This leave is provided to eligible employees in addition to standard leave entitlements.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Wellbeing Leave can only be taken as a full or half day, per leave application. A maximum of one day's Wellbeing Leave can be taken in each specified four month period, as follows:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1 July to 31 October</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1 November to 28 February (or 29 February in a leap year); and</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1 March to 30 June.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Wellbeing Leave is not accrued and does not carry over from one period to the next. Any Wellbeing Leave days not taken during a specified four month period will lapse.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees who commence employment anytime during a specified four month period will be eligible for Wellbeing Leave at the start of the next period.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Similarly, employees with excessive Annual Leave balances (30 days or more) at the time of application are not eligible, until they reduce their balance to below this threshold.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent and fixed-term salaried employees of Lendlease are eligible for wellbeing leave, subject to policy conditions.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Where employees are employed under the terms and conditions of an operative enterprise agreement with a Lendlease group company, please refer to the relevant enterprise agreement as to whether or not this policy applies to you.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Additionally, employees with excessive annual leave balances of 30 days or more are not eligible.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees who start part way through a specified four-month period (per the policy) will be eligible for Wellbeing Leave at the start of the next period.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; Existing employees are given priority consideration for all vacancies.</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The resourcing team will contact you regarding next steps, which could include a telephone interview or face to face interview. We guarantee to give you detailed feedback after face to face interviews.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 66.7812px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858; height: 66.7812px;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>FINALISE</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858; height: 66.7812px;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;If you are selected for a position a transition time will be worked out between your current manager and new manager. sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">At Lendlease we strive to create places where employees feel comfortable and supported to be themselves every day. Our First Nations Cultural Leave enables eligible employees to fulfill their cultural obligations.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This ceremonial leave is paid leave and can be granted for a maximum of 10 days per calendar year, pro-rated for part time employees. It is in addition to compassionate leave or emergency leave.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">National Aboriginal and Islander Day of Observance (NAIDOC) leave is paid leave of one day per calendar year that may be granted to a First Nations Australian employee to attend and participate in NAIDOC Week activities.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent, fixed term, full time and part time employees of Lendlease who identify as First Nations Australians are eligible. Employees who are employed under the terms and conditions of an operative enterprise agreement should refer to their agreement details for benefits that apply to them.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease recognises the need for employees to grieve and to support other members of their immediate family in the occurrence of a death, serious life-threatening illness or injury in the family.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent full-time, fixed-term contract full-time employees and part-time employees employed on local terms are eligible for compassionate leave.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Notify your manager as soon as you are aware you need to take compassionate leave.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Refer to the relevant Compassionate Leave Policy for your employment location.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Contact your manager if your circumstances change or your intended return to work date needs to be revised.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Upon your return to work, submit a compassionate leave request in Workday via the Absence worklet. sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease is a place for growth and progress, and we are always looking for great talent!&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As an employee you can be rewarded for referring quality talent to Lendlease. You might have a talented friend or family member who you think would enjoy working for us. Through our Employee Referral Program (ERP), Lendlease will award a financial incentive to eligible employees who have referred a successful candidate that has completed six months of employment.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Through this program we encourage eligible employees to refer individuals whom they believe align with our culture and values, and who would be a positive addition to our business. &nbsp;There is no limit to the number of candidate referrals you can submit, just make sure you have obtained the referred candidate's permission. &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent employees of Lendlease are eligible to participate in the Employee Referral Program if they are not:&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;- Involved in the hiring and selection process;&nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;- A People &amp; Culture professional; or&nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;- Part of the senior management team&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Refer to the relevant Employee Referral Policy for additional conditions.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I refer a candidate?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; You can use this benefit to obtain routine eye exams and eyewear. &nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Certain cosmetic or elective eyewear choices are not covered by this plan. &nbsp;An illness or injury to your eyes is covered by your medical plan.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">There are two vision plan options to choose from. For a comparison of the two options, please see the&nbsp;Vision Coverage Overview&nbsp;document located in the Resources tab.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1. Basic Plan</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2. Plus Plan</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Full -time salaried or hourly employee (non-union) regularly scheduled to work at least 30 hours per week. Salaried employees are eligible to participate in the Benefit Programs on their date of hire. Hourly employees are eligible to participate in the Benefits Programs the first day of the month following or coincident with completion of two months of continuous employment (at least 260 hours) from their most recent hire date (but no later than the 91<sup>st</sup> day after their most recent hire date).</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I enrol?</strong></span></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As a new hire, you have 31 days from your start date to elect healthcare benefits. New employees should go to the Benefits Center (<a href=\"http://www.Lendlease.hrintouch.com\">www.Lendlease.hrintouch.com</a>) to complete all benefit enrolments with the exception of the 401(k) plan. Per the Plan provisions, if you do not make an affirmative election to enrol in, or decline healthcare coverage (i.e., fail to enrol) within 31 days from your start date, you will be deemed to have elected to waive coverage under all Plans, except the Plan&rsquo;s default benefits.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When enrolling an eligible dependent, such as a spouse/domestic partner or child(ren), certain documentation will be required for verification, such as a birth certificate, marriage certificate.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you miss the 31-day election window, you will be able to enrol during the Open Enrolment period in November for benefits to be effective January 1 of the following year.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have a qualifying event, such as a marriage, divorce, birth of a child, loss of other coverage, etc. you will be able to change your benefit elections mid-year by going to the Benefits Center within 31 days following the life event.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I use the benefit?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once enrolled, you will not receive a vision identification card for this coverage.&nbsp;To verify your coverage. you will need to provide your provider with your Social Security Number and the Lendlease group number 12056767</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Out-of-pocket expenses are reduced when using a VSP-contracted provider, listed on the VSP online doctor search or through VSP customer service on 800 877 7195.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When you make your appointment, please identify yourself as a VSP member.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Who can I contact about the benefit?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can contact VSP customer service on 1-800-877-7195 or for general questions contact People Connect on 866-848-1200 and select option two (2) or ask People Connect online using the button on the top right hand corner of this page.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; background-color: #ffffff; sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #169179;\"><strong>Critical Incident Definition</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any event that had the potential to result in, or has resulted in, LARGE or VERY LARGE impacts (refer to the Impact Table below).</span></p>\r\n<table style=\"border-collapse: collapse; width: 83.8777%;\" border=\"1\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td style=\"width: 15.4977%; text-align: center;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Impact</span></strong></td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 42.8641%; text-align: center;\"><strong><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Health &amp; Safety </span></strong></td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 41.6205%; text-align: center;\"><strong><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Environmental </span></strong></td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td style=\"width: 15.4977%;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Very large </span></td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 42.8641%;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Fatality due to Injury or Occupational Illness</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Kidnapping of an employee</span></p>\r\n<span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Evacuation of employee&rsquo;s due to threat of fatality </span></td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 41.6205%;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Irreversible on-site and/or off-site damage; On-site and/or off-site damage with clean up or remedy work incurring a very large impact.</span></td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td style=\"width: 15.4977%;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Large </span></td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 42.8641%;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Injury or Occupational Illness that results in permanent disability </span></td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 41.6205%;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Treatable on-site and/or off-site damage with clean up or remedy work incurring a large impact. </span></td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A critical incident has the potential to overwhelm the usually effective coping skills of either an individual or group. Critical incidents typically cause a &lsquo;detrimental&rsquo; impact which can include:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">significant disruption;</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">increased levels of tension;</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">emotional responses, and</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">changes in performance.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Leaders can significantly assist recovery by providing the following supportive behaviours, called the three Rs approach: <strong>Recognise, Respond, Refer</strong>.</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Recognise</strong> signs of post-incident stress as normal reactions.</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Respond</strong> with a supportive approach and talking with all impacted employees.</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Refer </strong>the employee to further support or counselling, e.g. an Unmind Therapist, their family, or a GP.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #169179;\">For urgent critical incident support&nbsp;on Lendlease sites or assets please contact Assure or Unmind.</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Assure:</strong>&nbsp;1800 808 374 or&nbsp;<a href=\"mailto:info@assureprograms.com.au\">info@assureprograms.com.au</a>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Unmind:</strong>&nbsp;02 5604 6565</span></p>\r\n<p><em><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">**Initiating this process incurs a cost for the business unit, project, asset, operation, or site. Lendlease Management Services, through Lendlease Foundation, will arrange chargeback as contract owners with Unmind and Assure. </span></em></p>\r\n<table style=\"border-collapse: collapse; width: </span></td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td style=\"width: 17.3354%; text-align: center;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2</span></strong></td>\r\n<td determines clinically appropriate response and provides guidance to response co-ordinator </span></td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td style=\"width: 17.3354%; text-align: center;\"><strong><span either LOW RISK and Unmind access encouraged or;</span></p>\r\n<span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees identified at HIGH RISK and Scheduled follow-up with Assure/Unmind Psychologist 24 to 48 hours after initial contact with feedback provided to Lendlease response co-ordinator Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Approved long term disability (LTD) benefits begins after the expiration of 26 weeks of short term disability leave. The LTD benefit pays 60 per cent of your base pay, to a maximum of $21,500 per month as long as an approved disability exists, up to retirement age, as defined in the long term disability plans.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility criteria?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All full-time, salaried employees who are scheduled to work 30 or more hours per week and are approved for the maximum period of short term disability.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Includes international assignees on US payroll working outside the country for up to three years.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What steps do I need to take?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review the eligibility requirements.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Read through the Long Term Disability Policy and relevant salaried and international assignee resources.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You must choose a LTD benefit payment plan within 31 days of hire or rehire. You may switch LTD payment plan options during Lendlease's annual open enrollment period in the Fall, effective January 1.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are enrolled in the LTD contributory option, and are approved for LTD benefits, your benefits from the insurance carrier will be tax free.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Approximately 60 days prior to the expiration of short term disability benefits, The Hartford, our insurance carrier; will be in touch with you and the doctor regarding the possibility of transitioning into LTD.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The LTD claim must be approved before any benefits are issued by The Hartford.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<div>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease aims to attract, retain and motivate top talent by offering competitive and equitable remuneration, with a strong emphasis on pay-for-performance to align employee contributions with company success. Additionally, Lendlease places significant importance on transparency and fairness in its pay practices, ensuring employees understand how their remuneration is determined. The Company considers various factors when determining remuneration, including the skills and experience required for the role, market benchmarks, internal parity and company performance. Remuneration programs are regularly reviewed to ensure they remain competitive and aligned with the company&rsquo;s overall strategic direction.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Our pay philosophy is a key component of our Employee Value Proposition, which also encompasses Group and employee performance-based bonus incentives, equity, non-statutory or additional benefits, development and learning opportunities, additional leave, as well as health and welfare benefits.</span></p>\r\n</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">There are two key parts to how we pay our people:</span></p>\r\n</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; color: #008080; text-decoration: underline;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Merit - Fixed (base) Pay</span></strong></span></span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">We pay Merit fairly and within a pay range that is determined with reference to the external market. Some will be paid below the average and some will be paid above. We would expect most, but not all people, to be paid within the pay range.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\"><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">Bonus - Variable Pay</span>&nbsp;</span></strong></span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Some people may be eligible for a Bonus . Bonuses are used to reward our best performers. Bonus recommendations are determined by People Managers who consider performance against agreed goals, assess how an individual has achieved their goals and observe how they have demonstrated behaviours that show a commitment to the <a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/sites/Pulse/SitePages/Our-Purpose-and-Values.aspx#our-values\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\">Lendlease values</a>. Bonus terms and participation are subject to change from time to time and are determined by the Company. The Company can vary the terms and amount of a bonus, depending upon individual and Company performance. &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">Note</span>: To be eligible for a bonus you must be employed by Lendlease at the Bonus payment date and not under notice of termination. If you are under notice of termination (e.g. you have given notice of resignation or the Company has given you notice that your employment will terminate) or your employment has ended prior to the date a bonus is paid, or deferred securities are granted, you will not be eligible for the bonus or grant of deferred securities.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For details on Year End Compensation Review click <a Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Federal law requires that non-exempt employees be compensated at the rate of time and one half of their regular pay for any hours worked during a week after 40 hours. The Company will comply with this standard, as well as any additional requirements imposed by state law.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All Lendlease AMER Employees that are classified as non exempt.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All overtime must be approved, in advance, by the employee&rsquo;s immediate supervisor. Employees may NOT waive their right to receive overtime. Payment of overtime may not be denied simply because overtime hours have not been approved. However, if an employee consistently works overtime and does not obtain the manager&rsquo;s advanced approval it will be deemed a performance issue and subject to disciplinary action.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The following time must be counted as hours worked when computing overtime</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Compensable attendance at orientation, training</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In-office conference calls</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Hours worked inside and outside of the office, including work done at home</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Compensation for Travel Time for Non-Exempt Employees</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Certain time spent by the employee in travel must be counted as hours worked.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Commuting back and forth to work is not considered hours worked.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Where an employee is asked to travel to a client site or another Company office other than his or her regular work site, only that part of the travel that exceeds the employee's regular commuting time to work will be compensated.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee's travel from one client site to another during the regular workday is compensable work time.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an employee travels out of town during a regular workday, he or she will be compensated for all hours travelling and working, except for his or her regular commuting time to and from work.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Overnight travel out of town, where the travel occurs outside of the employee's regularly scheduled working hours, and where the employee is a passenger on an airplane, boat, train or bus, is not counted as hours worked (unless the employee performs work while travelling). If the employee is required to drive to the out of town location or travel as a passenger in another employee's vehicle, however, he or she will be paid for the travel time.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an employee is required to travel on a day that is not a regular work day, he or she will be paid for all hours he or she spends travelling during his or her regular work hours.</span></p>","sys_created_by":"hinw325","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Lendlease UK Pension Scheme is a core benefit provided by Lendlease.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease contributes to your Personal Investment (PI) Account to help you prepare for the best possible financial future. The Scheme operates with an employer and an employee contribution towards your pension fund for each year you are a member. Your contributions and Lendlease's contributions are paid into your PI Account.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You are eligible to join the personal investment (PI) section at the time of joining Lendlease or at annual benefit renewal each March.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What is included in the benefit?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease will pay 10% of your base salary to your PI Account if you pay 5% (or more).</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you choose to pay a lower contribution, Lendlease will \"double-match' this.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=56c30096479166102d72c701e36d43fc\" alt=\"uk pension contribution flexibility\" width=\"310px\" height=\"301px\"></span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can pay a higher contribution to the Scheme (called an Additional Voluntary Contribution) by selecting this through Preference. &nbsp;Lendlease's maximum contribution to your PI Account is 10%.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can change your contribution level at any time through Preference. &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease also pay 4% of your base salary to fund Scheme administration and core life assurance. &nbsp;This is shown on your payslip for information but is not invested in your PI Account.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As a member of the Lendlease UK Pension Scheme you can benefit from:&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull;&nbsp;Tax relief at your highest marginal rate on your contributions up to HMRC allowances&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull;&nbsp;No National Insurance on your contributions.&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull;&nbsp;The option to choose your own personal contributions.&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull;&nbsp;A range of investment choices to meet your needs.&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull;&nbsp;Take up to 25% of your pension as a tax free lump sum at retirement. &nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull;&nbsp;Your own pension account (ePA) where you can view and manage your account online.&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull;&nbsp;Annual online benefit statements on the performance of your account and potential income at retirement.&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull;&nbsp;Access to modellers and tools to help you plan for your future.&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull;&nbsp;Helpdesk support from our pension scheme administrators, Willis Towers Watson&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Option to transfer your pension when you leave Lendlease to another registered pension arrangement or continue to be invested in the Lendlease UK Pension Scheme.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What happens once I have opted into the Lendlease UK Pension Scheme?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once you have made your selection to opt into the Lendlease UK Pension Scheme (by making your selection in Preference and by completing and sending your Pension Application Form to Willis Towers Watson), your contributions to the Scheme will be deducted from your pay from the following month. Willis Towers Watson will confirm receipt of your application and provide you with details about accessing Scheme information through our pension portal, ePA.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span style=\"color: #000000; text-decoration: underline;\">ePA (Pensions Account)</span></span><br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ePA is our pension portal managed by Willis Towers Watson where you can:</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Check the value of your pensions saving</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Choose your investment funds of your Personal Investment Account</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Check and change your Target Retirement Age</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Nominate your beneficiaries for death benefit</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Check investment fund past performance&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ePA can be accessed via &nbsp;the Resources tab &nbsp;below</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Who can I contact regarding the benefit?</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Members can contact the administrators of the scheme, Willis Towers Watson, via e-mail on&nbsp;<a href=\"mailto:lendleasepensions@willistowerswatson.com\" rel=\"nofollow\">lendleasepensions@willistowerswatson.com</a>&nbsp;or call 0173 727 3119</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an employee receives taxable fringe benefits (other than those specifically excluded) in excess of AUD$2,000 in the period 1 April - 31 March (FBT year), the amount must be recorded on their payment summary for the corresponding income year.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The amount shown on the payment summary (group certificate) will be the &lsquo;grossed up&rsquo; figure, which is the benefit plus taxes paid by Lendlease.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What do reportable fringe benefits mean for me?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Although RFB appear on a payment summary, they are not part of the taxpayer&rsquo;s taxable income, and are therefore not subject to income tax.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The amount of RFB received by an individual is relevant for determining and may influence such things as:</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Medicare levy surcharge</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Mature age worker tax offset</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Repayment of higher education loan program (HELP) debt&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Eligibility of the government super co-contribution&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Child support assessments&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Family tax benefits, child care benefits or youth allowance</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What are examples of reportable fringe benefits?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Taxable benefits forming part of your total remuneration, e.g. company cars used for personal use</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Benefits provided to your family, e.g. recreational functions&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Lendlease child care rebate</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Attendance at recreational events, e.g. golf days, sailing days&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Private expenses reimbursed, e.g. holidays&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Private travel paid by Lendlease or travel when you do not complete a travel diary, where a travel diary is required</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Gifts you receive valued at $300 or more, e.g. wedding, farewell presents, Incident &amp; Injury Free and Employee Excellence Awards&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Education assistance&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What is excluded from being on your payment summary?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Reportable Fringe Benefits of AUD$2,000 or less</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Meal entertainment (such as business lunches paid for by Lendlease)</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Car parking fringe benefits (but not payment reimbursements made via iExpenses)&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Corporate boxes&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Items used primarily for work, i.e. notebook and laptop computers (one per Fringe Benefits Taxation year), briefcase and work-related software</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Where do I go for more information?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Visit the Australian Taxation Office website to read more, or contact an independent advisor to determine how you will be impacted.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You may like to contact your payroll team to get a breakdown of your reportable fringe benefit amount.&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"NULL\" rel=\"nofollow\"><br></a> All other Lendlease Companies:&nbsp;<a href=\"NULL\" rel=\"nofollow\">PayteamAU@lendlease.com</a></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To establish equity and consistency across the Lendlease Americas Region and provide a unified, market driven approach to automobile and commuting allowances across all businesses.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Only those employees meeting the criteria outlined in the policy below are eligible for an Auto Allowance or a Commuting Allowance. Office employees are not eligible for commuting allowances.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Auto Allowance<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Paid to employees who regularly use their personal vehicle on company business.* Regularly is defined as three (3) or more days per week for a period of more than 90 days. All Allowances are gross, taxable income and will be paid bi-weekly on the normal paycheck cycle, effective the first full pay-period on the project. If an employee transfers to a project in the middle of a pay-period, it will not be paid until the next full pay-period. The below eligibility requirements must be met and approved by the Managing Director in order to receive an Auto Allowance.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Business Travel<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1. Required to regularly drive personal vehicle more than 20 miles per day between job site locations or on other regular business activities.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2. Required to regularly drive personal vehicle on broad acre development projects (i.e. MHPI).</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Gross Auto Allowance Rates<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Based upon amount of travel and level of role:</span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto; border-collapse: collapse; margin-left: 30.0pt; border: 1.5pt solid #DDDDDD;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; font-size: 12pt;\">$9,800</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">$376.92</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">$7,500</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">$288.46</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">$5,000</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">$192.31&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Commuting Allowance<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A commuting allowance may be paid to an employee based upon the below eligibility requirements and must be approved by the Managing Director.* All Allowances are gross, taxable income and will be paid bi-weekly on the normal paycheck cycle, effective the first full pay-period on the project. If an employee transfers to a project in the middle of a pay-period, it will not be paid until the next full pay-period.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1. Employees travelling more than 50 miles one way from home to their project site, or incurring additional, significant tolls or mass transit expense (outside of their normal commuting expense) as a result of a change in project location.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2. Allowance based upon &ldquo;additional&rdquo; mileage incurred as a result of new project location. &ldquo;Additional mileage&rdquo; is defined as the calculated number of miles driven&nbsp;in excess of 50 miles one way&nbsp;from home to the project site. Allowance amount will be based upon the current IRS rate per mile or transit expense incurred. For example, if an employee travels 80 miles one way from home to his or her project site, only the incremental 30 miles would be reimbursable each way.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees receiving a Commuting Allowance will not generally be eligible to receive an Auto Allowance. Commuting allowances are determined on an individual, case by case basis, and will be subject to periodic review. Employees located in an office will not be eligible for a commuting allowance.</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Mileage<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees receiving the Auto Allowance will generally not be eligible for mileage reimbursement. Business trips of 150 miles or more one way will be reimbursed. Business trips under 150 miles one way will not be reimbursed.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">* Lendlease prohibits billing to clients, and reimbursement by clients, of costs greater than this policy provides to employees.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease reserves the right to change or discontinue this policy at any time.</span><br /><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>General Rules</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1. Officers or non officers that were grandfathered at their current allowance rate will not be subject to further increases in their allowance rate, unless they become eligible under the current policy based upon eligibility rules.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2. No additional officers to receive allowance unless they meet eligibility under the new policy.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">3. As employees transition to new job sites/roles, the allowance provided will be reviewed for need and equity.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Mileage Reimbursement<br /></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1. Employees receiving the Auto Allowance will not generally be eligible for mileage reimbursement. Business trips of 150 miles or more one way will be reimbursed. Business trips under 150 miles one way will not be reimbursed.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2. If the employee would like to waive their right to the allowance, they will be eligible for mileage reimbursement for business mileage; however they will not thereafter be eligible to receive an allowance without the approval of the Lendlease Americas Director of Operations.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Client Reimbursement<br /></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1. Lendlease may not be reimbursed by clients for more than this policy provides to employees.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Access more information on the processes and procedures for&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018724\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"auto and commuting allowance\">auto and commuting allowance</a>.</span></p>","sys_created_by":"hinw325","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Policy","u_problem_type":null,"topic":"General","display_number":"KB0018958 v6.0","base_version":{"display_value":"KB0018958 v5.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge/252b4b97db86cad0ee773313e2961922"},"short_description":"Personal (Sick) and Carer's Leave Policy - Australia","u_last_review_date":"2025-05-06","x_caukp_ebonding_provider_id":"","roles":"","direct":"false","description":"","disable_suggesting":"false","sn_grc_target_table":"","sys_class_name":"Knowledge","article_id":"f08da9b41b37a4106d4e986cbc4bcb45","sys_id":"0ef01c1e471566102d72c701e36d4313","use_count":"0","flagged":"false","disable_commenting":"false","valid_to":"2026-05-06","retired":"","u_add_to_homepage":"false","u_video_url":"","display_attachments":"false","latest":"true","summary":{"display_value":"KB0018958","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_summary/4864d95e1bbf6010ef4543b4bd4bcb68"},"sys_view_count":"29","revised_by":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"5","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"AUST","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/8f58f34f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcb41"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2024-12-19 07:59:40","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018820","sys_updated_by":"kohj323","sys_created_on":"2024-12-19 07:55:49","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE&nbsp;</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease recognizes and encourages the importance of bonding and nurturing, developing relationships and adapting to new environments. To create a workplace that is best for all, the company seeks to provide the support and flexibility that employees may need as they balance their commitments both inside and outside work. Therefore, if eligible, Lendlease provides Parental Leave for the primary parent pursuant to the terms and conditions set forth in this policy.&nbsp; To the extent there is a conflict between this policy and any applicable law on the subject, the applicable law shall control.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Parental Leave benefit provides paid leave for scheduled hours during the work week, for up to twelve weeks and an additional unpaid leave period of up to eight weeks for the following life events:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\" type=\"disc\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Birth of your child;</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Adoption placement (up to age 18); or</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Foster care placement (up to age 18).</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For the purpose of this policy, a \"primary parent\" is defined as someone who has primary or full-time responsibility for the care of the child immediately following the birth or the arrival date of his or her child into the parent's home.&nbsp; There may be only one primary parent per household.&nbsp; If the employee is not the sole primary parent, they may be considered for Lendlease&rsquo;s Partner Leave.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE&nbsp;&nbsp;</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This policy applies to all active full-time salaried, benefits eligible employees, scheduled to work 30 hours or more per week.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Eligible employees may take&nbsp;Parental Primary Leave for up to 20 calendar weeks, of which the first 12-weeks are paid, provided the following conditions are met:</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1. The employee seeking leave is the full-time primary caregiver parent during the period of the leave.&nbsp; There may only be one primary parent per household.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2. The Parental Primary Leave must be taken within 12 weeks of the life event (i.e., the birth or placement of the child). To the extent permitted by applicable law, the unpaid portion of the Parental Primary Leave (up to 8 weeks) must be taken immediately following the paid 12-week portion.</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\" type=\"disc\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an FMLA-eligible employee elects to take the remainder of any unpaid Parental Primary Leave as FMLA, such leave must be taken within 12months of the life event.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">3. The Parental Leave runs concurrently with short-term disability (STD) leave, when applicable.</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\" type=\"disc\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The short-term disability 7-calendar day elimination period is paid with approved Parental Leave. Use of PTO is not&nbsp;required during the elimination period, so long as the employee is not rendered medically disabled prior to the delivery date and placed on STD leave early. If the employee&rsquo;s doctor certifies them as disabled and the STD leave begins(and receipt of STD benefits) prior to the delivery date, e.g., bedrest, then the employee will be required to use accrued PTO, if available, during the elimination period.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Eligible employees must apply for Parental Leave&nbsp;<strong><u>after&nbsp;</u></strong>the life event has occurred (i.e., birth or placement&nbsp;of child) by:&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1. Completing the Parental Leave Request Affirmation Form.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2. Signing, dating and submitting the form to The Hartford for leave approval.</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\" type=\"disc\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If approved, Lendlease will receive notification of the approval.</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Approved Parental Leave time entry will be submitted on the employee&rsquo;s behalf; employees and/or managers will not be responsible for time entry.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any Parental Primary Leave taken under this policy will run concurrently with any short-term disability leave, FMLA&nbsp;leave, and any&nbsp;other state or local family and/or medical leave to which the employee is entitled, where applicable and permissible under law.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">There may be only one&nbsp;<strong>primary&nbsp;</strong>parent per household.&nbsp; For birth of a child, this is typically the birth parent, unless they are deemed mentally or physically unable to care for the child. For adoption or foster care placement, this would be the parent taking on the primary caregiver role.&nbsp; &nbsp;If the spouse/domestic partner also works for Lendlease they have the ability to share the 12-calendar week paid portion of the Parental Primary Leave. If this circumstance applies, the employee must inform The Hartford at the time they file their Parental Primary Leave.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Parental Leave Benefit will be 100% of the employee&rsquo;s weekly salary.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>If the employee is giving birth to the child, they must also apply for short-term disability benefits and&nbsp;leave.</strong>&nbsp;As set forth above, Parental Primary Leave will run concurrently with any short-term disability leave, FMLA leave, and any other state or local family and/or medical leave to which the employee is entitled, where applicable. Below are the steps to initiate the short-term disability process and the paid portion of the Parental Primary Leave.</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"list-style: none; font-size: 12pt;\">\r\n<ol style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Within 30 days of the due date, contact The Hartford at 888.301.5615 to initiate the short-term disability leave or visit The Hartford's web portal at&nbsp;<a href=\"http://www.abilityadvantage.thehartford.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">www.abilityadvantage.thehartford.com</a></span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Within 30 days of the due date, the employee must notify their manager of their need for leave and estimated dates they plan to be on leave.</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once the delivery has occurred, the employee must complete and submit a Lendlease Parental Primary Leave Request Affirmation Form to The Hartford confirming they are the primary parent.</span></li>\r\n</ol>\r\n</li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\" type=\"disc\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the employee&rsquo;s employment service is less than 5 years, the disability benefit payment is paid at 60% of their weekly salary; however, the approved Parental Primary&nbsp;Leave will supplement the disability benefit pay for a total payment of 100% of their salary.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In addition to the paid 12-calendar week Parental Primary Leave, employees may request additional&nbsp;unpaid&nbsp;leave, for up to 8 weeks, for a total of 20 weeks Parental Primary Leave. The additional 8-week unpaid leave time is subject to The Hartford approval. Follow the steps below to apply:</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1. Employee contacts The Hartford at 888.301.5615 or visits The Hartford's web portal at&nbsp;<a href=\"http://www.abilityadvantage.thehartford.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">www.abilityadvantage.thehartford.com</a></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2. Employee completes and submits a Lendlease Parental Primary Leave Request Affirmation Form to The Hartford, confirming they are the primary parent.</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\" type=\"disc\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease will receive notification of an approval, or denial, from The Hartford.</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">No time entry is applicable during the unpaid 8-week Parental Leave period.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">During a 20-week Parental Primary Leave period, the employee shall continue to be eligible for benefits and their position with Lendlease will be protected. For the portion of the Parental Primary Leave that is unpaid and no paycheck is received, the employee will be responsible for submitting payment of their bi-weekly insurance premiums to Lendlease, so that there is not an interruption of healthcare benefits. Lendlease will send the employee a premium insurance statement in order to keep their insurance premiums up to date.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">*This minimum service requirement does not supersede the terms of the short-term disability benefit program, which provides that an employee may be eligible for coverage beginning on the first day of employment, provided the employee meets the eligibility and other requirements for short-term disability leave and benefits payments</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees are required to give Lendlease at least 30 days' advance notice of the need for leave when possible and practical to do so. When the need for leave is not foreseeable (e.g., last minute placement of a child or in the event of any emergency), the employee is required to give notice as soon as it is possible and practical to do so (following Lendlease's usual procedures).</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any questions about this leave should be directed to People Connect at 866-848-1200, option 2.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Access&nbsp;more information on the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018996\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" title=\"processes and procedures for Parental and Partner leave\">processes and procedures for Parental and Partner Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease supports employees in planning for their future by making mandatory savings plan contributions for eligible employees in Singapore and Malaysia.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080; text-decoration: underline;\"><strong>Malaysia</strong></span></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Employee Provident Fund (EPF)<br></strong> The EPF is Malaysia&rsquo;s social security savings plan aimed at providing citizens security in their retirement age. All working Malaysians and their employers are required to make monthly contributions to the EPF.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong> Retirement and Re-Employment<br></strong> Lendlease recognises the need to retain certain exceptional, highly skilled and productive employees beyond the statutory age of retirement. Accordingly, upon attaining the statutory retirement age, the employee may be offered a fixed-term contract of employment after their statutory retirement age for a period of up to two years or any deemed necessary by Lendlease.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Refer to the Retirement &amp; Re-Employment Policy&nbsp;for further details.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080; text-decoration: underline;\"><strong>Singapore</strong></span></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Central Provident Fund (CPF)<br></strong> The CPF is Singapore&rsquo;s social security savings plan aimed at providing citizens security in their retirement age. All working Singapore citizens, Singapore Permanent Residents and their employers are required to make monthly contributions to the CPF.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Retirement and Re-Employment<br></strong> Lendlease recognises the need to retain certain exceptional, highly skilled and productive employees beyond the statutory minimum retirement age. Accordingly, upon attaining the statutory minimum retirement age, the employee may be offered a fixed-term contract of employment after their statutory minimum retirement age for a period of at least one year or any deemed necessary by Lendlease.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Refer to the Retirement &amp; Re-Employment Policy for further details.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Unless your written conditions of employment state otherwise, the notice periods are:</span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto; border-collapse: collapse; border: 1.5pt
