LETTER</strong></span></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">There are two ways you can access the Reference Letter task within Workday.</span></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt; margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1. The simplest is to search for &ldquo;Request Reference Letter&rdquo; in the top search bar and select the task from the dropdown menu</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt; margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt; margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt; margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt; margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Bullet\" style=\"margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can also navigate to the task from the actions button under your profile.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Click on your photo in the top right-hand corner of the screen and select view profile. </span><br /><br /><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Then click Actions &gt; Worker Request &gt; Request Reference Letter.</span><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt; margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt; margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt; margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Both of the above navigation paths will take you to the Request Reference Letter screen</span></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 255.15pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\">\r\n<p align=\"center\"><br /></p>\r\n<p align=\"center\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In the Request Reference Letter screen, you will need to select which type of letter you require.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Click into the box next to Reference Letter to view the options</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1. If you are generating the letter for yourself, you will select &ldquo;Reference Letters for Current Employee&rdquo;.</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2. If you are a manager and have received a request from a former employee, please select &ldquo;Reference Letters for Former Employee&rdquo;.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">You will then be asked to confirm if you require the letter to include base pay information or not</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Once you have made your selection click submit at the bottom of the screen.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 255.15pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; LETTER</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">The reference letter will be generated and available in your inbox</span></p>\r\n<p><span font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">click the inbox tray icon in the top right-hand corner of the screen</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">The generated document will appear in your email actions folder.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can click the hyperlink to view and save the letter</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Tick to confirm the letter is as per requirements and click Submit.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A copy of the letter will be placed in your Worker&rsquo;s Profile &gt; Personal &gt; Documents tab and remain on your profile</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 255.15pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\">\r\n<p><span Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A contingent worker is an individual who is not a permanent employee and can only be engaged through one of the following two methods:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Private Limited Company</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Recruitment Agency</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease does not engage directly with sole traders.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Her Majesty's Revenue &amp; Customs (HMRC) regularly conduct audits in relation to employment status. If an individual has been treated as self-employed, but the paperwork does not support this, or if it fails to reflect the reality of the relationship, they will challenge the employment status of the individual. This could have financial implications for Lendlease.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are in doubt around a contract hire or have any questions, please contact&nbsp;<a href=\"mailto:contingentresourcing@lendlease.com\">Europe Contingent Resourcing</a>. In the event of uncertainty, individuals should not be paid, until advice has been sought.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; border-right: 1.5pt solid #FFFFFF; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=24f628e11b2ad650727c0e12604bcb62\" alt=\"System\" width=\"48px\" height=\"45px\">&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; border-right: 1.5pt solid #FFFFFF; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://wd3.myworkday.com/lendlease/d/home.htmld\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" title=\"Workday\">Workday</a>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; border-right: 1.5pt solid #FFFFFF; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;<img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=e0f628e11b2ad650727c0e12604bcb65\" alt=\"Process or Procedure\" width=\"47px\" height=\"64px\"></span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; border-right: 1.5pt solid #FFFFFF; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Quick%20Guide_Contingent%20Workers.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=hoZ2hW\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" title=\"Contingent Worker Guidance\">Contingent Worker Guidance</a>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>","sys_created_by":"wonl340","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"x_caukp_ebonding_integration_mode":null,"can_read_user_criteria":"","active":"true","cannot_read_user_criteria":"","published":"2024-12-18","helpful_count":"0","sys_domain_path":"/","u_view_count_all":"164","version":{"display_value":"6.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_version/6cc7ac2d97a21a5072b954800153af81"},"x_caukp_ebonding_requester_id":"","meta_description":"A contingent worker is an individual who is not a permanent employee and can only be engaged through","kb_knowledge_base":{"display_value":"People Connect Knowledge Base","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_base/01125e5a1b9b685017eeebd22a4bcb44"},"meta":"Contingent Worker (Europe Only)","u_problem_type":null,"topic":"General","display_number":"KB0018969 v6.0","base_version":{"display_value":"KB0018969 v5.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge/dfc2319d1b37f5d04d4c0fa2cd4bcba4"},"short_description":"Contingent Worker - Europe ","u_last_review_date":"2024-12-18","x_caukp_ebonding_provider_id":"","roles":"","direct":"false","description":"","disable_suggesting":"false","sn_grc_target_table":"","sys_class_name":"Knowledge","article_id":"761447f41bbfa4106d4e986cbc4bcbf2","sys_id":"24f6e4e11b2ad650727c0e12604bcb1c","use_count":"0","flagged":"false","disable_commenting":"false","valid_to":"2025-12-18","retired":"","u_add_to_homepage":"false","u_video_url":"","display_attachments":"false","latest":"true","summary":{"display_value":"KB0018969","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_summary/4054555e1bbf6010ef4543b4bd4bcb92"},"sys_view_count":"1","revised_by":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"6","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"EUR","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/e148f34f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcb0f"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2024-02-29 00:07:52","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018807","sys_updated_by":"raiv416","sys_created_on":"2021-05-05 21:51:17","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company is an equal opportunity employer. It is the policy of the Company to prohibit discrimination of any type and to afford equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, age, disability, health status, military or veteran status, political affiliation and/or any other categories protected by applicable federal, state or local law.&nbsp; The Company will conform with the spirit as well as the letter of all applicable laws and regulations.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All Lendlease US Employees</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Equal Employment Opportunity &amp; Non-Discrimination Policy</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The policy of equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination applies to all aspects of the relationship between the Company and its employees, including but not limited to:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Recruitment</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employment</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Promotion</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Transfer</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Training</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Working conditions</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Wages and salary administration</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Employee benefits and application of policies</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The policies and principles of equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination also apply to the selection and treatment of independent contractors, personnel working on our premises whom are employed by temporary agencies and any other persons or firms doing business for or with the Company.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Dissemination and Implementation of Policy<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The officers of the Company will be responsible for the dissemination of this policy.&nbsp; Directors, managers and supervisors are responsible for implementing equal employment practices within each department.&nbsp; The People &amp; Culture Department is responsible for the Company&rsquo;s overall compliance and shall maintain personnel records in compliance with applicable laws and regulations.</span><br /><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Procedures<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Company practices that support this policy include the following:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company displays posters regarding equal employment opportunity in areas highly visible to employees.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All advertising for job applicants includes the statement &ldquo;An Equal Opportunity Employer.&rdquo;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company forbids retaliation against any individual who files a charge of discrimination, reports harassment, or who assists, testifies or participates in an equal employment proceeding.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees are required to report to a member of management, People &amp; Culture representative, or the General Counsel any apparent discrimination or harassment.&nbsp; Reports should be made within 48 hours of the incident(s).</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Harassment</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Harassment is defined by Federal, State and (where applicable) local law. Harassment is a form of unlawful discrimination and violates this policy.&nbsp; The Company&rsquo;s prohibition against harassment and the related reporting mechanism is set forth in its Harassment-Free Workplace Policy and Complaint Procedure.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Harassment is against the law.&nbsp; All employees have a legal right to a workplace free from harassment, including sexual harassment, and employees can enforce this right by filing a complaint internally with the Company, or with a government agency or in court under federal, state or local anti-discrimination laws.&nbsp; The Harassment-Free Workplace Policy applies to all employees, applicants for employment, interns, contractors and persons conducting business with the Company.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Remedy for Violation of Policy<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Violations of the Company&rsquo;s Harassment-Free Workplace Policy, regardless of whether or not an actual law has been violated, will not be tolerated. The Company will investigate every issue that is brought to its attention in this area and will take appropriate disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment for employees who are found in violation of this policy.&nbsp; Further remedies may be available by other agencies.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Harassment-Free Workplace Policy &amp; Compliant Procedure<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Policy Statement</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company is committed to providing its employees with a work environment free of unlawful harassment.&nbsp; In keeping with this commitment, the Company expressly prohibits harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, political affiliation and/or any other categories protected by applicable federal, state or local law.&nbsp; Unreasonable interference with an individual&rsquo;s work performance or creation of a hostile, intimidating or offensive working environment will not be tolerated.&nbsp; All Company employees must act responsibly to help establish a comfortable working environment free from harassment.&nbsp; The Company strongly disapproves of and will not tolerate harassment of employees by other employees, managers, supervisors or co-workers, clients or vendors.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This policy prohibits unlawful harassment in any form, including verbal, physical, or visual harassment.&nbsp; This policy applies to all conduct between Company employees, including but not limited to, conduct during company events, including after-hours meetings, gatherings and celebrations with employees, clients, vendors, etc.&nbsp; This policy applies to employees at all levels and positions within the Company.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Sexual Harassment</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Generally, sexual harassment is unwelcome behavior that may or may not include sexual conduct. Both males and females may be victims of sexual harassment by persons of the same or opposite gender.&nbsp; In particular, sexual harassment includes unwelcome sexual advances or propositions, sexual flirtations, leering, verbal abuse of a sexual nature, subtle pressure or requests for sexual favors or acts, unwanted touching or intimacy, insulting or degrading sexual remarks or conduct, epithets, derogatory remarks or negative stereotyping based on gender, sexually explicit or offensive jokes, and the posting or display in the workplace of sexually offensive or degrading materials, electronic or otherwise.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Federal, state and (where applicable) local laws define sexual harassment as unwelcome sexual advances, requests for sexual favors, and other visual, verbal or physical contact of sexual nature when:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">submission to such conduct is made either explicitly or implicitly a term or condition of employment; or</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">submission to or rejection of such conduct by an individual is used as the basis for employment decisions affecting such individual; or</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">such conduct has the purpose or effect of unreasonably interfering with an employee&rsquo;s work performance or creating an intimidating, hostile or offensive working environment.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The following are some examples of conduct which, if unwelcome, may constitute sexual harassment depending upon the totality of the circumstances, including the severity of the conduct and its pervasiveness:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Sexual advances &ndash; whether they involve physical touching or not;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Direct or implied requests by a supervisor for sexual favors in exchange for actual or promised job benefits such as favorable reviews, wage/salary increases, promotions, increased benefits, or continued employment;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Sexual epithets, jokes, written or oral references to sexual conduct, gossip regarding one&rsquo;s sex life, comments on an individual&rsquo;s body, comments about an individual&rsquo;s sexual activity, deficiencies, or prowess;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Displaying sexually suggestive objects, pictures, cartoons;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Unwelcome leering, whistling, brushing against the body, sexual gestures, suggestive or insulting comments;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Inquiries into one&rsquo;s sexual experience; and/or</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Discussion of one&rsquo;s sexual activities.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Protected-Class Harassment</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In addition, federal, state and (where applicable) local laws prohibit any form of harassment that impairs an employee&rsquo;s working ability or creates an intimidating, hostile or offensive work environment, and is based on or taken because of the employee&rsquo;s race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, political affiliation and/or any other class protected by applicable federal, state or local law.&nbsp; Such offensive behavior may take a variety of forms, including, but not limited to:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Epithets, derogatory comments, jokes or slurs;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Derogatory or offensive posters, cards, objects, symbols, calendars, cartoons, graffiti, drawings, online postings or gestures;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Assaults, blocking normal movement or interfering with work; and/or</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Retaliation for having reported or threatened to report harassment.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Who can be a target of sexual harassment?</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Sexual harassment can occur between any individuals, regardless of their sex or gender.&nbsp; The law protects employees, paid or unpaid interns, and non-employees, including independent contractors, and those employed by companies contracting to provide services in the workplace.&nbsp; A perpetrator of sexual harassment can be a superior, a subordinate, a coworker or anyone in the workplace including an independent contractor, contract worker, vendor, client, customer or visitor.</span></p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Where can sexual harassment occur?</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Unlawful sexual harassment is not limited to the physical workplace itself.&nbsp; It can occur while employees are traveling for business or at employer sponsored events or parties.&nbsp; Calls, texts, emails, and social media usage by employees can constitute unlawful workplace harassment, even if they occur away from the workplace premises or not during work hours.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any form of unlawful harassment creates an unprofessional and unacceptable atmosphere.&nbsp; Regardless of its form, harassment of employees occurring in the workplace or in other settings in which employees perform their work is unlawful and will not be tolerated by the Company.&nbsp; The Company will take reasonable steps to prevent harassing conduct by supervisory and non-supervisory employees, coworkers, clients, and vendors.&nbsp; Further, any retaliation against an individual who, in good faith, has complained about workplace discrimination, retaliation or harassment, or who has cooperated with the Company&rsquo;s investigation of such matters, is similarly unlawful and will not be tolerated.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In addition, the Company strictly prohibits its managers, supervisors and other employees from implying or suggesting that an applicant&rsquo;s or employee&rsquo;s submission to or refusal to submit to sexual advances or participation in such conduct is a condition of continued employment or receipt of any job benefit (including job assignment, compensation advancement, career development, or any other term or condition of employment).&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">What is &ldquo;Retaliation&rdquo;?</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Unlawful retaliation can be any action that would keep a worker from coming forward to make or support a harassment claim. Adverse action need not be job-related or occur in the workplace to constitute unlawful retaliation.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Such retaliation is unlawful under federal, state, and (where applicable) local law. The law protects any individual who has engaged in &ldquo;protected activity.&rdquo;&nbsp; Protected activity occurs when a person has:</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">filed a complaint of harassment, either internally or with any anti-discrimination agency;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">testified or assisted in a proceeding involving harassment under an applicable human rights and/or fair employment law or other anti-discrimination law;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">opposed harassment by making a verbal or informal complaint to management, or by simply informing a supervisor or manager of harassment;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">complained that another employee has been harassed; or</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">encouraged a fellow employee to report harassment.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Reporting Procedures</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company's reporting procedures (the &ldquo;Company&rsquo;s Reporting Procedures&rdquo;) provide for a thorough and objective investigation of any harassment claim, appropriate disciplinary action against an individual or individuals found to have engaged in prohibited harassment, and appropriate remedies to any employee who has been a victim of harassment.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company requires immediate reporting of all perceived incidents of harassment.&nbsp; If you believe that you are being harassed, or if you believe that your employment is being affected by such conduct directed at someone else, you should discuss your concerns with your immediate supervisor or a People &amp; Culture Strategic Business Partner.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Additionally, employees may contact the Company&rsquo;s Harassment Hotline at 1-866-513-2097.&nbsp; Should employees know of an incident of harassment, they are expected to immediately utilize the available options outlined above for communicating such incidents.&nbsp; The report should include details of the incident(s), the names of individuals involved, the names of any witnesses, direct quotes when relevant, and any documentary evidence (e-mails, notes, pictures, cartoons, etc.). The Company provides a complaint form which employees can use to report harassment and file complaints.&nbsp; All employees are encouraged to use this complaint form.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company will conduct a thorough and objective investigation that ensures due process for all parties.&nbsp; All persons involved, including complainants, witnesses and alleged perpetrators will be accorded due process to protect their rights to a fair and impartial investigation. The investigation will be completed, and a determination made and communicated to you as soon as practical. The Company will endeavor to protect the privacy and confidentiality of all parties involved to the extent possible consistent with a thorough investigation and any resultant disciplinary action.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the Company determines that harassment in violation of this policy has occurred, disciplinary action up to and including immediate discharge will be taken. Appropriate action may also be taken to deter any future harassment.&nbsp; Managers or supervisors who knowingly allow harassing behavior to continue will be subject to disciplinary action.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">While the Company is confident that its internal complaint procedure will effectively address all complaints of violations of this policy and encourages employees to use this internal complaint procedure, employees who believe that they have been subject to unlawful harassment or discrimination also have the right to pursue legal remedies in court and/or file a formal complaint with the government agencies that investigate and prosecute complaints of unlawful harassment and discrimination in employment, including the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (the &ldquo;EEOC&rdquo;) and state and local government agencies enforcing state and local laws (including the New York State Division of Human Rights and New York City Commission on Human Rights).&nbsp; Information about filing a discrimination or harassment complaint with the EEOC is available on the EEOC&rsquo;s website at&nbsp;<a href=\"https://www.eeoc.gov/\" rel=\"nofollow\">https://www.eeoc.gov</a>.&nbsp; The EEOC can also be reached by calling 1-800-669-4000 or emailing&nbsp;<a href=\"mailto:info@eeoc.gov\" rel=\"nofollow\">info@eeoc.gov</a>.&nbsp; Additional information may also be available from state or local agencies, where applicable, regarding the procedures for filing administrative claims, and further information may be found&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Lendlease%20Harassment%20Policy%20AMER%20Additional%20Complaint%20Info%20-%20FINAL.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=ChnG3x\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"here\">here</a>.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Supervisory Responsibilities</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All supervisors and managers who receive a complaint or information about suspected sexual harassment, observe what may be sexually harassing behavior or for any reason suspect that sexual harassment is occurring,&nbsp;are required&nbsp;to report such suspected sexual harassment to People &amp; Culture.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In addition to being subject to discipline if they engaged in sexually harassing conduct themselves, supervisors and managers will be subject to discipline for failing to report suspected sexual harassment or otherwise knowingly allowing sexual harassment to continue.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Supervisors and managers will also be subject to discipline for engaging in any retaliation.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Investigations and Non-Retaliation</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">We will investigate any claims of harassment promptly, impartially, thoroughly and, to the extent possible, confidentially.&nbsp; The manner and extent of investigation and confidentiality is at the discretion of the People &amp; Culture Department, as it deems necessary.&nbsp; Investigations may include taking steps to obtain and preserve documents, emails or phone records relevant to the allegations, requesting and reviewing electronic communications, interviewing all parties involved, including any relevant witnesses, and preparing written documentation of the Company&rsquo;s findings.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All employees are expected to cooperate in investigations of harassment complaints by providing truthful information in response to any inquiry.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">After an appropriate investigation, any employee who is found to have violated this policy will be subject to disciplinary measures, as determined by the Company, up to and including termination.&nbsp; Managers or supervisors who knowingly allow such behavior will be subject to the same measures.&nbsp; Appropriate written documentation will be placed in his/her personnel file.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company prohibits any form of retaliation against any employee for filing a truthful complaint under this policy or for assisting in a complaint investigation.&nbsp; Retaliation may result in disciplinary action, up to and including termination.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If, after investigating any complaint of harassment, the Company determines that the complaint was untruthful or that an employee has provided false information regarding the complaint, disciplinary action, up to and including termination, may be taken against an individual who knowingly filed an untruthful complaint or gave false information.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />Reasonable Accommodations<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company is committed to the fair and equal employment of all employees and it is our policy to reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with disabilities or religious needs unless the accommodation would impose and undue hardship on the Company.&nbsp; A reasonable accommodation is any change or adjustment to the job application process, work environment, or work processes that would make it possible for the employee to perform the essential functions of their position.&nbsp; Employees seeking an accommodation based on a disability or religious need which will allow them to perform the essential functions of their position should speak with their manager or People and Culture Strategic Partner, who will work with the employee to identify possible reasonable accommodations and to assess the effectiveness of each in allowing the employee to perform the essential functions of their position.&nbsp; All information obtained concerning the medical condition or history of the employee will be treated as confidential.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Work Standards</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company expects all employees to accept certain responsibilities, adhere to acceptable business principles in matters of personal conduct, and exhibit personal integrity at all times.&nbsp; Employees must comply with the Company&rsquo;s policies and procedures and observe the Company&rsquo;s high standards of professionalism.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Solicitation &amp; Distribution of Literature</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Solicitation of an employee by another employee is prohibited if either employee is on working time.&nbsp; Distribution of advertising materials, handbills, or any other literature by employees in working areas of the Company is prohibited at all times.&nbsp; Solicitation or distribution of literature by non-employees on the Company&rsquo;s premises is prohibited at all times.&nbsp; Only official Company communications and notices may be posted on the Company's bulletin boards.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Workplace Violence</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company expressly prohibits disruptive, threatening or intimidating behavior, as well as any acts or threats of violence, that involve or affect any current or former employee, customer, client, vendor, or other third party on or about its facilities or elsewhere at any time, either during or after working hours.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company absolutely prohibits the possession of firearms and/or other dangerous or deadly weapons by any employee, client, customer, vendor, visitor or other third parties while on Company property or engaged in Company business. Weapons include knives, explosives and any other object designed to cause bodily harm as defined by applicable laws.&nbsp; This prohibition includes keeping or transporting a firearm or weapon in a vehicle in a parking lot area provided by the Company.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company will take immediate and appropriate disciplinary action consistent with applicable law against any employee who violates this policy, up to and including termination of employment.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any employee who is aware of a violation of this policy must report it to his or her immediate manager or a member of the People &amp; Culture Department.&nbsp; In emergency situations, local law enforcement or the police should be notified immediately.&nbsp; The Company will undertake a prompt investigation of any violation of this policy, maintaining confidentiality to the extent possible.&nbsp; Retaliation of any kind against the party reporting a violation of this policy is strictly prohibited.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Serious Offenses</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Certain acts are considered so serious that they normally will result in termination of employment for a single offense.&nbsp; Such actions include, but are not necessarily limited to, the following:</span><br /></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Gross insubordination (e.g., refusal to carry out assigned job duties or work-related directives given by a supervisor).</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Deliberate or reckless action that causes either actual or potential loss to the Company or employees, or damage to Company or employee property, or physical injury to employees.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Fighting or disorderly conduct on the Company&rsquo;s premises, or at Company-sponsored events off site, or engaging in violence or making threats of violence in the workplace, or using obscene, abusive, or threatening language or gestures.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Unauthorized use or disclosure of confidential or proprietary information, or related materials.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Dishonesty or misrepresentation, including falsification of reports, records or Company documents, or deliberate failure to accurately complete reports, records or Company documents.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Misappropriation or misuse of Company funds or other assets.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Stealing property from co-workers or clients of the Company.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Having firearms on Company premises or while on Company business.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Failing to maintain the confidentiality of Company or client information.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Use, sale, purchase, transfer, or possession of an illegal drug while on Company property or while on Company business.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Use, possession, or being under the influence of alcohol on Company property or while on Company business, except during Company-sponsored or approved social or business events at which alcohol is provided, as long as the degree of impairment is insubstantial.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Violation of the Company's policies, including the policy against unlawful harassment.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Discrimination in hiring, firing, pay, promotion, transfer, discipline, development, or establishment of terms and conditions of employment of any employee, or retaliation against an employee who has complained about discrimination or harassment.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Violations of safety standards.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Violation of security practices (e.g., loaning card keys/codes to non-employees).</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Sleeping on the job or leaving the job without authorization.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Being convicted of a crime that indicates unfitness for the job or raises a threat to the safety or well-being of the Company, its employees, clients, or property.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This list is illustrative only and is not intended to cover every possible situation that may arise.&nbsp; Any conduct that is detrimental to the Company's interests or security, or the safety or welfare of the employee or his or her co-workers, may result in corrective action up to and including termination of employment.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Substance Abuse and a Drug Free Workplace</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company is committed to protecting the safety, health, and well-being of its employees and all people who come into contact with its workplace(s), property, and/or use its services as well as abiding by the laws governing illegal substances.&nbsp; In accordance with the Drug-Free Workplace Act of 1988, it is the policy of the Company to prevent the use of drugs from having adverse effects at its project and office sites and is committed to maintaining a drug-free workplace.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Prohibited Behavior</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">It is the policy of the Company that the use, sale, offer for sale, purchase, transfer, possession, manufacture, dispensation, trade, or presence in one's system of any controlled substance, including alcohol, illegal drugs, or intoxicants (&ldquo;Controlled Substances&rdquo;) by any person while on company/client premises, engaged in safety-sensitive Company business, operating Company/client equipment, applying for employment, or while under the authority of the Company is strictly prohibited.&nbsp; Employees may not report to work or be subject to duty while their ability to perform their job duties is impaired due to on- or off-duty use of Controlled Substances.&nbsp; This Policy does not prohibit the use of prescription or over-the-counter drugs as directed by a doctor and/or in accordance with the package directions, as long as the use does not impair the Employee&rsquo;s ability to perform his or her job duties.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company expects employees to follow the legal requirements relating to the consumption of alcohol.&nbsp; At no time is alcohol to be stored or consumed within the Company&rsquo;s project sites or within its project trailers.&nbsp; Within Corporate or Regional offices, at no time is alcohol to be consumed during core business hours on Company premises or while under the authority of the Company.&nbsp; To the extent that employees share offices with other Lendlease businesses or anyone else with a more restrictive policy, the more restrictive policy governing that office would control.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Consequences</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employee compliance with this Policy is a condition of employment.&nbsp; Failure or refusal to fully cooperate and comply with this Policy will be grounds for disciplinary action up to and including termination of employment.&nbsp; If an applicant for employment violates this Policy, the offer of employment will be withdrawn.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Notification of Convictions</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any employee who is convicted of a criminal drug violation in the workplace (including employees who plead no contest or nolo contendere) must notify the Company in writing within five calendar days of the conviction. The Company will take appropriate disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment, within 30 days of notification. Federal contracting agencies will be notified when appropriate.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Communication</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Communicating this drug-free workplace Policy to both supervisors and employees is critical to the Company&rsquo;s success.&nbsp; To ensure all employees are aware of their role in supporting the Company&rsquo;s drug-free workplace program:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All employees will receive a written copy of this Policy.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This Policy will be reviewed in orientation sessions with new employees.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This Policy and any available assistance programs will be reviewed at safety meetings.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All employees will receive an update of this Policy annually with their paychecks.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Posters and brochures will be available at all locations.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employee education about the dangers of alcohol and drug use and the availability of help will be provided to all employees.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Every supervisor will receive training to help him/her recognize and manage employees with alcohol and other drug problems.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Drug and Alcohol Testing</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Each employee, as a condition of employment, will be required to participate in pre-employment, post-accident, reasonable suspicion, and random testing upon selection or request of supervisor or management.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In all instances drug and alcohol screening will be handled by the People &amp; Culture Department both to ensure the integrity of the process and to protect the rights of the individuals involved.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Pre-employment Testing</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Each offer of employment with the Company will be conditioned upon the passing of a test for alcohol and drugs as permitted by applicable law.&nbsp; The Company will not hire any applicant who fails to pass the pre-employment alcohol and drug test.&nbsp; Applicants refusing to take the test or sign the consent form prior to testing will not be hired.&nbsp; Applicants will not be allowed to begin work until the Company receives a negative test result.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Post-Accident Testing</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees will be subject to post accident testing if involved in an on-the-job accident, near miss on-the-job accident, or incident where injury or property damage did occur or might have occurred. The Safety Manager and/or the Director of Safety must be contacted for consultation prior to notifying the employee of the requirement to test.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Company employees involved in reportable on-the-job accidents will be sent for drug testing for the use of alcohol or controlled substances as soon as possible after the reported accident and after receiving appropriate medical treatment.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Reasonable Suspicion Testing</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When the Company or its client have reason to believe that a drug/alcohol problem exists, the employees will be subject to testing after the manager has contacted the People &amp; Culture Department for consultation.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Other Testing Programs</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The company reserves the right to perform random testing at its discretion, in accordance with applicable law.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Refusal to Submit</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee may not refuse to consent or submit to alcohol or controlled substances tests required by this Policy.&nbsp; Refusal to submit includes failing to provide adequate breath or urine sample for alcohol or drug testing and any conduct that obstructs or interferes with any stage of the testing process.&nbsp; This includes adulteration of or tampering with a urine or breath sample.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Failure or refusal to proceed directly and immediately to the collection site will be considered a refusal to test.&nbsp; A refusal to test is considered a positive test result.&nbsp; An employee who fails or refuses to proceed directly and immediately to the collection site will be subject to discipline, up to and including termination.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Confidentiality/Record keeping</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All employee alcohol and controlled substance test records are considered confidential. For the purpose of this Policy/procedure, confidential record keeping is defined as records maintained in a secure manner, under lock and key, accessible only to the People &amp; Culture Department.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employee alcohol and controlled substance test records will only be released in the following situations:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To the employee, upon his/her written request;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Upon request of a government agency with regulatory authority over the Company;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Upon request of state or local officials with regulatory authority over the Company; and</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Upon request by subsequent employers upon receipt of a written request by a covered employee.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>REFERENCE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"http://pulse.lendlease.com/policies/americas/people/code-of-conduct\" rel=\"nofollow\" title=\"Group Code of Conduct Policy\">Group Code of Conduct Policy<br /></a> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018791\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Group Diversity &amp; Inclusion Policy\">Group Diversity &amp; Inclusion Policy<br /></a> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018792\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Group Employee Concerns and Advocacy Policy\">Group Employee Concerns and Advocacy Policy<br /></a> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018801\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Group Harassment and Bullying Policy\">Group Harassment and Bullying Policy<br /></a> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; Click on the days you wish to request </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"> as leave (selected days will highlight </span><br /><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\"> blue)</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">c. Click &lsquo;Request Absence&rsquo; </span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">d. Click &lsquo;Type&rsquo; and select correct leave type </span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">e. Click &lsquo;Next&rsquo;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 255.15pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\">\r\n<p style=\"position: relative; min-height: 158px;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=23a35eec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb77\" alt=\"\" width=\"289px\" height=\"158px\" /></span></p>\r\n<p style=\"position: relative; min-height: 97px;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=a3a35eec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb79\" alt=\"\" width=\"325px\" height=\"115px\" /><img style=\"position: absolute; top: 23px; left: 17px;\" src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=27a35eec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb7b\" alt=\"\" width=\"189px\" height=\"74px\" /></span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 28.4pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\"><br /></td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 226.55pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For <strong>longer periods</strong> of leave such as Parental Leave or Sabbatical Leave, you must enter the full date range. Follow step 1 to access the Absence calendar then follow the below steps.</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">a. Click &lsquo;Select Date Range&rsquo;</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">b. Input the date ranges and the type of leave</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"> <em>From &ndash; First day of leave<br />To &ndash; Last date of Leave</em></span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-left: 18.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">c. Click &lsquo;Next&rsquo; to continue</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 255.15pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\">\r\n<p style=\"position: relative; min-height: 85px;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img style=\"position: absolute; left: 11px;\" src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=a7a35eec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb7d\" alt=\"\" width=\"250px\" height=\"85px\" /><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=2ba35eec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb7f\" alt=\"\" width=\"233px\" height=\"201px\" /></span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 28.4pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">3.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 226.55pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In the <strong>Request Absence</strong> screen it will show an overview of the dates, hours and type of leave. </span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">a. To input additional requests for leave, Click the + icon on the left hand side of the table </span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">b. If you need to edit the hours, Click Edit Quantity per day </span></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-left: 18.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-left: 18.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">c. If you need to edit the date range, Click the &lsquo;From or To&rsquo; to bring up the calendar and reselect dates</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">d. To edit the type of leave, click X out the current leave and reselect from the list </span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">e. Enter a comment if necessary </span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">f. Select attachments if this type of leave requires documentation</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">g. Click &lsquo;Submit&rsquo;</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 255.15pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\">\r\n<p style=\"position: relative; min-height: 35px;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img style=\"position: absolute; top: 1px; left: 81px;\" src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=aba35eec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb81\" alt=\"\" width=\"39px\" height=\"34px\" /></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=2fa35eec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb61\" alt=\"\" width=\"170px\" height=\"33px\" /></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=afa35eec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb63\" alt=\"\" width=\"289px\" height=\"71px\" /></span></p>\r\n<p style=\"position: relative; min-height: 79px;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=a3a35eec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb68\" alt=\"\" width=\"258px\" height=\"79px\" /></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=a7a35eec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb6c\" alt=\"\" width=\"212px\" height=\"42px\" /></span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 28.4pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">To View submitted absence requests</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">a. Click on your Workday profile (either a cloud or your photo) from the top right-hand corner of the Workday homepage </span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">b. Click &lsquo;Time Off&rsquo;</span></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-left: 18.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">c. Select the Time Off and Leave </span><br /><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\"> Requests tab</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 255.15pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=2ba35eec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb6e\" alt=\"\" width=\"143px\" height=\"276px\" /></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=aba35eec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb70\" alt=\"\" width=\"254px\" height=\"45px\" /></span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 28.4pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">5.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 481.7pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\" colspan=\"2\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Please note: </strong></span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&middot; Annual leave and Wellbeing leave are automatically approved i.e. they do not go to your manager for approval.</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&middot; Discuss your annual leave and wellbeing leave with your manager before you enter the request into Workday. All other leave types require manager approval in Workday, such as parental, partner, personal, emergency, compassionate, leave without pay, sabbatical leave.</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&middot; Leave is displayed in hours for AUS and AMER and in days for ASIA and UK.</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&middot; Each region has different leave types.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Please contact People Connect if you have any questions or need assistance entering a leave request.</strong></span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p class=\"footer\"><br /></p>\r\n<p sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease encourages all employees to take regular breaks to support mental health and wellbeing. Annual leave is paid time off granted to eligible employees to use as requested.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent full-time, fixed-term contract full-time employees and part-time employees employed on local terms are eligible for annual leave.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Read through the relevant Annual Leave Policy for your employment location.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Discuss your leave plans with your manager well in advance, in order to agree to a time which minimises disruption to your team and the business.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The required notice periods are:</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Less than five working days requested - at least five days in advance</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- More than five working days requested - at least one month in advance</span><br /></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; font-size: 12pt;\">Your annual leave will be automatically approved in Workday.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858;
