sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Insurance is an important part of providing for our employees and their families in the event of illness, injury or unfortunately sometimes in the case of death.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Having insurance to bring a level of financial relief during these times can provide great comfort to our employees and their families.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Our permanent employees who are members in the Lendlease Superannuation Plan provided by Mercer, will be provided with the following insurances:</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Death &amp; Total and Permanent Disablement (Death &amp;TPD)</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Income Protection (IP)</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Please refer to the Insurance Booklet in the Resources section for specifics relating to policy coverage.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Also note, that if you choose to join the Lendlease Superannuation Plan at a time other than when first joining Lendlease (for employees hired after 1 May 2018), your cover will be restricted to &ldquo;new event&rdquo; cover only for the first 2 years of membership and you may be required to complete medical tests at the discretion of the insurer.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Death &amp; TPD<br /></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This insurance is a compulsory component of membership within the Lendlease Superannuation Plan as provided by Mercer.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Upon joining the plan, employees will be offered insurance based on a default formula of:</span><br /><span style=\"margin-left: 10px; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"> Sum insured = 15% x Salary (excluding super) x years to age 65.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"margin-left: 10px; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"> Insurance based on the formula above will not require the employee to complete any medical tests provided they join when first offered to them (typically upon hire) and the total sum insured does not exceed $1.5 million.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"margin-left: 10px; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"> Members who transitioned from other Lendlease funds on 23 May 2018 may have other minimum levels of cover as specified in their transfer guide.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"margin-left: 10px; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"> The premiums for this insurance (using sum insured based on the formula) will be paid for by Lendlease. Any cover that a member has in excess of this default level, will have the additional portion of the premium deducted from their superannuation account.</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Income Protection<br /></strong> Also known as salary continuance, income protection provides a level of income should you become temporarily injured or ill which prevents you from working for a period of time.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The cover provided to members is:</span><br /><span style=\"margin-left: 10px; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"> Sum insured = 75% of salary (excluding mandatory super contributions), paid monthly</span><br /><span style=\"margin-left: 20px; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"> for a maximum of 2 years.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"margin-left: 20px; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"> Premiums for this insurance are charged monthly to members accounts, at corporate rates which are typically lower than retail.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"margin-left: 20px; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"> This insurance is provided automatically when joining the fund, however members may choose to &ldquo;opt out&rdquo; if this cover is not required or already held privately via another policy.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><br /><span style=\"color: #008080;\">Resources</span><br /></strong> <img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=a08847031b7be0106d4e986cbc4bcb86\" sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Identity Theft protection</strong>, offered through ID Watchdog, covers identity monitoring and internet surveillance, credit monitoring, social media monitoring, password protection, lost wallet protection, digital exposure report, and identity theft insurance up to $1,000,000.00, for fraudulent electronic transfers from checking and savings accounts. You will receive real-time credit alerts within minutes of detected activity.&nbsp; The customer care center and case managers are available 24/7 to assist with managing resolutions.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ID+3 level coverage offered includes Dark Web Monitoring, Fraud Alert Reminder, High Risk Monitoring, Identity Monitoring, Sex Offender Notifications, and monitoring of your bank account and credit cards.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All active full time salaried eligible employees are eligible for this benefit.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><br><span style=\"color: #008080;\">How do I apply?</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Newly hired employees are eligible to elect this benefit when electing their healthcare benefits. Elections must be completed within 31 days from the employee&rsquo;s start date. Current employees may elect this benefit during our annual open enrolment or if they experience a qualifying life event during the year.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><br><span style=\"color: #008080;\">How do I manage my account?</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees who elect this benefit will receive a welcome letter which will include information along with the employee&rsquo;s unique identification code. Once the welcome letter is received the employee can log in to the secure website to&nbsp;<a href=\"https://dashboard.idwatchdog.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\">activate his/her account online</a>.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you wish to make changes to your coverage please call the Benefits Center at 844 549 6210.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have questions, review the information on the website at&nbsp;<a careers and to express Lendlease's appreciation for their continued contribution and dedication to the business.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All Lendlease full time salaried employees in the United States are eligible to receive service awards.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Eligibility</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All Full-time, salaried employees with uninterrupted service with any Lendlease company are eligible for service awards. For employees who have a break in service with the company of 12 months or less, prior years of service will be recognized, adjusting the hire date to reflect the break in service, if the following criteria are met:</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Prior years of service were as full-time, salaried employee; and</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee has at least one year of uninterrupted prior service.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Service Milestones &amp; Rewards</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease recognizes every 5 years of service up to 50. Stellar points are awarded at each 10 year service milestone as outlined in the table below and employees can redeem these for a range of merchandise and gift cards.</span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto; Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Personal (sick)&nbsp;and carer's leave&nbsp;is time off that an eligible employee may use to help deal with personal illness or to care for an immediate family or household member who is sick.</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent and fixed-term employees are eligible.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees bound by an enterprise agreement where Lendlease is the employer may have varying leave conditions. Please refer to the relevant enterprise agreement for specific terms and conditions that apply to you.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Notify your manager as soon as you are aware that you need to take leave.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you want to check your personal or carer&rsquo;s leave entitlements, view the Personal (Sick) and Carer&rsquo;s Leave Policy.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ACT&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Contact your manager if your circumstances change or the intended day of return to work needs to be revised.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Collect a medical certificate if requested by your manager.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>FINALISE</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Provide any required medical certificates to your manager upon your return to work.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Submit leave request in Workday.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Your manager will approve or reject the request and confirm once this has been actioned.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Can I cash out my personal and carer&rsquo;s leave?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Accrued personal (sick) and carer&rsquo;s leave cannot be cashed out. Additionally, this leave is not payable upon termination of employment. &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">At Lendlease we understand the need to be flexible with a number of benefits for employees who have differing circumstances. One of these benefits is annual leave. It is important for employees to take leave as one of the ways to maintain a healthy work-life balance, but we understand there are circumstances where you may accumulate more leave than you can take. You may be able to &lsquo;cash out&rsquo; an entitlement of annual leave if you meet certain eligibility requirements.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent and fixed-term employees are eligible for annual leave cash out, subject to policy conditions. &nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Where employees are employed under the terms and conditions of an operative enterprise agreement with a Lendlease group company, please refer to the relevant enterprise agreement as to whether or not this policy applies to you.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I cash out my annual leave? (for employees in Australia)</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Read through the Annual Leave Cash Out Policy.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Gather required documentation providing evidence that you have:</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">-&nbsp;A remaining accrued annual leave balance of at least 20 days (pro-rata equivalent for part-time employees) after you have deducted the number of leave days to be cashed out at the date of your application.&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Discuss your application with your manager.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; font-size: 12pt;\">Submit the application to your manager for approval.&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once you have received your manager&rsquo;s approval, send the signed application form and supporting documents to&nbsp;<a href=\"peopleconnect@lendlease.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" title=\"People Connect\">People Connect</a>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">It is your responsibility to ensure that your personal information lodged with Lendlease is up to date. Changes to personal details that you are required to notify the company of, are defined as the following:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080; text-decoration: underline;\"><strong>Changes to personal information</strong></span></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Change to your surname (family name)<br />Change of home/ mailing address<br />Change of phone number (home/ mobile)<br />Change of bank details<br />Change of emergency contact details<br />Change to educational achievement/ qualifications</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span style=\"color: #008080; text-decoration: underline;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Changes to family information/ new dependants</span></strong></span></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Marriage/ de-facto<br />Birth/ adoption<br />Child no longer dependant<br />Divorce</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; font-size: 12pt;\">Gather any necessary documentation for the change required, such as birth, adoption or marriage certificates.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">Malaysia employees ONLY</span>:&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If there are any changes to family information/ dependencies, the Payroll Declaration Form must also be completed.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; font-size: 12pt;\">Access the Personal Information worklet in Workday to submit your change of details, attaching any required documentation.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Adding or editing your bank details is important as payments are made to the account updated in your profile. Please ensure that you input your correct bank account details, including branch and bank codes. You may refer to the&nbsp;available guidelines under &lsquo;Resources&rsquo;&nbsp;for reference.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any requests received after these dates will take effect the following month.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;- before the 10th of the month in Singapore</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;- before the 16th of the month in Malaysia</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>FINALISE</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For any issues relating to leave contact your manager or ask People Connect (<a href=\"mailto:PeopleConnect@Lendlease.com\">PeopleConnect@Lendlease.com)</a>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong><br />Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; border-right: 1.5pt solid #FFFFFF; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=7dc9a5c21bbbc2904d4c0fa2cd4bcbf9\" alt=\"Stationery_Pen_BLK_PNG\" width=\"46px\" height=\"48px\" /></span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; border-right: 1.5pt solid #FFFFFF; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Payroll%20Declaration%20Form%20-%20Malaysia.doc?d=w7eca19fe1c7044bb814a193b0baf4039&amp;csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=nqhDLs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Payroll Declaration Form - Malaysia\">Payroll Declaration Form - Malaysia</a>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; border-right: 1.5pt solid #FFFFFF; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=fdc9a5c21bbbc2904d4c0fa2cd4bcbfc\" alt=\"Quick Facts\" width=\"48px\" height=\"50px\" /></span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; border-right: 1.5pt solid #FFFFFF; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Quick%20Facts%20-%20Updating%20bank%20details%20-%20SG%20and%20MY.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" title=\"Quick Facts Guide to updating bank details in Workday\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Quick Facts Guide to updating bank details in Workday</span></a></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>","sys_created_by":"wonl340","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"x_caukp_ebonding_integration_mode":null,"can_read_user_criteria":"","active":"true","cannot_read_user_criteria":"","published":"2024-08-05","helpful_count":"0","sys_domain_path":"/","u_view_count_all":"454","version":{"display_value":"6.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_version/3d0f390a47378690fa3d6da7a46d43fb"},"x_caukp_ebonding_requester_id":"","meta_description":"It is your responsibility to ensure that your personal information lodged with Lendlease is up to date.","kb_knowledge_base":{"display_value":"People Connect Knowledge Base","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_base/01125e5a1b9b685017eeebd22a4bcb44"},"meta":"Manage My Details","u_problem_type":null,"topic":"General","display_number":"KB0018749 v6.0","base_version":{"display_value":"KB0018749 v5.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge/7fc917a31bb0f1504d3b97d58d4bcbe2"},"short_description":"Manage My Details - Asia","u_last_review_date":"2024-08-05","x_caukp_ebonding_provider_id":"","roles":"","direct":"false","description":"","disable_suggesting":"false","sn_grc_target_table":"","sys_class_name":"Knowledge","article_id":"0674fcc5dbe76c50ee773313e29619e6","sys_id":"2dc925c21bbbc2904d4c0fa2cd4bcbe0","use_count":"0","flagged":"false","disable_commenting":"false","valid_to":"2025-08-05","retired":"","u_add_to_homepage":"false","u_video_url":"","display_attachments":"false","latest":"true","summary":{"display_value":"KB0018749","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_summary/f044115e1bbf6010ef4543b4bd4bcbb5"},"sys_view_count":"6","revised_by":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"7","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"ASIA","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/36c83b8f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcbfe"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2024-02-29 00:07:54","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018788","sys_updated_by":"raiv416","sys_created_on":"2021-04-18 19:11:37","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Our policies are designed to acquaint employees with Lendlease, and its subsidiaries and affiliates, (the “Company”) and to serve as a useful reference for questions about policies and procedures.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The information contained within the policies on People Portal are intended to be accurate as of the time of publication and to replace and supersede any other sources of information regarding the Company’s policies and procedures including, but not limited to, statements of policy or procedure found on the Company’s intranet site, previous editions of the Company’s policy manual and previous editions of the Company’s employee handbook.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company reserves the right to modify, revoke, suspend, interpret, change, or terminate, in whole or in part, benefits or policies as circumstances warrant at any time, with or without cause, and with or without advance notice. Updates and new editions of policies will be routinely published in response to Company needs and in compliance with federal and state laws.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The company policies are only a general guide.  The provisions of our policies do not constitute an employment contract, express or implied, or a guarantee of continued employment with the Company.  Employees of the Company have an at-will relationship with the Company.  This means that either the employee or the Company may terminate employment at any time, with or without cause, and with or without prior notice.   Neither the policies on People Portal, nor any other communication by a management representative, made at the time of hire or during the course of employment, are intended to create an employment contract.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong> SCOPE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease US Philosophy</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company strives to be “a creative property group, with global reach and world class local capability… passionate about safely creating, building, managing and owning inventive and sustainable people places.”</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company is committed to providing benefits for all customers, employees, and the community with:</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Our people… A team that lives our values  </span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\"><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">People places… People places not buildings  </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Inventive… People with imagination, who embrace challenges, identify opportunities early, act on them quickly and question the status quo to develop smart solutions </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Partnering… We will be known as a great partner and recognized for producing win/win outcomes </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Safety… Always safe, all of the time, for everybody </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Sustainable… Lead on sustainability, recognizing that what we do helps form the long term fiber for Communities</span></li></ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Core Values<br /></strong> The Company and its employees actively subscribe to a set of Core Values.  The values also relate to the Lendlease Code of Conduct, which provides guidance for employees in relation to the standards that the Company expects in the conduct of its operations.  The Lendlease core values are: </span><br /></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\"><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Respect </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Integrity </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Innovation </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Collaboration </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Excellence </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Trust</span></li></ul>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Employment</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action</span></strong><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, creed, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizen status, sex, age, disability, marital status, genetic information, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease expressly prohibits any form of unlawful employee harassment based on race, creed, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizen status, sex, age, disability, marital status, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Lendlease&#39;s employees to perform their expected job duties is strictly prohibited.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease will not terminate or in any way discriminate against any employee because they have inquired about, discussed or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Employees with access to compensation information of other employees or applicants as part of their duties may not disclose this information to others who do not have access to compensation information without express written consent from senior management, Legal or People &amp; Culture.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease is an affirmative action employer who recognizes the value of diversity in the workplace. To further the principles of equal employment opportunity, Lendlease has developed affirmative action programs for minorities and women, individuals with disabilities, and for disabled veterans and other eligible veterans.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Recruitment &amp; Hiring<br /></strong> The Talent Acquisition team within People &amp; Culture is committed to attracting and hiring top talent across the company. All Job Requisitions must be initiated by the Hiring Manager in Workday and follow our formal approval process.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once approved, a member of the recruiting team will conduct an intake call with the Hiring Manager to better define the scope of the role. The assigned Recruiter will sources and prescreen candidates for submittal to the Hiring Manager. The Recruiter will coordinate interviews and work with the Hiring Manager throughout the interview and selection process.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Upon selection of a finalist candidate, the Hiring Manger will work with the Recruiter to determine appropriate offer parameters, facilitate a formal offer and commence the hiring process.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Lendlease U.S. Immigration Policy<br /></strong> To ensure that Lendlease U.S. (the “Company”) has the best talent needed to successfully complete a project or assignment, the Company may assist selected foreign-born individuals in their efforts to obtain documentation necessary to become and remain a Company employee in the United States. Nothing in this Policy or Procedure shall be regarded as a guarantee of continued employment nor as the basis for any part of a contract with an employee.  Employment with the Company is based on the mutual consent of the Company and the employee, as well as, the company&#39;s approval of associated costs.  Accordingly, either the Company or the employee may terminate the Employment relationship “at will,” at any time, with or without cause or advance notice.  Nothing in this policy entitles the employee to continued sponsorship if their employment in the U.S. is terminated. </span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Employment of Part Time High School Students<br /></strong> High school students who are at least 16 years of age or  older and who have working papers required by federal or state law may be employed part time provided they do not work on project sites.  </span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Background Investigations<br /></strong> All regular, full-time salaried and non-union hourly candidates for employment with the Company will be required to pass a background check according to this policy as part of the employment screening process.  Current or temporary employees, interns or co-op students may be required to undergo a background check at the discretion of the Company.  Employees who are rehired with less than 12 months break in service are not required to have a background check.  Rehires with a break in services greater than 12 months will be required to submit to a modified background check.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company has selected an approved background check vendor and all offices and project sites are required to use the approved vendor for background checks. </span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Notification &amp; Authorization<br /></strong> Applicants should be informed during the pre-employment process that all offers of employment are contingent upon the results of a background check. Applicants will be required to complete a consent form, which requests specialized information for the approved background investigation vendor. Applicants who refuse to authorize a background check will be denied employment. No employee is to begin the orientation process or assignment prior to obtaining the results of the background investigation.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any exception to this policy must be approved in writing by the Head of People &amp; Culture.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Use of Background Check Results<br /></strong> Offers of employment must be made contingent upon successful completion of the background check.  Failure to meet the requirements of the background check will eliminate the applicant from further consideration for the position.  Some reasons that would qualify as a failure to meet these requirements are:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\"><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Inconsistency of information provided by the candidate versus that obtained by the background check </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Omissions of information by the candidate versus that obtained by the background check </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Unsatisfactory information uncovered by the background check </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Conviction of certain job related criminal offenses within the allowable reportable time period and /or any conviction of one or more of the following crimes which are all considered to be job related: </span><br /></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Theft or Dishonesty </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Violent Crimes </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Alcohol/Drug-Related Crime </span></li></ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The determination to eliminate an applicant from consideration for hiring on the basis of failure to meet the requirements of background verification will be made by the appropriate Human Resources Representative. </span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) Compliance<br /></strong> The FCRA is intended to give, among other things, a candidate for employment the opportunity to correct factual errors in his or her background check report before an adverse employment action is taken, and to be provided time between the employer&#39;s notification of any disqualifying information and the actual rejection of the employment application in order to correct, if possible, these discrepancies.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When a background check report is received that contains information disqualifying the candidate from further consideration, the P&amp;C Compliance Manager:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\"><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Send the candidate a letter notifying him or her that we have received such information.  Further, a copy of the report and a summary of his or her rights under the FCRA will be enclosed.  This notification is required before any adverse employment action can be taken based on the background check report.</span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"> After five business days, a second letter will be sent to the applicant rejecting the candidacy based on the disqualifying information in the background check if information satisfactory to the Company negating the discrepant information has not been provided.</span></li></ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Employment Records &amp; Reference Inquiries<br /></strong> The Company collects various personal data necessary for lawful Human Resources Administration and Management. The information contained in personnel records is treated as confidential.  All requests for information on current or former employees must be referred to People &amp; Culture.  Information given by phone will be limited to verification of employment dates and position title only.  In response to written requests (e.g. mortgage applications, etc.), information such as salary, dates of employment, job history, and position may be provided, if an authorization signed by the employee is provided. If and when requested by the Company, an employee&#39;s digital signature will be considered an accepted means of validating the signing employee&#39;s identity and an acceptable substitute for a wet signature on or in electronic documents and correspondence.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As a global organization with global human resources functions and facilities, the Company will transfer employee’s personal and sensitive data worldwide among our group companies for the purposes of benefits and payroll administration, job transfers, etc.  If there is a change in any personal information, employees should notify People &amp; Culture. It is very important that records are kept current to provide employees with correct pay and benefits and to contact the appropriate person in case of an emergency.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an employee wishes to review his or her personnel records, he or she should contact a People &amp; Culture Representative.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Offers of Employment<br /></strong> All terms of the employment offer including proposed annual salary, bonus, relocation assistance, auto allowance or any other components of the offer must be discussed and approved, in advance, with the assigned Recruiter and/or Director of Talent Acquisition. In some instances, additional Senior Management approval may be required. All offer letters are generated by People Connect in Sydney.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>At Will Employment<br /></strong> All employment and compensation with the Company is &#34;at will&#34; in that the employment relationship can be terminated with or without cause, and with or without notice, at any time, at the option of either the Company or the employee, except as otherwise provided by law. </span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Nepotism<br /></strong> Lendlease is committed to a policy of employment and advancement based on qualifications and merit and does not discriminate in favor of or in opposition to the employment of family members.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Due to potential for perceived or actual conflicts, such as favoritism or personal conflicts from outside the work environment, which can be carried into the daily working relationship, Lendlease will hire or consider other employment actions concerning family members of persons currently employed only if: a) candidates for employment will not be working directly for or supervising a family member, and b) candidates for employment will not occupy a position in the same line of authority in which employees can initiate or participate in decisions involving a direct benefit to a family member. </span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">“Family member” is defined as one of the following: relationships by blood—parent, child, grandparent, grandchild, brother, sister, uncle, aunt, nephew, niece and first cousin; and relationships by marriage—husband, wife, step-parent, step-child, brother-in-law, sister-in-law, father-in-law, mother-in-law, son-in-law, daughter-in-law, half-brother, half-sister, uncle, aunt, nephew, niece, and partner or significant other.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Managers are responsible for ensuring policy compliance.  If any employee, after employment or change in employment, enters into one of the above relationships, the employee is responsible for immediately reporting the change to their manager.  All changes must be approved by the Head of People &amp; Culture. </span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Discipline<br /></strong> The Company may choose to exercise its discretion to use forms of discipline that are less severe than termination, depending on the circumstances.  Less severe forms of discipline include, but are not limited to, verbal counseling and reprimands, written reprimands, involuntary transfers or demotions, and suspensions.  Although one or more of these steps may be taken in connection with a particular employee, no particular order or system is required, and the Company may or may not adhere to a “progressive” series of disciplinary actions.  </span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company has the discretion to use whatever form of corrective action it believes is appropriate under the circumstances.  How the Company chooses to administer employee discipline in no way alters or limits the normal at-will employment relationship.  </span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Termination of Employment<br /></strong> The Company reserves the right to terminate the employment of any employee at any time, with or without cause, and with or without prior notice. Terms and conditions of employment, including a defined period of employment, cannot be guaranteed by any member of management. The provisions of this Policy will not limit the employment at-will relationship between employees and the Company.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Voluntary Termination<br /></strong> Standard business practice requires that employees provide the Company at least two weeks written notice before the resignation date. Employees who do not give two weeks notice may not be eligible for rehire. </span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Involuntary Termination<br /></strong> All involuntary terminations must be pre-approved by People &amp; Culture and an Executive Team Member. There will be no exceptions to this policy. </span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee’s “Last Day Worked” is the last day an employee is actively performing his or her job duties. This is the effective date of termination. Upon an employee’s termination, the employee will receive his or her unused, accrued PTO and information regarding the continuation of employee benefits or conversion privileges that may be available. For additional information, the employee should consult a People &amp; Culture Representative.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Rehire<br /></strong> Former employees may be considered for re-employment. Consideration will be based on previous work performance, supervisory recommendation at the time of prior termination from the Company, subsequent work record and other job-related factors.  </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Re-employment within 12 months of termination will result in a revised service date taking into consideration the number of months not employed at Lendlease.  This revised service date will be used for benefit eligibility such as short term disability, service awards and PTO.  Re-employment after 12 months will result in a brand new service date equal to their most recent date of hire and no prior service will be recognized.  Please note that certain benefit plans are based on most recent date of hire regardless of how long you were unemployed by Lendlease.  For 401(k) purposes, if an employee has completed one year of continuous service prior to leaving the company, eligibility for company match will be immediate.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Work Environment</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Work Hours<br /></strong> To maintain an effective work environment, the Company has established its working hours to align with overall company operations and individual departmental needs.  Therefore, some positions and employees in different locations may be required to work varying schedules.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In general, the regular workweek is Monday through Friday, 40 hours per week. The regular workday is generally from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. with a 60-minute unpaid break for lunch. At times, it may be necessary for the company to change work hours to accommodate the needs of the business.  Employees are expected to work the hours assigned by his or her manager. Failure to adhere to the assigned hours may result in disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Attendance and Punctuality<br /></strong> The Company expects all employees to arrive to work on time and consistently for the work schedule assigned.  Therefore if an employee is unable to report for work, the employee is to notify his or her supervisor or department head immediately.  Specifically, this requires that the employee must directly notify his or her supervisor by telephone or in person on each day he or she is absent.  Sending an email or relaying a message through a coworker is not sufficient.  Such notice must be provided as far in advance as possible.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an employee is absent for more than three (3) days, the employee may be required to produce a physician’s statement.  Excessive absences or tardiness may result in disciplinary action up to and including termination of employment.  An employee absent from work for two consecutive days without notifying the department head or direct supervisor will be considered to have terminated due to job abandonment.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Employee Appearance<br /></strong> All employees are expected to observe good habits of dress, grooming and personal hygiene.  While many offices of the Company may adopt “business casual” attire, at no time will any of the following be permitted:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\"><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Jeans with holes or ragged edges </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Cut-offs </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">T-shirts with logos or slogans </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Sweat suits </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Halter or strapless tops </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Beachwear or beach sandals </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Baseball caps</span></li></ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">While the above is not an exhaustive list, all employees are expected to use good judgment and taste in matters of appearance.<br /></span><br /><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Workers’ Compensation </span></strong><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All employees are insured for accidental injuries sustained on the job or while performing duties for the company under state Workers’ Compensation laws. The amounts of such compensation, including any pay to be received for time missed from work and medical coverage costs, are established by state law and the rulings of the state regulatory body.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Workplace Emergency<br /></strong> The Company is committed to protecting all employees’ safety in the event of an emergency.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The local emergency action plan addresses potential emergencies that may be expected in each location. In the event of an emergency evacuation, employees should use floor plans or workplace maps that clearly outline the emergency escape routes. Safe or refuge areas should be included in the plan.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Every manager is expected to periodically review with employees the actions employees are to take in the event of an emergency.  This review should include the following:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\"><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Identify the individuals responsible for various aspects of the plan (chain of command) so that in an emergency confusion is minimized and employees have no doubt about who has authority to make decisions. </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Identify the method of communication that is used to alert employees that an evacuation or some other action is required as well as how employees can report emergencies (such as manual pull stations, public address systems, or telephones). </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Identify the evacuation routes from the building and locations where employees should gather. </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">General guidance for fires and related emergencies includes: </span></li></ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an employee discovers a fire or sees/smells smoke, he or she should immediately follow these procedures: </span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\"><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Notify the local Fire Department. </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Activate the building alarm (fire pull station). If not available or operational, verbally notify people in the building. </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If safely possible, isolate the area by closing windows and doors and evacuate the building. </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If safely possible, shut down equipment in the immediate area. </span></li></ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If possible and if the employee has received appropriate training, use a portable fire extinguisher to: </span><br /></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\"><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Assist oneself to evacuate, </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Assist another to evacuate, and </span></li><li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Control a small fire. </span></li></ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Do not collect personal or official items. Leave the area of the fire immediately and walk, do not run, to the exit and designated gathering area. </span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Provide the fire/police teams with the details of the problem upon their arrival. Special hazard information known is essential for the safety of the emergency responders. Employees should not re-enter the building until directed to do so. </span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the fire alarms are ringing in the building, employees must evacuate the building and stay in the designated meeting location until notified to return. Managers must account for all employees within his or her group, keep them together, and report any missing persons to the emergency personnel at the scene. </span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an individual is overexposed to smoke or chemical vapors, remove the person to an uncontaminated area and treat for shock. If any employee suspects that a life threatening condition still exists (such as heavy smoke or toxic gases), do not enter the area. If CPR certified, follow standard CPR protocols and get medical attention promptly. </span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Security<br /></strong> All employees are expected to follow the security practices established at each location/project site.  In addition, employees are asked to report any suspicious activity or persons immediately to security.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company recognizes an employee’s right to privacy; however, procedures regarding security are in effect to protect employees and to safeguard the property of the company.  Therefore, the Company reserves the right to inspect packages, cabinets, drawers, computer files, carrying cases, vehicles, etc.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Fraternization<br /></strong> A manager should not engage in any form of relationship with a subordinate employee that could potentially have the appearance of creating or promoting favoritism or special treatment for the subordinate employee. Accordingly, managers are prohibited from romantic involvement or engaging in sexual relations with any employee who reports to the manager or whose terms and conditions of employment are potentially affected by the manager.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Smoke-Free Environment<br /></strong> The Company will maintain and enforce a smoke-free environment and will prohibit smoking (including vaporizers, e-cigarettes, or any electronic smoking device) in all the Company offices (including all building stairwells, hallways, lunchrooms, break rooms, and restrooms) and functions.  If an employee wishes to smoke a tobacco product, he or she must do so outside of the work facility in designated smoking areas. </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company will not retaliate against an employee for invoking this policy, or for requesting management&#39;s assistance in implementing this policy in the workplace.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Employee Concerns and Advocacy</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Effective Communication of Workplace Concerns</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease supports the success and development of its employees by providing them with appropriate avenues for expressing their complaints and concerns. The company is committed to maintaining good employee relations through effective communication and the satisfactory resolution of work related issues.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee who wishes to express a complaint or concern regarding a work related problem is encouraged to resolve the issue informally through dialog with his or her immediate manager. If the employee feels that direct communication with their immediate manager is not feasible because the problem involves accusations against that manager, or because the employee is for some other reason uncomfortable discussing it with their manager, an employee may contact a higher level manager. </span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees may also contact their local People &amp; Culture representative. In addition, employees may use the employee advocacy page to view the list of P&amp;C leaders to express their concerns. </span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees should feel free to raise any issue using any of these avenues of communication without fear of coercion, discrimination, or reprisal.  There will be no retaliation against any employee for raising concerns. The Company will attempt to keep confidential all such expressions of concern, any investigation, and the terms of any resolution to the extent practicable and appropriate under the circumstances.  It should be noted, however, that during the course of investigating and resolving concerns, some dissemination of information to others may be necessary and appropriate.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Finally, employees who are not comfortable contacting those individuals may report any objectionable conduct by calling the Lendlease Confidential Hotline at (866) 513-2097.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the issue of concern to an employee involves conduct that may violate any of the Company&#39;s policies, the employee must report the conduct to People &amp; Culture, so that an appropriate investigation can be initiated. If an employee reports such conduct to a company manager, the manager is required to notify People &amp; Culture.</span></p>","sys_created_by":"hinw325","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy UK","u_last_review_date":"2024-10-14","x_caukp_ebonding_provider_id":"","roles":"","direct":"false","description":"","disable_suggesting":"false","sn_grc_target_table":"","sys_class_name":"Knowledge","article_id":"5bdae83e1b9f59106d4e986cbc4bcb0c","sys_id":"3113ede01bd51ed0d96c315bcd4bcb51","use_count":"0","flagged":"false","disable_commenting":"false","valid_to":"2025-10-14","retired":"","u_add_to_homepage":"false","u_video_url":"","display_attachments":"false","latest":"true","summary":{"display_value":"KB0020100","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_summary/644be07e1b9f59106d4e986cbc4bcbc0"},"sys_view_count":"1","revised_by":{"display_value":"Norhaniza Binti Mohd Razali","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/b8d1a1cc47716510fa3d6da7a46d436d"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"5","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"EUR","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/e268bb4f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcbcf"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2025-04-27 18:18:02","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018974","sys_updated_by":"hinw325","sys_created_on":"2025-04-20 20:52:42","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A great onboarding and induction process will set the employee up for success in their new role. It is imperative that Managers invest time in helping their new team member get settled into the Lendlease work environment and to ensure they complete all the necessary training.&nbsp; A great induction &amp; onboarding experience is also a requirement for employees moving to new roles &ndash; especially into new teams or regions. Starting in a new team for an employee can be just as challenging for those coming from another organisation.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An induction checklist has been developed to support you as a manager. There is also an employee checklist for your new starter which can be downloaded from the Induction page on ServiceNow.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As a manager, you will receive automated onboarding notifications for your new starter via Workday.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The initial notification email will be sent prior to your employee's first day, followed by notifications on their first day, day 30, day 75 and day 90. These emails will provide you with a link to the checklists for onboarding and induction, and will act as a reminder to complete the relevant activities.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Your new starter will also receive induction notifications. It is important for you to support them in completing their own activities.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Remember to maintain contact with your new starter once the written offer has been accepted.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>New Workday Onboarding module&nbsp;</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">We have launched a new module in Workday to assist with the preparation and onboarding of new starters at Lendlease.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Prior to a new starter commencing, they will have access to this module to receive key pieces of information, messages and tasks that can assist the onboarding process.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Managers need to complete the following to ensure the information and messages are correct:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Add a message to welcome the new hire</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Select people for the new hire to meet</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Complete the new hire checklist</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Complete a questionnaire to ensure activities for the new hire have been completed</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For information about how to do this, please refer to this&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/QFG%20-%20Workday%20onboarding%20manager%20tasks%20August%202021.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" title=\"one pager\">one pager</a>.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you need assistance with Workday. Please reach out to&nbsp;<a href=\"mailto:peopleconnect@Lendlease.com.au\">peopleconnect@Lendlease.com</a></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><strong>NOTE</strong></span>: This new tool is available to onboard salaried, permanent, fixed term contract employees. It does NOT include wages, casuals.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Apart from the checklists, are there any other resources to support me?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The New to Lendlease section of People Portal contains information for Managers and Employees to assist with Onboarding.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; border-right: 1.5pt solid #FFFFFF; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=bd6d36d54705a210fa3d6da7a46d432e\" alt=\"Quick Facts\" width=\"48px\" height=\"50px\"></span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; Annual leave is paid time off work which eligible employees begin to accrue from their employment commencement date.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent and fixed-term Lendlease employees are eligible to accrue annual leave. Casual employees are not entitled to annual leave.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees bound by an operative enterprise agreement to which Lendlease is the employer may have varying annual leave entitlements. Please refer to the relevant agreement for specific terms and conditions.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Job Family Frameworks have been created for a number of job families across Lendlease.&nbsp; These frameworks are designed to give you comprehensive, in-depth knowledge of the behaviours required for success, in particular roles, throughout our business.&nbsp; Select the Job Family Framework appropriate for your role to learn more.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Corporate Affairs Capability Framework</strong></span></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Corporate%20Affairs%20Capability%20Framework.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=1diAit\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" title=\"Corporate Affairs Capability Framework\">Corporate Affairs Capability Framework</a>&nbsp;defines the technical (functional knowledge, skills and experience) and behavioural (attitudes and behaviours) characteristics required by our Corporate Affairs professionals to support our businesses.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">It consists of four strategic marketing capabilities, seven specialist marketing capabilities, four operational capabilities and 4 functional capabilities.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">Design &amp; Build/PM&amp;C Capability Framewor</span>k</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Design &amp; Build/PM&amp;C Capability Framework applies to team members at all levels, including construction, operations, project team members and their managers. The content has been specifically tailored for each region in which we operate:</span></p>\r\n<table style=\"border-collapse: collapse; width: 99.9851%; height: 105px;\" border=\"1\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 22.4px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 19.6109%; font-size: 12pt;\">For capabilities that you are looking to develop, please access the 70/20/10 guides below.
