sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All positions need to be approved. Firstly, Managers should determine if the position has been budgeted for in the Operational Business Plan. If not, they should speak to their People &amp; Culture Business Partner to determine if any offline approval is required prior to submitting a job requisition.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The People &amp; Culture Matrix and Limits of Authority document determines the process for approvers.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Workday is our system used to manage the process from an initial job requisition through to onboarding new employees.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You must be a people manager with a Career and Job Framework level of PMII or above to create the job requisition.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I start recruitment?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: 494.25pt;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 0.3pt; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; PLAN &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Identify your requirement needs and discuss further with your manager.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Your P&amp;C Business Partner is available to assist you with any People &amp; Culture strategy and planning.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 0.3pt; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;PREPARE&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Think about the requirements of the role &amp; discuss with your P&amp;C Business Partner:</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Organisation details &ndash; if the new role is not within your organisational structure then you will need to know the employing entity, business unit, division and department.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Position details &ndash; this includes Career and Job Framework (CJF) information, project details (if applicable) as well as whether the role is permanent, fixed term or casual and hours required. Your P&amp;C Business Partner can provide you with more information on CJF.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A job description must be attached to the requisition to commence the recruitment process.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You should provide a rationale for recruitment and a business case.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are replacing an existing role, review the structure of the role and your team to determine if the role remains suitable to meet business results, or if changes are required.&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Compensation &ndash; discuss and finalise salary budget and any applicable allowances for the role with your manager.</span><br><br></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 0.3pt; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;ACT</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review the Quick Facts on the Job Requisition process.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You are now ready to create the Job Requisition in Workday.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Note - If your requirement is for a number of people for the same role you only need to raise one Job Requisition, with multiple positions.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 0.3pt; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;FINALISE</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once your Job Requisition is submitted it will be sent for approval based on the financial Limits of Authority.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once approved the Talent Acquisition team will contact you directly. You will then work with your Talent Acquisition Partner to create the Recruitment Action Plan</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease Capability Frameworks are designed to help you understand the capabilities you need in your role.&nbsp; Each Capability Framework describes the behaviours needed to perform at Proficiency or Job Level.&nbsp;The Lendlease Frameworks are made up of two sets.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease Capabilities &ndash; The eight capabilities that apply to all roles at all levels at Lendlease.&nbsp; No matter what role you are in, or where you work in Lendlease these are the capabilities that are critical to Lendlease success.&nbsp; You should be proficient at all these capabilities at a level appropriate to your role.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Job Family/Category Capabilities &ndash; These are the capabilities that apply to job families in Lendlease and are categorised according to Job Level</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Why are Capabilities important?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Capabilities are the underlying characteristics that people bring to their work which results in effective performance.&nbsp;&nbsp;Capability Frameworks set out the capabilities that Lendlease have identified as important for success.&nbsp;By understanding which capabilities are expected of you can perform more effectively, plan for future roles and participate in development opportunities to build your capability.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As an organisation, Lendlease can understand the capability of our people and support the growth and development of capability across all Lendlease.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What can I use the Capability Frameworks for?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Firstly, spend time understanding the Capability Frameworks that apply to your role.&nbsp; Start with understanding and developing your Lendlease Capabilities.&nbsp; These are the eight capabilities that apply to all roles at Lendlease.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Secondly, have a conversation with your manager about their expectation of capability in your role.&nbsp; Begin with the Lendlease Capabilities and if you wish to go deeper then explore the Capabilities appropriate to you in your role with the Job Family Capabilities.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once you understand the expectations in your role use the Lendlease Capability Framework to map your development plan and participate in development opportunities.&nbsp; You should aim to develop your capabilities using a mixture of experience, exposure and education.&nbsp; Use the Resources tab below to learn more.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">At Lendlease we understand that unforeseeable events occur that may require you to support and assist another family member, or to protect and secure your property.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent and fixed-term employees of Lendlease are eligible&nbsp; for paid emergency leave, subject to policy conditions. Casual employees are not entitled to paid emergency leave, however, after consultation with your manager, you may be granted unpaid time off. &nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This policy may not apply to employees covered by an enterprise agreement. Where employees are employed under the terms and conditions of an operative enterprise agreement with a Lendlease group company, employees should refer to their enterprise agreement for details on the policies and benefits.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What do I need to do to apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Notify your manager as soon as you are aware you need to take emergency leave.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you want to check your emergency leave entitlements, view the Emergency Leave Policy.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ACT</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Keep your manager informed if your absence is longer than originally discussed.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Submit your emergency leave request through Workday. &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">FINALISE</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Check your emergency leave has been approved.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; UK","u_last_review_date":"2025-03-12","x_caukp_ebonding_provider_id":"","roles":"","direct":"false","description":"","disable_suggesting":"false","sn_grc_target_table":"","sys_class_name":"Knowledge","article_id":"e1728cb9db33a850ee773313e296193f","sys_id":"349cd2ec47582ad0fa3d6da7a46d43bd","use_count":"0","flagged":"false","disable_commenting":"false","valid_to":"2026-03-12","retired":"","u_add_to_homepage":"false","u_video_url":"","display_attachments":"false","latest":"true","summary":{"display_value":"KB0019047","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_summary/6f54995e1bbf6010ef4543b4bd4bcba5"},"sys_view_count":"0","revised_by":{"display_value":"Norhaniza Binti Mohd Razali","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/b8d1a1cc47716510fa3d6da7a46d436d"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"5","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"EUR","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/e268bb4f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcbcf"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2025-02-12 01:59:41","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018838","sys_updated_by":"kohj323","sys_created_on":"2025-02-04 00:41:19","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: 403px; border-collapse: collapse; border: 1.5pt solid rgb(221, 221, 221); height: 99px;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 213.181px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Approver:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Chief People Officer&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 121.375px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Effective date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">January 2007</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">It is intended that the Lendlease, Tuition Assistance Policy (the \"Plan\") meet the requirements for qualification under Section 127 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the \"Code\"), and that benefits paid employees under the Plan be excludable from gross income to the maximum extent allowed under Code Sec. 127.</span></p>\r\n<p><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease seeks to support the ongoing education of its employees. Investment in education ensures Lendlease can:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Attract, retain and develop employees as our primary source of competitive advantage;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Continually build employee capability to execute our business strategy; and</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Ensure the future leadership of the business.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease will provide financial assistance through this Tuition Assistance policy for employees seeking an undergraduate or graduate degree. Employees receiving other financial assistance or other aid from sources other than Lendlease are not eligible to receive duplicate assistance from Lendlease.&nbsp; Lendlease will pay the difference between the covered expenses and the assistance received from the outside sources subject to annual maximums. The Company will require proof of the amount of assistance provided by other financial aids.</span><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><br></strong> </span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee must have completed a minimum of 12 months continuous service prior to the start of the course for which reimbursement is to be provided. Twelve (12) months of continuous service shall be based on most recent hire date. For rehired employees, who are re-employed with Lendlease within 1 year, the 12 months of service will be based on the Service Recognition Date.</span></p>\r\n<p><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY<br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Course Eligibility<br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">It is important to maintain your workload; failure to do so could result in the individual&rsquo;s forfeiture of this benefit and jeopardize future participation.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This policy covers courses leading to a degree that is related to the individual&rsquo;s career at Lendlease. Courses must be approved by the employee&rsquo;s direct Department Manager or Senior Leadership Team Member and People &amp; Culture&nbsp;<strong>prior to course start date</strong>. Courses must be taken at an accredited school or college and be directly related to obtaining an undergraduate or graduate degree relative to your current or future career at Lendlease.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Undergraduate and graduate degree programs and related courses will be approved for reimbursement under the Plan if they support the business needs of the Company. Courses related to certification are not a part of this Policy, however they may be paid for by the Company through the employee's departmental budget. Contact your supervisor for details regarding approval for certification courses.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The limits for each calendar year reimbursement are based on the reimbursement payment date.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Undergraduate degree is $5,250 (i.e. Associates and Bachelors) and is not taxable to the employee;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Graduate degree is $10,000 (i.e. Masters or Doctorate). The amount up to $5,250 is not taxable to the employee; amounts over $5,250 are taxable to the employee and paid through payroll on the employee's paycheck.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Pre-Approval Application Procedure<br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Prior to course registration, the employee will meet with their direct Department Manager or Senior Leadership Team Member to discuss their educational plans. Upon approval from the manager, the employee must complete the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Education%20Assistance%20Application%20Form.docx?d=w8ef00764d67d41598157e06497a7418f&amp;csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=bHQffG\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Education Assistance Form\">Education Assistance Form</a>. Upon completion of this form, upload the form into the benefits worklet in Workday.&nbsp; Once approved, the employee will be sent an email from&nbsp;<a href=\"mailto:AMERBenefits@lendlease.com\" rel=\"nofollow\">AMERBenefits@lendlease.com</a>&nbsp;outlining the next steps.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Each Department and/or local office is responsible for budgeting this expense. Note: Since this is budgeted locally by each office, each Senior Office Leader has the discretion to cap or limit the total reimbursement for their office within a fiscal year.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees will not be reimbursed for completed courses unless pre-approval and all required documents are provided.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Reimbursement Conditions<br><br></strong> Reimbursement of tuition, fees, and books at 100% (subject to annual maximum reimbursement limits) will be made upon completion of the pre-approved course with a grade \"C\" or higher, \"pass\" if not graded, or numerical equivalents.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The maximum reimbursement for each calendar year is based on payment date, not when the course is taken.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Reimbursement Process<br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee will pay for all tuition and fees up front. Upon successful completion of an approved course, the employee will complete the most recent version of the <a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Tuition%20Reimbursement%20Form%20America.docx?d=wad4cd2fbaaad44849dbd7ed74eb63fde&amp;csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=A2kLeV\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Tuition Reimbursement Form\">Tuition Reimbursement Form</a> including manager approval. The employee must submit the Tuition Reimbursement Form, course grade report, and all receipts for tuition, books and lab fees and proof of any financial assistance, to People &amp; Culture at <a href=\"mailto:AMERBenefits@lendlease.com\" rel=\"nofollow\">AMERBenefits@lendlease.com</a> within six (6) months of course completion.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once People &amp; Culture has reviewed and approved the reimbursement, instructions will be sent to the employee on how the payment will occur. If the course reimbursement is denied People &amp; Culture will notify the employee.</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For reimbursements up to $5,250, the employee will be sent an approval document to submit for reimbursement through normal expense reporting processes.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee accesses SAP Concur Website <a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/sites/Microsite-Finance\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Expenses SharePoint</a> to request reimbursement (up to $5,250 per calendar year) and upload the approval document. The employee will be reimbursed either by a separate check or direct deposit, depending on how the participant is currently set up with Accounts Payable.</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For reimbursement of amounts over $5,250 and up to $10,000, People &amp; Culture will forward the approved amount to the payroll department to be reimbursed on the employee's paycheck.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an employee terminates from Lendlease, they are not required to pay the Company back for monies that were distributed to him/her for tuition towards a degree. However, if the employee is currently taking and/or enrolled for future courses and terminates from Lendlease, they become ineligible for reimbursement. You must be an active employee to be eligible for tuition reimbursement.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Discontinuation of Plan<br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company intends to continue this Plan indefinitely. However, this Plan shall be subject to termination at any time. Any employee enrolled in an approved course at the time of discontinuation shall be reimbursed in accordance with the terms of this Plan.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SUPPORT CONTACT INFORMATION<br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Should you have any questions regarding this policy, please contact People Connect on&nbsp;+1 866 848 1200, option 2.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Download&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Tuition%20Reimbursement%20Form%20America.docx?d=wad4cd2fbaaad44849dbd7ed74eb63fde&amp;csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=PVp9gk\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Tuition Assistance policy\">Tuition Assistance policy</a>.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Access more information on the processes and procedures for&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0019094\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Tuition Assistance\">Tuition Assistance</a></span></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-bottom: 15.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; color: #222222; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">&nbsp;</span></p>","sys_created_by":"mohn407","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"x_caukp_ebonding_integration_mode":null,"can_read_user_criteria":"","active":"true","cannot_read_user_criteria":"","published":"2025-02-12","helpful_count":"1","sys_domain_path":"/","u_view_count_all":"465","version":{"display_value":"6.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_version/bf25826397235ad0ac3ad2b00153af41"},"x_caukp_ebonding_requester_id":"","meta_description":"Americas Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">MetLife&rsquo;s Critical Illness Insurance is a voluntary benefit designed to complement but not replace your current medical coverage. Critical Illness coverage provides you with a lump-sum benefit payment in the event that you or your covered dependent experience one of the covered conditions in the three distinct categories and meet the policy and certificate requirements.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE<br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As a new hire, you have the opportunity to enrol in Critical Illness Insurance (CII) during the 31-day eligibility period from your hire date. Provided you are actively at work and have medical insurance, your enrolment is guaranteed.&nbsp; Please note that this medical coverage does not necessarily have to be the medical coverage made available to you by Lendlease.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY<br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can use the lump-sum payment as you see fit, including those costs that are not covered by your existing medical coverage, such as&nbsp;experimental&nbsp;treatments, travel expenses &ndash; even childcare fees.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Call 1 800 438 6388 to speak with a MetLife Customer Service Representative (Monday Through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., Eastern Time).&nbsp; You can select the following coverage amounts for you and your dependents:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employee:&nbsp; Category benefit amount of $15,000</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Spouse/Domestic Partner:&nbsp;&nbsp; Category benefit amount of $15,000 (provided the employee enrols for coverage)</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Dependent Child(ren):&nbsp; Category benefit amount of $15,000 per dependent child (provided the employee enrols for coverage).</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To enrol in Critical Illness Insurance for any of the above Guaranteed Issue amounts (GI), go to the <a href=\"http://lendlease.hrintouch.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Benefits Center</a>.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you experience a Life Event such as marriage or birth of a baby, and you currently are enrolled in CII for yourself, you can purchase coverage for your dependent within 31 days of the life event.&nbsp; You can log onto the&nbsp;<a href=\"http://lendlease.hrintouch.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Benefits Center</a> and enrol in $15,000 Spouse/Domestic Partner GI coverage for marriage/domestic partnership or $15,000 for birth/adoption of baby.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br><br><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Critical Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Family and Medical Leave is unpaid job-protected leave provided to employees covered under the Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) for the following reasons:</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- The birth of a child;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- The placement of a child for adoption or foster care and to care for the newly placed child;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- To care for a spouse/domestic partner, child(ren) or parent with a serious health condition (see policy definitions);</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Qualifying exigency leave for families of members of the National Guard or Reserves or of a regular component of the Armed Forces when the covered military member is on covered active duty or called to covered active duty.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Salaried employees who have worked for the company for at least one year and for 1,250 hours over the previous 12 months.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Family and Medical Leave may be taken for up to 12 weeks within a 12 month period.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A 30 day advance notice may be required when the leave is 'foreseeable.'</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PLAN</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review eligibility requirements.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Read through the following resources:</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; &nbsp;FMLA General Notice Family and Medical Leave Procedure</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; Family and Medical Leave Policy</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>ACT</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Advise your manager where possible before taking leave.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Contact The Hartford's Customer Service Center at 888 301 5615 or file a Family and Medical Leave claim on The Hartford's website.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You will receive a &ldquo;Statement of Insurance Premiums&rdquo; to remit payment for any health and welfare premiums missed during unpaid FMLA.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">FINALIZE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">After filing an FMLA claim with The Hartford, you will receive a &lsquo;leave packet&rsquo;. You may be required to return information to The Hartford for an approval, so please review the packet carefully.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Who can I contact induction process we&rsquo;d like to provide you with an overview of the tools and resources to assist you in a smooth induction to our team.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What training am I required to complete during my 90-day induction?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You are required to complete the induction certification which was automatically assigned to you in Workday Learning, our online learning tool. There are a number of eLearning modules for you to complete.&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Compliance learning is a key element of your induction, designed to provide you with knowledge and skills relating to relevant laws, rules and regulations. The courses you need to complete will depend on your location and role within Lendlease.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You are also required to complete your business induction which should be arranged by your manager/team.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What is Pulse?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Pulse is our Lendlease intranet and your one-stop shop for everything you need to know about Lendlease.&nbsp; Click&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Pulse%20-%205%20Things.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=uaJ1fK\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" title=\"here\">here</a>&nbsp;to view our guide on what you need to know about Pulse.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How can I see region specific information on Pulse?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When joining Lendlease your Pulse region defaults to Australia and language to English.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are not located in Australia then it is important that you update your region so that you see region specific information when navigating People Portal.&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Additionally, you are able to change your language to either Japanese or Chinese on Pulse. Not all pages and news articles have been translated but those that have been will show in your preferred language.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To update your settings, take the Pulse Tour below.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Group People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto; border-collapse: collapse; border: 1.5pt solid #DDDDDD;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;padding-top: 0.75pt; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Function</span></strong><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Group People &amp; Culture&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;padding-top: 0.75pt; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;padding-top: 0.75pt; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Effective Date</span></strong><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">August 2013&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;padding-top: 0.75pt; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Revision Date</span></strong><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">July 2013</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;padding-top: 0.75pt; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Approved By</span></strong><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Michael Vavakis</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;padding-top: 0.75pt; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Approved Date</span></strong><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">July 2013</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Global Mobility Framework (GMF) governs the way that Lendlease supports its employees when they move across borders for extended periods of work. &nbsp;The GMF replaces the International Mobility Policy which was launched in 2002.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The framework provides direction and guidance for managers, employees and&nbsp;People &amp; Culture&nbsp;professionals to structure international assignments and transfers appropriately.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Underpinning the framework are 3 policies which define the support provided to employees in different circumstances.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;<img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=f80d02981b84b010ef4543b4bd4bcb8c\" alt=\"\" width=\"601px\" height=\"255px\" /></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Basic Principles</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Using the GMF means Mobility at Lendlease will:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">be fair and equitable, transparent and competitive in the marketplace.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">provide resourcing solutions whilst enabling talent development in growth markets.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">be perceived as a positive career differentiator and not a career risk.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">be governed by policies and processes which are cost-effective, benchmarked and implemented consistently.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">not be an opportunity to achieve personal financial advantage.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The GMF and associated policies are to be implemented across all locations in which we operate. &nbsp;Exceptions to the policies require sign off by authorised representatives in Regional and/or Global roles. &nbsp;Please refer to each individual policy for further guidance.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong> GMF - Business Decision Tree<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The GMF uses a series of questions to assess which policy is most appropriate to the circumstances. &nbsp;The decision tree below should be used by employees, line managers and P&amp;C managers to assess which policy should be used for a particular assignment. &nbsp;For full details of the assignment provisions please refer to the individual policy documents below.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=b80d02981b84b010ef4543b4bd4bcb8f\" alt=\"\" width=\"601px\" height=\"310px\" />&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Policy Changes</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company reserves the right to amend the content of the Global Mobility Framework and its associated policies from time to time.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong> REFERENCES<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: rel=\"nofollow noopener\">International Transfer Policy<br /></a> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Download&nbsp;<a Base","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_base/01125e5a1b9b685017eeebd22a4bcb44"},"meta":"Mobility","u_problem_type":null,"topic":"General","display_number":"KB0018805
