Global","u_last_review_date":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider_id":"","roles":"","direct":"false","description":"","disable_suggesting":"false","sn_grc_target_table":"","sys_class_name":"Knowledge","article_id":"ca58d0e21bebe410b03a9829bc4bcb7a","sys_id":"380d0e581b84b010ef4543b4bd4bcbc9","use_count":"0","flagged":"false","disable_commenting":"false","valid_to":"2100-01-01","retired":"","u_add_to_homepage":"false","u_video_url":"","display_attachments":"false","latest":"true","summary":{"display_value":"KB0018805","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_summary/7254595e1bbf6010ef4543b4bd4bcb72"},"sys_view_count":"7","revised_by":{"display_value":"Wendy Hinks","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/6a5918de13801a00d774fc04e144b08d"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"6","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"Global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/6878fb4f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcbae"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2024-02-29 00:07:55","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018817","sys_updated_by":"raiv416","sys_created_on":"2021-05-06 01:44:26","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: 486.0pt;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 231.05pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: top; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Approver's name and title:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Teena Hester</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Head of People &amp; Culture, Americas</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 231.05pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: top; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Effective date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">December 2017</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 231.05pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: top; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">January 2020</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 231.05pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: top; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Next review date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">January 2021</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease (the &ldquo;Company&rdquo;) will comply with the New York Paid Family Leave (NY PFL) law, which provides eligible employees on an approved NY PFL with a percentage of their average weekly wage while on the covered leave.&nbsp; &nbsp;The purpose of this policy is to provide employees with a general description of their rights under the NY PFL law.&nbsp; In the event of any conflict between this policy and the applicable law, employees will be afforded all rights required by law.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">NY PFL benefits are paid by the same insurance carrier that provides New York State disability benefits, The Hartford.&nbsp; If you have any questions regarding this policy, you must contact The Hartford(the insurer and administrator of the NY PFL benefit program) at 888.301.5615 or online at&nbsp;<a href=\"https://pulse.lendlease.com/policies/americas/people/absence/www.abilityadvantage.thehartford.com\" rel=\"nofollow\">www.abilityadvantage.thehartford.com</a>.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All Lendlease Employees in US.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>ELIGIBILITY</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Full-time employees working in New York State for 20 hours or more per week will become eligible for NY PFL after the 26th consecutive work week of employment.&nbsp; Part-time employees working less than 20 hours per week will become eligible for NY PFL after 175 working days.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees who: (1) work 20 hours or more per week but will not work 26 consecutive weeks in a 52-week period; or (2) work less than 20 hours per week but will not work 175 days in a 52 week period, may file a waiver of paid family leave benefits to exempt them from making contributions for NY PFL coverage.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees may be eligible for NY PFL benefits even if they are not eligible for leave under the FMLA.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Part-time employees are entitled to only a pro-rated percentage of the maximum NY PFL benefit available to full-time employees.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>LEAVE ENTITLEMENT AND USAGE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To qualify for job-protected NY PFL, the employee must be taking leave for one of the reasons listed below:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1.&nbsp;To bond with a new child during the first twelve months after the child&rsquo;s birth, or the first twelve months after the placement of the child for adoption or foster care with the employee;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2.&nbsp;To participate in providing care (including physical or psychological care) for a family member with a serious health condition; or</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">3.&nbsp;Because of any &ldquo;qualifying exigency&rdquo; (as interpreted under the federal Family and Medical Leave Act), due to the fact that a family member is on or has been called to active duty.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">NOTE:&nbsp; NY PFL is not available for an employee&rsquo;s own serious health condition or qualifying military event.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Under this policy, eligible employees will be entitled to NY PFL as follows:</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Beginning on January 1, 2020, eligible employees will be entitled to up to ten (10) weeks of NY PFL within any 52-week period.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Beginning January 1, 2021, eligible employees will be entitled to up to twelve (12) weeks of NY PFL within any 52-week period.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">NY PFL is only available in full day increments.&nbsp; However, it may be taken intermittently, so an employee can take only the full days off during the week when he or she is caring for a family member or bonding with a child.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Successive periods of family leave caused by the same or related injury or sickness will be considered a single period of family leave if separated by less than three months.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company will not provide the same NY PFL to two or more employees at the same time to care for the same family member.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>NY PFL BENEFIT LEVELS<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">NY PFL benefits will be increased annually until January 1, 2021. (New York State has discretion to delay the increases in certain instances.)&nbsp; Subject to any delays or changes by the State, the amount of weekly benefits paid to an eligible employee for any 52-week calendar period will be as follows:&nbsp;</span><br /></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">January 1, 2020: 10 weeks paid at 60% of the employee&rsquo;s average weekly wage or 60% of the state average weekly wage, whichever is less; and</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">January 1, 2021: 12 weeks paid at 67% of the employee&rsquo;s average weekly wage or 67% of the state average weekly wage, whichever is less.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The New York State Average Weekly Wage is set every year after an analysis by the New York Department of Labor.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees may elect (at their option) to supplement NY PFL benefits with accrued unused PTO.&nbsp; Should an employee choose to use paid PTO, the Company may request reimbursement from the employee for any NY PFL benefits the employee received from the state during that period.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PERIODS FOR WHICH NY PFL BENEFITS ARE NOT PAYABLE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees are not entitled to NY PFL benefits:</span><br /></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For any period of family leave during which the employee performed work for remuneration or profit;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For any period of family leave during which the employee is receiving total disability benefits under a claim for workers&rsquo; compensation.&nbsp; (If an employee is receiving partial disability payments under a workers&rsquo; compensation claim, the amount of NY PFL benefits combined with the benefits under state law may not exceed the employee&rsquo;s average weekly wage);&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For any period of family leave during which the employee is subject to suspension or disqualification of the accumulation of unemployment insurance benefit rights, or would be subject if he or she were eligible for such benefit rights;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For any period of family leave during which the employee is not employed or during which the employee is on administrative leave from his or her employment; and&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For any period of family leave commencing before the employee becomes eligible for benefits under the NY PFL program.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>COORDINATION THE FMLA AND THE NY STATE SHORT-TERM DISABILITY LAW<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><em><strong>FMLA</strong></em>.&nbsp; Employees who qualify for both FMLA leave and NY PFL must use leave under both statutes concurrently, and the Company will designate such leaves as running concurrently.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the Company designates a period of FMLA leave for a reason covered under the NY PFL and notifies the employee of his/her eligibility under the NY PFL but the employee declines to apply for payment, the Company will nevertheless count the period of leave against the employee&rsquo;s maximum NY PFL benefit.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee may elect (but is not required to) to use accrued vacation or sick time while receiving NY PFL in order to receive full salary during the leave period.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><em><strong>New York State Short-Term Disability Law</strong></em></span>.&nbsp; An employee&rsquo;s combined total disability leave and PFL in any 52-week period may not exceed 26 weeks.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>COORDINATION WITH THE COMPANY&rsquo;S PARENTAL LEAVE AND PARTNER LEAVE POLICIES<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any NY PFL will run concurrently with leave taken pursuant to the Company&rsquo;s Parental Leave and/or Partner Leave policies, to the extent the employee is eligible for such leaves.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company will request reimbursement of any NY PFL benefits paid to the employee for any periods of NY PFL taken that also qualify for leave under the Parental and/or Partner Leave policies.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>EMPLOYEE BENEFITS DURING LEAVE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">While an employee is on an approved NY PFL, the Company will continue the employee's healthcare coverage during the leave period at the same level and under the same conditions as if the employee had continued to work, provided the employee continues to pay his or her share of premiums during the leave. The employee must submit payment for their premiums and it must be received in the Benefits Department by the due date provided on the insurance invoice. If the payment is more than 30 days late, the employee's health care coverage may be terminated for the duration of the leave.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any employee whose healthcare coverage has lapsed during a NY PFL and who returns to work is entitled to have his or her coverage reinstated upon return to work, provided the employee provides timely payment of his or her share of premiums.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>EMPLOYEE STATUS AFTER LEAVE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee who takes leave under this policy will be restored to the same or comparable job held prior to the approved NY PFL, in accordance with the terms, conditions and requirements of the New York Paid Family Benefits Law.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>REQUIRED NOTICE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees must provide the Company / The Hartford with 30 days&rsquo; advance notice when the need for leave is foreseeable.&nbsp; If the need for leave is not foreseeable, employees must notify the Company / The Hartford as soon as practicable.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When the need for family leave is foreseeable and an employee fails to notify the Company and/or The Hartford without any special circumstances justifying the failure to provide adequate notice, the Company and/or The Hartford may delay or partially deny the request for NY PFL.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees must provide notice sufficient to make the Company and The Hartford aware of the qualifying event and the anticipated timing and duration of the leave.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>NO RETALIATION OR DISCRIMINATION</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company will not retaliate or discriminate against any employee because the employee has taken NY PFL.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>DEFINITIONS</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto; border-collapse: collapse; border: 1.5pt solid #DDDDDD;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Family Member&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">means a spouse, domestic partner (as defined below), child (as defined below), parent (as defined below), grandparent or grandchild.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Domestic Partner&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">means a person at least eighteen years of age who (i) is dependent upon the employee for support as shown by either unilateral dependence or mutual interdependence, as evidenced by a nexus of factors including, but not limited to, common ownership of real or personal property, common householding, children in common, signs of intent to marry, shared budgeting, and the length of the personal relationship with the employee or, if the employee is deceased, was so dependent upon the employee immediately prior to the employee&rsquo;s death; or (ii) has registered as the domestic partner of the employee with any registry of domestic partnerships maintained by the employer of either party, the state, or any county, city, town, or village, or if the employee is deceased, did so register prior to the employee&rsquo;s death.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Child</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">means a biological, adopted, or foster son or daughter, a stepson or stepdaughter, a legal ward, a son or daughter of a domestic partner, or the person to whom the employee stands in loco parentis.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Parent&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">means a biological, foster, or adoptive parent, a parent-in-law, a stepparent, a legal guardian, or other person who stood in loco parentis to the employee when the employee was a child.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Serious Health Condition&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">means an illness, injury, impairment, or physical or mental condition that involves (i) inpatient care in a hospital, hospice, or residential health care facility, or (ii) continuing treatment or continuing supervision by a health care provider.&nbsp; Cosmetic treatments (such as plastic surgery) are not eligible conditions unless inpatient hospital care is required or complications develop. Continuing supervision by a health care provider includes a period of incapacity which is permanent or long term due to a condition for which treatment may not be effective where the family member is under the continuing supervision of, but need not be receiving active treatment by, a health care provider.&nbsp; Ordinarily, unless complications arise, the common cold, flu, ear aches, upset stomach, minor ulcers, headaches other than migraine, routine dental or orthodontia problems, periodontal disease are examples of conditions that do not meet the definition of a serious health condition and would not qualify for PFL.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SUPPORT CONTACT INFORMATION<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Contact The Hartford's Customer Service Center at&nbsp;888.301.5615 or online at&nbsp;<a href=\"https://pulse.lendlease.com/policies/americas/people/absence/www.abilityadvantage.thehatford.com\" rel=\"nofollow\">www.abilityadvantage.thehatford.com</a>&nbsp;to file a NY PFL claim. Also contact the People Central regarding insurance premiums during NY PFL.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Questions pertaining to the understanding or explanation of Leave should be referred to the Leave Coordinator at The Hartford's Customer Service Center at 888.301.5615.</span></p>","sys_created_by":"hinw325","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"x_caukp_ebonding_integration_mode":null,"can_read_user_criteria":"","active":"true","cannot_read_user_criteria":"","published":"2021-05-06","helpful_count":"0","sys_domain_path":"/","u_view_count_all":"162","version":{"display_value":"2.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_version/8af26d8c1b443010ef4543b4bd4bcb16"},"x_caukp_ebonding_requester_id":"","meta_description":"Americas People & Culture Approver's name and title: Teena Hester Head of People & Culture, Americas","kb_knowledge_base":{"display_value":"People Connect Knowledge Base","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_base/01125e5a1b9b685017eeebd22a4bcb44"},"meta":"New York State Paid Family Leave","u_problem_type":null,"topic":"General","display_number":"KB0018817 v2.0","base_version":{"display_value":"KB0018817 v1.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge/d6f5cd2e1b232810b03a9829bc4bcb00"},"short_description":"New York State Paid Family Leave Policy - Americas","u_last_review_date":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider_id":"","roles":"","direct":"false","description":"","disable_suggesting":"false","sn_grc_target_table":"","sys_class_name":"Knowledge","article_id":"d6f5cd2e1b232810b03a9829bc4bcb00","sys_id":"38455d0c1b803010ef4543b4bd4bcbac","use_count":"0","flagged":"false","disable_commenting":"false","valid_to":"2100-01-01","retired":"","u_add_to_homepage":"false","u_video_url":"","display_attachments":"false","latest":"true","summary":{"display_value":"KB0018817","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_summary/9754995e1bbf6010ef4543b4bd4bcb22"},"sys_view_count":"4","revised_by":{"display_value":"Wendy Hinks","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/6a5918de13801a00d774fc04e144b08d"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"6","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"AMER","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/11683f0f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcbbb"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2024-02-29 00:07:55","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018799","sys_updated_by":"raiv416","sys_created_on":"2021-05-05 22:28:55","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease and its subsidiaries and affiliates (hereinafter collectively referred to as &ldquo;The Company&rdquo;) is committed to serving its clients, customers, business partners, and the public in accordance with the highest ethical standards.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong> SCOPE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All Lendlease US Employees.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Compliance with Laws, Rules and Regulations<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Obeying the law, in letter and in spirit, is the foundation on which the Company&rsquo;s ethical standards are built. All employees must respect and obey local, state, and federal laws, and the rules and regulations applicable to the Company&rsquo;s business, including, but not limited to, ensuring appropriate licenses and/or permits are obtained where applicable. Although not all employees are expected to know the details of these laws, rules, and regulations, it is important to know enough to determine when to seek advice from supervisors, managers, or other appropriate personnel who should consult with an Executive Officer as necessary or appropriate. Compliance with the law does not preclude the need to act with the highest ethical standards.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Conflicts of Interest<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Each employee must ensure that he or she is free from the influence of any conflicting interests when he or she represents the Company in negotiations or makes recommendations with respect to dealings with third parties. A &ldquo;conflict of interest&rdquo; is any circumstance that could cast doubt on an employee&rsquo;s ability to act appropriately regarding the Company&rsquo;s interest or any situation that benefits the individual to the detriment of the Company. This may include owning or operating a related or non-related business. If a potential conflict arises, you must report it immediately to the General Counsel for the applicable line of business (referred to as the &ldquo;Business General Counsel&rdquo;). Employees who are unsure whether a potential conflict has arisen and/or if employees have any questions about conflicts of interest issues, they should contact the Business General Counsel.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Giving Gifts, Entertainment and/or Services<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees are prohibited from giving, offering, or authorizing the offer, directly or indirectly, of anything of value (such as money, goods or a service) to a customer, business partner or government official to obtain any improper advantage. A business courtesy, such as a gift, contribution or entertainment, should never be offered under circumstances that might cause a conflict of interest or create the appearance of impropriety. Gifts of nominal value (AUS $150 or less) may be given if reasonable under the circumstances of the business relationship and consistent with customary business practices in the industry (e.g., lunch invitations, nominal value gifts at the holidays). Gifts exceeding the nominal amount must be approved by the Business General Counsel or another member of Executive Management. The giving of a cash gift or a check, in any amount, is strictly prohibited.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees are strictly prohibited from giving, offering, or authorizing the offer, directly or indirectly, of anything of value (such as money, goods or a service) to any federal, state or local government official and/or government employee.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an employee is not sure whether a gift or proposed gift is appropriate, he or she must discuss the matter with the Business General Counsel or another member of Executive Management.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Accepting Gifts, Entertainment and/or Services<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees are prohibited from accepting, directly or indirectly, anything of value (such as money, goods or a service) from a customer, business partner or government official. A business courtesy, such as a gift, contribution or entertainment, should never be accepted under circumstances that might cause a conflict of interest or create the appearance of impropriety. Gifts of nominal value (AUS $250 or less) may be accepted if reasonable under the circumstances of the business relationship and consistent with customary business practices in the industry (e.g., accepting a lunch or dinner invitation, tickets to theater or sporting event, or nominal value gifts at the holidays). Accepting materials from suppliers that are outside of arrangements that are made available to all employees is not allowed. Participating in employee discount programs must adhere to the program guidelines. The accepting of a cash gift or a check, in any amount, is strictly prohibited.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees are strictly prohibited from accepting, directly or indirectly, anything of value (such as money, goods or a service) from any federal, state or local government official and/or government employee.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an employee is not sure whether a gift is appropriate, he or she must discuss the matter with the Business General Counsel or another member of Executive Management.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The&nbsp;<a href=\"http://workspace.lendlease.com/L3/WS2/AMER_Gifts_ConflictofInterest_Register/SitePages/Home.aspx\" rel=\"nofollow\">Lendlease US Gift Register</a><a href=\"http://portal.lendlease.com/Business/amer_hive_doc_libs/HR/us_gift_register.aspx\" rel=\"nofollow\">&nbsp;</a>is a site for Lendlease US Employees to provide information about gifts, entertainment and/or services that have been offered to them from third parties (i.e. customer or business partner). Gifts can be anything of value such as money, goods or a service. If you have accepted or been offered a gift with a value more than $300 please disclose the gift here. Although strictly prohibited by Lend Lease policy, we ask that you disclose any gifts offered to you by any government officials and/or government employees. Such gifts should also be disclosed on the Lendlease US Gift Register.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Political Contributions<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company supports active participation in the political process and encourages its employees to become involved in civic affairs and to participate in the political process by supporting the candidates and issues of their choice. Employees must understand, however, that their involvement and participation must be on an individual basis, on their own time, and at their own expense. There are specific restrictions imposed on the Company by federal and state law with respect to its political contributions. Accordingly, no employee may expend or employ the Company's funds or facilities, directly or indirectly, on behalf of any political organization, campaign or candidate for public office, except with the express written permission of the Business General Counsel before going to the <strong>Chief Executive Officer of the business line for final approval.<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Reimbursement for fund-raising events for candidates or political organizations is prohibited. Personal services on behalf of a candidate, political organization or campaign on the Company&rsquo;s time may be deemed contributions and are therefore prohibited. This policy has no effect on voluntary political service on personal time.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Contract Negotiations<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In negotiating contracts, employees must be accurate and complete in all representations. The submissions to a client, including any domestic or foreign federal, state, or local government, of a proposal, quotation, or other document or statement that is false, incomplete, or misleading can result in civil and/or criminal liability for the Company, the involved employee, and any managers who condone such a practice. In negotiating contracts with any domestic or foreign federal, state, or local government, the Company has an affirmative duty to disclose current, accurate, and complete cost or pricing data where such data is required under appropriate law or regulation.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Antitrust Laws<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company requires strict adherence to all antitrust laws. Such laws exist in the United States, the European Union, and in many other countries where the Company does business. Antitrust laws deal with agreements and practices in restraint of trade, such as price fixing; limiting supplies; dividing or allocating markets, territories, or customers; boycotting of suppliers or customers; disparaging or harassing a competitor; misrepresentation; stealing trade secrets; bribery; tying; and kickbacks.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Antitrust laws are vigorously enforced. Violations may result in severe penalties such as forced sales of parts of businesses, significant fines against a company, substantial fines against individual employees and prison sentences. Employees involved in any dealings with competitors are expected to know that the United States and other countries&rsquo; antitrust laws may apply to their activities and to consult with Business General Counsel prior to negotiating with or entering into any arrangement with a competitor.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Bidding and Performance<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees of the Company must comply with the laws and regulations that pertain to the acquisition of goods and services by our customers. The Company will compete fairly and ethically for all business opportunities. In circumstances where there is reason to believe that the release or receipt of non-public information is unauthorized, the Company shall not attempt to obtain and will not accept such information from any source.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Appropriate steps should be taken by employees to recognize and avoid organizational conflicts in which one business unit's activities may preclude the pursuit of a related activity by another Company business unit.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the Company is involved in proposals, bid preparations, or contract negotiations, employees must be certain that all statements, communications, and representations to prospective customers are accurate and truthful. Once awarded, all contacts must be performed in compliance with specifications, requirements, and clauses unless appropriate modifications or waivers are obtained.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company requires the maintenance of accurate and auditable records of all financial transactions in compliance with generally accepted accounting principles. No false or deceptive entries may be made, and all entries must contain an appropriate description of the underlying transaction. All Company funds must be retained in corporate bank accounts and no undisclosed or unrecorded fund or asset shall be established for any purpose. Further, all reports, vouchers, bills, invoices, payroll records, service records, and other essential data must be prepared with accuracy, care, and integrity.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Confidentiality<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Information regarding the Company&rsquo;s operations, planning, and financial status, both short and long term, must be kept confidential unless an authorized executive in the appropriate department within the Company decides otherwise and authorizes the release of such information in writing. Employees must maintain the confidentiality of confidential and proprietary information entrusted to them by the Company&rsquo;s customers, clients, or business partners, except when disclosure is authorized by the Chief Executive Officer, Chief Operating Officer or Chief Financial Officer or required in writing by laws or regulations. Employees may not disclose any financial information without the prior approval of an Executive Officer.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company and its employees must cooperate with appropriate government inquiries and investigations. In this context, however, it is important to protect the legal rights of the Company with respect to its confidential information. All government inquiries and requests for information, documents, or investigative interviews (whether in person, by telephone, email, or written correspondence) must be referred to Business General Counsel, who is responsible for coordinating a response.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Upon termination of your employment for any reason, you are required to immediately return to the Company all Confidential Information then remaining in your possession. Without limiting the foregoing, employees who leave employment with the Company are further obligated to continue to recognize and uphold the confidentiality and proprietary nature of all Confidential Information acquired during the course of employment with the Company.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In the event of any disclosure of Confidential Information in violation of the foregoing provisions, the Company would be irreparably and immediately harmed and could not be made whole by monetary damages. Therefore, in the event of any breach or threatened breach by an employee of this policy on Confidential Information, the Company shall be entitled to injunctive and/or other preliminary or equitable relief without any requirement for the securing or posting of any bond in connection with such remedy, in addition to any other remedies available at law or in equity. Without limiting the foregoing, any breach or violation of the Company&rsquo;s policy on Confidential Information is grounds for immediate disciplinary action, including, without limitation, termination of your employment.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For those departments working with Confidential Information, at the end of the day and on weekends all such materials must be placed in secure, locked files. All legal and financial documents must be locked securely in file cabinets.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All confidential computer and electronic files should be protected using passwords or other security tools. Additionally, users of the Internet or other networks are responsible for their activities on the network. Moreover, these networks should only be used for purposes that benefit the Company. Transmission of any material in violation of any U.S. or state laws or regulations is strictly prohibited.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are unsure if something constitutes Confidential Information, or if you have any questions regarding this policy or your responsibilities in dealing with Confidential Information, please ask a member of Senior Management.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Privacy<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company collects various personal data necessary for lawful Human Resources Administration and Management. The information contained in personnel records is treated as confidential. All requests for information on current or former employees must be referred to the People &amp; Culture Department.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To the extent permitted by local laws we may use and disclose your personal data to carry out appropriate business related checks. We may also share your name and business contact information with our business partners (e.g. joint ventures) and clients and other third parties such as our professional advisers for the purpose of carrying on business. If appropriate we may also disclose your personal data to our professional advisers, including legal advisers and auditors, for the purpose of obtaining professional services from them for our business related purposes. Future reference information given by phone or in writing will be limited to verification of employment dates and position title. In response to written requests (e.g. mortgage applications, etc.), information such as salary, dates of employment, job history, and position may be provided, if an authorization signed by the employee is provided.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As a global organization with global People &amp; Culture functions and facilities, the Company will transfer employee&rsquo;s personal and sensitive data worldwide among our group companies for the purposes of benefits and payroll administration, job transfers, etc. If there is a change in any personal information, employees should notify People &amp; Culture. It is very important that records are kept current to provide employees with correct pay and benefits and to contact the appropriate person in case of an emergency. We may keep your personal data and that of other individuals which you provide to us for a reasonable period in accordance with legal requirements if you cease to be employed by us.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an employee wishes to review his or her personnel records, he or she should contact a People &amp; Culture Representative.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>REFERENCE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"http://workspace.lendlease.com/L3/WS2/AMER_Gifts_ConflictofInterest_Register/SitePages/Home.aspx\" rel=\"nofollow\">Lendlease US Gift 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Effective date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">January 2018</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 231.05pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: top; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">August 2018</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 231.05pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: top; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Next review date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">January 2020</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This Lendlease policy relates to employees and new hires that are requested to permanently relocate.&nbsp; There is a separate policy related to temporary relocations that does not involve asking the employee to change their current housing situation.&nbsp; The policy that relates to temporary relocation is called Out-of-Town Living (OTL) and requires the individual to maintain duplicate living arrangements.&nbsp; It is not anticipated that relocation benefits would be used in conjunction with OTL. Therefore be sure to understand the purposes of both policies when deciding on which approach is correct.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Relocations consider employee assignments, client and business needs, length of assignment, proximity to employee&rsquo;s home, and various other factors.&nbsp; All reimbursements are made and reported in accordance with the prevailing income tax laws.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Eligible Employees<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All employees asked by the company to permanently relocate themselves, spouse/domestic partner or their family due to an assignment in a new city may be eligible for relocation benefits.&nbsp; Under special circumstances only, newly hired employees will also be eligible for relocation benefits as part of a new hire package.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">While relocation benefit items will be granted according to each individual situation, items in the Standard area require normal approvals and items in the Non-Standard area require additional, higher-level, approvals. All approvals for relocation are granted as part of the Workday process.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Pre-approval<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Relocation Authorization Form must be completed and uploaded into the Offer, Promotion or Job Change within Workday. Workday approvals will also cover the proposed relocation details. Once all required approvals are obtained and the individual has signed their offer and relocation repayment agreement, the Mobility Specialist will be notified and the relocation process may begin. The expenses associated with employee relocation will be charged to the receiving cost center unless specified otherwise.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Approved relocation expenses paid directly by the company to the relocation vendors will be sent directly to the Mobility Specialist. The Mobility Specialist will coordinate payment of the invoice and coordinate needed imputes or gross-ups for tax with the Lendlease Payroll group.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Relocation%20Authorization%20Form%20-%20Final%20Version.doc?d=wf05c092f4219423da72a960638e30986&amp;csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=cwCCeb\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Relocation Authorization Form\">Relocation Authorization Form<br /></a> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Reimbursement<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Approved relocation expenses not directly paid by the company will be reimbursed to the employee. Requests for expense reimbursements, if on the employee&rsquo;s Corporate Credit Card, must be submitted by the employee in the R-12 financial services system as expense reports. Requests for expense reimbursements of approved items paid by cash or on an employee&rsquo;s personal check or credit card, may be reimbursed on a Relocation Reimbursement Request Form and then forwarded to the Mobility Specialist for processing.&nbsp; If requested reimbursements include items that are an exception and/or have not been approved, then reimbursements will not be made until proper approvals have been obtained.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Relocation items paid directly by the company and that require impute into income and/or tax details to be handled, will also be coordinated through Lendlease Payroll by the Mobility Specialist.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Relocation%20Reimbursement%20Request%20Form%20(002).xls?d=w07d0daf587b34240880d41e8d3ca19a0&amp;csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=LpA4gb\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Relocation Reimbursement Form\">Relocation Reimbursement Form<br /></a> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Reimbursable Relocation Expenses<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Eligible employees may be reimbursed for some or all of the following relocation expenses based on the conditions of their new assignment.&nbsp; Each employee&rsquo;s relocation items may be different depending on the situation and are requested and approved by the Management of that area.&nbsp;<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">No items are automatically granted</span>&nbsp;and the specifics of any particular item may be limited to specific instructions as listed by the department.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Gross-Up For Taxes&nbsp;</strong>&ndash; If approved, the Company may gross up any taxable relocation expenses at the supplemental withholding rates to help offset tax liabilities associated with taxable relocation benefits.</span><br /><br /><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Standard Relocation Items &ndash; require normal Workday Approval:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>House Hunting Trips</strong>&nbsp;-The Company may reimburse the costs associated with a trip to the new location by the employee and spouse/domestic partner for the purpose of locating a new house or apartment.&nbsp; This may be a maximum of 2 trips and includes round-trip transportation (coach or economy class), three (3) meals per day, rental car, if needed, and overnight accommodations for combined total of up to five (5) nights.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Transportation of Personal/Household Goods</strong>&nbsp;-For permanent moves the company may pay the reasonable cost of moving an employee's household goods up to the weight limit that is determined by the employee's family status.&nbsp; Packing, shipping, unpacking and insurance will be provided by the Company's contracted mover.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Transportation of Automobile&nbsp;</strong>- If the employee's move is over 500 miles, the cost of transporting up to two (2) automobiles may be paid by the Company.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Mileage Allowance&nbsp;</strong>- If the relocating employee chooses to drive his/her personal automobile to the new location, mileage allowance for the one-way trip may be reimbursed at the current applicable business mileage reimbursement rate.&nbsp; Contact the Accounts Payable department for the current rate set by the IRS.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Temporary Accommodation</strong> - Hotel/Apartment An employee may not be able to move into new living quarters immediately upon arrival at the new location.&nbsp; The Company may reimburse reasonable hotel or furnished apartment costs for a limited period of time not to exceed sixty (60) continuous calendar days commencing on the first day of living in temporary quarters.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Storage of Household Goods</strong>&nbsp;- Storage of household goods at the new location may be provided while the employee is living in temporary quarters and looking for permanent housing.&nbsp; The Company may pay storage expenses for a limited period of time, not to exceed sixty (60) continuous calendar days commencing on the first day household goods are placed into storage.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Reimbursement of Incidental Expenses</strong>&nbsp;&ndash; Typically set at a net of $1,000 for reimbursement of items related to the relocation. Examples are for meals (except those covered separately by house hunting trip), utility hook-up fees, taxis, car registration fees, etc.</span></p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Non-Standard Relocation Expense Items &ndash; require normal Workday Approval, plus approvals by Managing Director and Head of People &amp; Culture, Americas:</span></strong><br /><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">(All approved Non-Standard Relocation items will automatically be grossed-up to cover tax liability, unless otherwise instructed.)</span></strong><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Closing Costs</strong>&nbsp;- The Company may reimburse some or all of the costs associated with selling a current residence and the costs associated with buying a new residence.&nbsp; These costs include, but are not limited to, attorney fees, title searches, applicable inspections, etc. A maximum dollar amount is normally requierd to be set for this.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Realtor Commissions</strong>&nbsp;-The fee paid by the employee to the realtor for selling their house, typically 6% of the selling price, may be reimbursed by the Company. A maximum dollar amount is normally required to be set for this.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Unexpired Home/Apartment Lease</strong>&nbsp;- If an employee is requested to relocate prior to the expiration date of their current rental lease, the Company may reimburse the cost of any penalty associated with termination of that lease. If under $2,000, this may be approved as part of Standard Relocation approval levels. Otherwise, it must receive Non-Standard Relocation approvals. A maximum dollar amount is normally required to be set for this.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Temporary Accommodation (Hotel/Furnished Apartment)</strong>&nbsp;- Approval in excess of 60 days. Specific length of time should be specified.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Storage of Household Goods</strong>&nbsp;- Approval in excess of 60 days. Specific length of time must be specified.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Lump Sum Relocation Allowance</strong>&nbsp;- A discretionary one-time lump sum payment.&nbsp; This can be used towards the actual move, settling-in costs (such as setting up utilities, applying for driver&rsquo;s license, etc.) closing costs, etc. If net $4,000 or less, and no other relocation items, are being provided, this may be approved as part of Standard Relocation approval levels. Otherwise, it must receive Non-Standard Relocation approvals. Higher supplemental tax rates apply to the entire amount of any lump sum relocation payment. This should be considered when setting as a net payment amount (LL grossing up the payment amount to cover tax liability) or a gross payment amount (LL reducing the payment amount by the required tax liability).</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Transportation of Household Goods - Detail<br /></strong> &nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The company has a contract with two nationwide carriers and will coordinate the household goods move through the Mobility Specialist.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once all approvals are completed, the Mobility Specialist will contact the relocating employee to discuss the specifics related to the move. Afterward, the Mobility Specialist will have a representative of the carrier contact the relocating employee in order to schedule a date for the assessment of their household goods and gather all information necessary for the cost estimate.&nbsp; The estimate will include move date, approximate weight, packing needs, and van space required for the move.&nbsp; The household goods estimate will typically be sent to the Mobility Specialist. The employee should not contact the company- approved moving companies on their own until the Mobility Specialist initiates contact.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Authorized Expenses<br /></strong></span></p>\r\n<ol style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Transportation of household furnishings from point of origin to point of destination by authorized carrier.&nbsp; The Company reserves the right to limit the weight of goods that will be paid for. This is based on the employee's family relocation status.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If only the single employee will be relocating, the household goods weight limit is set at 6,000 lbs.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the employee is relocating with a spouse/domestic partner and/or family, the household goods weight limit is set at 16,000 lbs.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Full packing and unpacking.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Servicing of washers, stereos, ice makers or other items as determined by the carrier that need special servicing.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Storage costs of household goods will be provided up to sixty (60) days with prior approval from relocation authorization form.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Special crating of objects where deemed necessary for protection of household goods.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Cost of transporting up to two (2) autos may be allowed if the employee is moving over 500 miles.&nbsp; Mileage allowance will be payable at the current business mileage reimbursement rate for driving a personal auto to new location.&nbsp; Contact the Accounts Payable department for the current rate.&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n</ol>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Non-authorized Items<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The company will not reimburse an employee for expenses related to any of the following items:</span><br /></p>\r\n<ol style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Pets, livestock, or animals of any kind.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Boats, campers, airplanes, trailers, farm tractors, etc.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Firewood</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Bricks, blocks, lumber, or other building supplies.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Plants, flowers, or shrubbery of any kind.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Frozen food.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Labor charges for disassembly or reassembly of swing sets, storage sheds, or similar playground or yard equipment.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Maid service or house-cleaning charges.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Third party work by plumbers, electricians, carpenters, etc.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The carrier is prohibited by ICC rules from carrying explosives, perishables, combustible items, paints, etc.</span></li>\r\n</ol>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">IMPORTANT</span></strong><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>THE COMPANY WILL NOT BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE DAMAGE OR LOSS OF VALUABLES.</strong>&nbsp; Valuables such as jewelry, precious stones, stamp collections, wills, stocks, trading stamps, furs or other articles of extraordinary value must be moved by the employee.&nbsp; The carrier is prohibited from carrying them.&nbsp; If any of these items are found in the carrier's possession without their knowledge, they will not assume any liability for loss or damage of these items.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any charges or services not approved in advance will be at the employee's expense.</span><br /><br /><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Relocation Repayment Agreement</span></strong><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As stated in the required Relocation Repayment Agreement for all existing and new hire employees:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>General<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee should secure a clear understanding of the requirements and conditions of the move, such as mode of transportation, estimated time en route, etc.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee, or a designated representative, must be home when packing, loading and unloading is performed.&nbsp; The employee will be asked to sign a copy of the inventory at origin and will be furnished a copy of the same.&nbsp; The employee will be able at that time to verify any notations regarding scars, scuffs, gouges, dents, scratches, etc., and verify that the articles on the inventory confirm the articles being shipped.&nbsp; This is the employee's agreement that it is complete and correct.&nbsp; The employee will be asked to sign the same inventory after delivery to confirm that all items were received and in good condition.&nbsp; If any items were lost or damaged, they must be noted at time of delivery.&nbsp; Failure to do so may result in employee not being paid for these items.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Each employee must file his/her own damage claim.&nbsp; Therefore, claims should be filed directly with the moving company within the time specified on the moving agreement.&nbsp; The moving companies will send information relative to insurance coverage and filing damage claims to the employee.&nbsp; In the event that the employee feels his/her settlement is not being handled promptly or fairly, he/she should contact the Mobility Specialist who will attempt to resolve the dispute.</span><br /><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Income Tax Status of Provided or Reimbursed Moving Expenses<br /></strong> &nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The following is an effort to help our employees understand the income tax implications of the reimbursement of relocation expenses:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Income Tax Impact<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">With the new income tax law changes effective in January 2018, all relocation benefits provided are now taxable. As required by IRS regulations, all amounts paid on behalf of, or reimbursed to, the employee must be reported as income on the employee's W-2.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Amounts paid to an employee may, based on the Relocation Authorization Form approvals, be grossed up at the supplemental tax withholding rates to help offset any tax liability associated with the relocation. All expenses and reimbursements must be documented with receipts.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Access more information on the processes and procedures for&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018737\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Relocation&nbsp;Benefits\">Relocation&nbsp;Benefits</a></span></p>","sys_created_by":"hinw325","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"x_caukp_ebonding_integration_mode":null,"can_read_user_criteria":"","active":"true","cannot_read_user_criteria":"","published":"2021-05-06","helpful_count":"1","sys_domain_path":"/","u_view_count_all":"321","version":{"display_value":"2.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_version/4bf26d8c1b443010ef4543b4bd4bcbbf"},"x_caukp_ebonding_requester_id":"","meta_description":"Americas People & Culture Approver's name and title: Teena Hester Head of People & Culture, Americas","kb_knowledge_base":{"display_value":"People Connect Knowledge Base","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_base/01125e5a1b9b685017eeebd22a4bcb44"},"meta":"Relocation","u_problem_type":null,"topic":"General","display_number":"KB0018834 v2.0","base_version":{"display_value":"KB0018834 v1.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge/72f3a5261b272810b03a9829bc4bcbb8"},"short_description":"Relocation Policy - Americas","u_last_review_date":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider_id":"","roles":"","direct":"false","description":"","disable_suggesting":"false","sn_grc_target_table":"","sys_class_name":"Knowledge","article_id":"72f3a5261b272810b03a9829bc4bcbb8","sys_id":"3c00a1cc1b043010ef4543b4bd4bcb60","use_count":"0","flagged":"false","disable_commenting":"false","valid_to":"2100-01-01","retired":"","u_add_to_homepage":"false","u_video_url":"","display_attachments":"false","latest":"true","summary":{"display_value":"KB0018834","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_summary/7344555e1bbf6010ef4543b4bd4bcb7b"},"sys_view_count":"1","revised_by":{"display_value":"Wendy Hinks","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/6a5918de13801a00d774fc04e144b08d"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"6","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"AMER","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/11683f0f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcbbb"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2024-02-29 00:07:56","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018752","sys_updated_by":"raiv416","sys_created_on":"2021-05-03 02:57:09","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Changing your name requires relevant legal documentation and&nbsp;the request is made in Workday. To request a name change simply follow the steps below.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What steps do I need to take?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Source copies of either your certified marriage certificate or other legal proof of your name change to provide as evidence.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; Upload any evidence as required.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; Lendlease</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">The world of work has changed.&nbsp;Work is now increasingly virtual, mobile, collaborative and project based, creating more choices for&nbsp;when,&nbsp;where&nbsp;and even&nbsp;how&nbsp;it gets done. Traditional career pathways involved ascending a &lsquo;corporate ladder&rsquo; through promotion. Today, career paths are multidirectional, with moves across as well as up and down.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">To drive your career at Lendlease, you need to look for opportunities that will help you achieve new skills, increase your capability and gain experiences in different areas.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Be responsible for your own development</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Actively manage your development plan throughout the year.</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Utilise the resources available to you.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\"><strong><br /><span style=\"color: #169179;\">Workday Learning</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Workday Learning is the learning platform that sits within the Workday suite.
