font-size: 12pt;\">FINALISE</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You must pay for your course and any applicable related study expenses up front and retain the original invoice(s).</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once you have successfully completed the subject/ course and you can provide documentation to support this, you may apply for reimbursement up to the amount specified in your return of service agreement.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If there is a change of course date, course cancellation or you fail to attend the course for any reason, you must inform People Connect.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Upon completion of your study, please notify your line manager in writing provide a copy of your certificate (e.g. Masters Certificate) for records.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply for education assistance reimbursement?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PLAN</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Read the Education Assistance Policy including the reimbursement conditions.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PREPARE</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Source copies of your invoices and academic transcript (demonstrating that you have passed).&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>ACT</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Submit a claim through Finance, attaching Education Assistance request form, the relevant invoices and academic transcript to show that you have passed the subject/ course.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Select study reimbursement as the expense type.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Enter the study sponsorship application reference number in the justification field. Please note that a signed return of service agreement must be presented to Finance upon request.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Contact Finance if you require assistance.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>FINALISE</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once approved you will be reimbursed the relevant amount in the next pay run. &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I approve Education Assistance? (People Managers only)</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;To view the criteria and entitlement for education assistance, please read the policy in the resources section below.</span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;<strong>PREPARE</strong> &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">It is the responsibility of the employee, not the people manager, to initiate a discussion about education assistance. Once you have had this conversation with your employee, organise a follow up meeting to check if all eligibility criteria is met.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You will need to have a discussion with your own manager to obtain their approval in principle before an application is made.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Confirm the decision with your employee and guide them to this section on ServiceNow.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You will be able to review and approve or reject the request via Workday.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can choose to take an Unpaid Personal Leave of Absence (UPLOA) due to personal reasons for more than one month and up to a maximum of six months.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For an unpaid leave of absence request of less than 30 days, refer to the Unpaid Short Term Personal&nbsp;Leave of Absence Policy.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All active, salaried employees scheduled to work 30 or more hours per week.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Benefits are not continued during an Unpaid Personal Leave of Absence and COBRA will be offered where eligible.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees must use all accrued Paid Time Off (PTO) prior to the start of the unpaid personal&nbsp;leave of absence.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review the eligibility requirements above.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Read through the unpaid personal leave of absence (UPLOA) Policy.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Discuss request for unpaid personal leave of absence with your manager to gain approval to apply for leave at least 30 days prior to the start of the requested leave date.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Complete the leave of absence request form and enter your leave request in Workday.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Your manager will approve through Workday.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Send a copy of the completed and approved form to&nbsp;<a href=\"mailto:AmerBenefits@lendlease.com\">AmerBenefits@lendlease.com</a></span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Questions regarding an UPLOA</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have any questions regarding this benefit please contact People Connect on 866-848-1200 and select option two or ask People Connect online using the button on the top right hand corner of this page.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td Global","u_last_review_date":"2025-03-04","x_caukp_ebonding_provider_id":"","roles":"","direct":"false","description":"","disable_suggesting":"false","sn_grc_target_table":"","sys_class_name":"Knowledge","article_id":"a55890e21bebe410b03a9829bc4bcb38","sys_id":"4fa6ffb5974caa9072b954800153af8e","use_count":"0","flagged":"false","disable_commenting":"false","valid_to":"2026-03-04","retired":"","u_add_to_homepage":"false","u_video_url":"","display_attachments":"false","latest":"true","summary":{"display_value":"KB0018794","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_summary/7154d55e1bbf6010ef4543b4bd4bcbe5"},"sys_view_count":"0","revised_by":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"5","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"Global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/6878fb4f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcbae"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2024-02-29 00:05:35","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018816","sys_updated_by":"raiv416","sys_created_on":"2021-05-05 22:40:41","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto; border-collapse: collapse; border: 1.5pt solid #DDDDDD;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;padding-top: 0.75pt; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Approver's name and title:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Teena Hester</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Head of People &amp; Culture, Americas</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;padding-top: 0.75pt; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Effective date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">April 2011</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;padding-top: 0.75pt; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Reviewed date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">August 2017</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;padding-top: 0.75pt; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Next review date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">August 2018</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any Salaried employee who is voluntarily or involuntarily on &ldquo;Active Duty&rdquo; in the &ldquo;Uniformed Services&rdquo; will be granted military leave and reemployment rights for a period of up to 5 years, or longer if required by law, in accordance with the&nbsp;<a href=\"http://www.dol.gov/vets/programs/userra/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Uniformed Services Employment and Reemployment Rights Act of 1994</a>, as amended (USERRA).</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any Salaried employee who is voluntarily or involuntarily on &ldquo;Active Duty&rdquo; in the &ldquo;Uniformed Services&rdquo;.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any Salaried employee who is voluntarily or involuntarily on &ldquo;Active Duty&rdquo; in the &ldquo;Uniformed Services&rdquo; will be granted military leave and reemployment rights for a period of up to 5 years, or longer if required by law, in accordance with the Uniformed Services Employment and Reemployment Rights Act of 1994, as amended (USERRA).&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Active Duty includes:</span></strong></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Active duty</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Active duty for training</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Inactive duty training</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Absence from work for an examination to determine a person(s) fitness for any of the above types of duty funeral honors duty performed by National Guard or reserve members</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Service as an intermittent disaster-response appointee upon activation of the National Disaster Medical System (NDMS), or authorized training for same</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Uniformed Services includes:</span></strong><br /><br /></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">United States Army</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">United States Air Force</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">United States Marine Corps</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">United States Coast Guard</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Army and Air National Guard</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">National Guard duty under federal statute</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Public Health Service Commissioned Corps</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">State-organized militia, if required by state law</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Non-Discrimination<br /><br /></strong> No employee or prospective employee will be subjected to any form of employment discrimination or retaliation based on performing Active Duty in the Uniformed Services.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Notification of Leave<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When scheduling military leave, employees should provide their Department Heads with a copy of their military orders.&nbsp; Employees should notify their Department Heads of any such obligations as far in advance as possible so that arrangements can be made.&nbsp; Employees will need to complete the Leave of Absence Request form and submit it to the Benefits Department along with a copy of the military orders.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Paid Leave<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Basic Military Pay<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If, at the time the employee requests military leave, the employee&rsquo;s military leave for Active Duty in the Uniformed Services is formally scheduled for a period of 2 weeks or less at the time the employee requests the military leave, then the employee is eligible for continuation of the employee&rsquo;s full base pay, less any deductions required by applicable law, during the leave for a maximum of 2 weeks per calendar year.&nbsp; A maximum of 2 weeks of this &ldquo;basic military pay&rdquo; will be paid for one military leave, even if an employee&rsquo;s military leave extends into a second calendar year; and for this purpose only, two or more separate military leaves that commence within the same calendar year will be considered a single military leave.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Supplemental Military Pay<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If, at the time the employee requests military leave, the employee&rsquo;s military leave for Active Duty in the Uniformed Services is formally scheduled for a period that is more than 2 weeks, then Lendlease will pay the employee supplemental military pay as a supplement to the employee&rsquo;s Military Pay.&nbsp; The period covered by this supplemental military pay will start at the beginning of week 3, and will end 18 months following the date the employee&rsquo;s leave began or, if earlier, on the date the employee is no longer on military leave for Active Duty in the Uniformed Services.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Supplemental military pay is the pay added to the employee&rsquo;s Military Pay to maintain the normal base pay that the employee was receiving from Lendlease just prior to the leave.&nbsp; The amount of this &ldquo;supplemental military pay&rdquo; will be the employee&rsquo;s normal base pay from Lendlease at the time the leave begins, less any deductions required by applicable law, and less Military Pay received by the employee.&nbsp;</span><br /></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&ldquo;Military Pay&rdquo; is defined as an employee&rsquo;s base pay from the Uniformed Services plus any allowances for longevity, ratings, special qualifications or hazardous duty.&nbsp; It does not include subsistence, quarters, travel or uniform allowances.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee will provide written evidence satisfactory to Lendlease on a regular basis of the amount of Military Pay received.&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease will pay supplemental military pay in the same manner and on the same schedule as pay for a similarly-situated active employee, commencing with the applicable payroll date immediately following the date the employee&rsquo;s leave begins.&nbsp; However, supplemental military pay will not begin until Lendlease receives satisfactory evidence of the amount of the employee&rsquo;s payments of military pay and military orders, and payment of any amounts that otherwise would have been paid under this policy before that information is delivered (if that information had been provided timely) will be delayed until Lendlease receives such evidence at which time all such missed payments will be paid in a lump sum; provided, to the extent necessary to satisfy Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code with respect to any amounts subject to that section, all or a part of such missed payments will be forfeited.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Employees on Military Leave at Effective Date of this Policy<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any employee who currently is on Active Duty in the Uniformed Services as of the effective date of this policy will be paid the amount due under this policy as if this policy had been in effect on the date the employee&rsquo;s Active Duty in the Uniformed Services began.&nbsp; Payment to any such employee will begin 30 days after the effective date of this policy; however, any payments that would have been due before that commencement date will be paid in a single lump sum 30 days after the effective date of this policy.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Application for Reemployment<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As consideration for providing an employee with this supplemental military pay and the subsidized group health benefits (as described below), Lendlease expects an employee who receives this pay and these benefits to apply for reemployment when his or her military leave ends.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Employment Status While on Military Leave<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee receiving supplemental military pay will be placed on &ldquo;paid military leave of absence greater than 2 weeks&rdquo; status.&nbsp; This status in the payroll system will not exceed 18 months.&nbsp; If an employee&rsquo;s military leave extends beyond the 18-month period, the employee&rsquo;s status will be changed to &ldquo;unpaid leave of absence&rdquo; status in the payroll system for the remainder of the period during which the employee remains on military leave but not longer than the remainder of the period during which he has reemployment rights required by USERRA (generally 5 years).&nbsp; If the employee does not return to employment by the applicable deadline provided under the section &ldquo;Application for Reemployment&rdquo; below, the employee&rsquo;s status will be changed to &ldquo;terminated&rdquo;, and the employee will have no further reemployment rights.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Benefits<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Change in Status<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee commencing or returning from military leave experiences a change in status and can change his or her elections regarding health and welfare benefits, as permitted under Lendlease&rsquo;s cafeteria plan documents.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>During First 30 Days of Military Leave<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease will continue all health and welfare benefits for an employee and the employee&rsquo;s covered dependents based on the same terms and conditions as regular active employees until through the last day of the month coincident with or following the 30th day of the military leave.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">After First 30 Days of Military Leave (&ldquo;extended military leave&rdquo;)</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Health Benefits<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee, employee&rsquo;s covered spouse/domestic partner and/or dependents may elect to continue their group health benefits (i.e., medical, dental, vision and EAP coverage) for up to 24 months after these benefits otherwise end, as provided in the prior paragraph.&nbsp; This coverage is available under both USERRA and COBRA, and the coverage under each will run concurrently.&nbsp; The employee, the employee&rsquo;s covered spouse/domestic partner and/or dependents will receive a notice of the opportunity to elect to continue their group health benefits from the COBRA Administrator for the group health benefits.&nbsp; If the employee, the employee&rsquo;s covered spouse/domestic partner and/or dependents wish to continue their group health benefits, they will need to elect the coverage by completing an election form and returning it to the COBRA Administrator.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The cost of this coverage during the initial 18 months of continuation coverage (or if shorter, the period during which the employee is on military leave for Active Duty in the Uniformed Services) will be the rate paid by similarly-situated active employees for the cost of group health benefits.&nbsp; For the remaining period of continuation coverage, the cost will be 102% of the total cost of coverage, including both Lendlease&rsquo;s cost and the employee&rsquo;s cost.&nbsp; The payments will be made on an after-tax basis by sending a monthly check to the COBRA Administrator.&nbsp; The group health benefits will terminate if the payments are not made in a timely manner.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Health Care Spending Account<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A covered employee and his or her spouse and dependents may continue participation in the health care spending account plan for up to 24 months.&nbsp; This coverage is available under both USERRA and COBRA, and the coverage under each will run concurrently.&nbsp; The same procedures for electing and paying for the health benefits apply for the continuation of the health care spending account plan, and the payments will be made on an after-tax basis.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Dependent Care Spending Account<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee on extended military leave may not make contributions to the Lendlease dependent care spending account plan but may continue to be reimbursed for contributions made to that plan before his extended military leave period, as permitted and limited by the terms of that plan.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong> Other Welfare Benefits<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Life insurance, AD&amp;D insurance, long term disability insurance, and short term disability insurance provided by Lendlease will be continued at Lendlease&rsquo;s expense for a period of 12 weeks after the commencement of the employee&rsquo;s military leave, unless continuation for a longer period is required by state law.&nbsp; These insured benefits are subject to any exclusions or limitations under the terms of the insurance policies and contracts.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Availability of Accrued Time Off<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee on military leave may cash out accrued PTO at any time while on paid or unpaid military leave, at his or her sole election.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Other Benefit Accruals<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee will not accrue PTO while on extended military leave.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Retirement Plan Benefits<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee&rsquo;s salary deferrals to the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018722\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"401(k) plan\">401(k) plan</a>&nbsp;will end when the employee begins a military leave for a period that is formally scheduled for longer than 2 weeks.&nbsp; However, an employee with an account in the 401(k) plan may take a loan from the plan while he or she is on military leave.&nbsp; If an employee has an outstanding participant loan under the 401(k) plan, he or she may continue to make loan payments or may elect for the loan to be held in suspense while he or she is on military leave.&nbsp; While suspended, the loan will continue to bear interest at the lesser of (i) the rate set under the 401(k) plan, or (ii) the rate specified under the Soldiers&rsquo; and Sailors&rsquo; Relief Act (currently 6%).&nbsp; At the end of the military leave, the loan will be reamortized, and loan payments must recommence.&nbsp; Beginning in 2009, to the extent permitted under the 401(k) plan and applicable law, an employee may take a distribution from the 401(k) plan while on military leave.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The 401(k) plan and the plan&rsquo;s loan policy statement provide more detailed terms that control.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong> Reemployment<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Upon an employee's timely application for reemployment, and depending upon the employee&rsquo;s period of military service, an employee will be reinstated to employment as described in this section.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Retirement Plan Benefits<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee, who becomes reemployed after his or her military leave and who is a participant in the 401(k) plan, will be credited for purposes of eligibility and vesting for the time spent in military service and will be treated as not having incurred a break in service.&nbsp; Immediately upon reemployment, the employee may, at the employee&rsquo;s election, make any or all employee contributions (and receive in his or her account any associated Lendlease matching contributions) that the employee would have been eligible to make (or receive) had employment not been interrupted by military service.&nbsp; The time after reemployment allowed for making up missed contributions cannot exceed the lesser of three times the length of military leave or 5 years.&nbsp; Upon reemployment, an employee will receive all other company contributions that would have been made to the plan had the employee not taken military leave.&nbsp; The 401(k) plan provides more detailed terms that control.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Welfare Benefits<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If any of the employee&rsquo;s welfare benefits terminated during the employee&rsquo;s leave, the employee may start participating in the welfare benefits upon reemployment without a waiting period and without exclusions, except as permitted under USERRA.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Less than 91 Days of Military Service<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the employee returns to employment with Lendlease after a period of service in the Uniformed Services of less than 91 days, the employee will be reinstated:</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In a position that the employee would have attained if employment had not been interrupted by military service; or</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If found not qualified for such position after reasonable efforts by Lendlease, in the position in which the employee had been employed prior to military service.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">More than 90 Days and Less than 5 Years of Military Service</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the employee returns to employment with Lendlease after a period of service in the Uniformed Services of more than 90 days and less than 5 years, the employee will be reinstated:</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In a position that the employee would have attained if employment had not been interrupted by military service or a position of like seniority, status and pay, the duties of which the employee is qualified to perform; or</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If found not qualified after reasonable efforts by Lendlease, in the position the employee left, or a position of like seniority, status and pay, the duties of which the employee is qualified to perform.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>An Employee with a Service-Connected Disability<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If after reasonable accommodation efforts by Lendlease an employee with a service-connected disability is not qualified for employment in the position he or she would have attained or in the position that he or she left, the employee will be employed in:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any other position of similar seniority, status and pay for which the employee is qualified or could become qualified with reasonable efforts by&nbsp; Lendlease; or</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If no such position exists, in any other position that is the nearest approximation to the employee&rsquo;s position before the military service.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Exceptions to Reemployment<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In addition to the employee's failure to apply for reemployment in a timely manner, an employee is not entitled to reinstatement as described above if any of the following conditions exist:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease&rsquo;s circumstances have so changed as to make reemployment impossible or unreasonable.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee's employment prior to the military service was merely for a brief, non-recurrent period, and there was no reasonable expectation that the employment would have continued indefinitely or for a significant period.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee did not receive an honourable discharge from military service</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Application for Reemployment<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee who has engaged in military service must, in order to be entitled to the reemployment rights set forth above, submit an application for reemployment according to the following schedule, unless the employee has different rights pursuant to applicable state law:</span><br /></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: 405.0pt; border-collapse: collapse; border: 2.0pt solid #000000;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-left: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-right: 2.0pt solid #000000; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Time or Reason Away from Lendlease</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-left: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-right: 2.0pt solid #000000; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Report to Work/Job Protection</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-left: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-right: 2.0pt solid #000000; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Less than 31 days</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 271.95pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-left: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-right: 2.0pt solid #000000; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employee must report to Lendlease at the beginning of the first full regularly scheduled working period on the first calendar day following completion of service and the expiration of 8 hours after time for safe transportation back to residence.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 109.95pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-left: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-right: 2.0pt solid #000000; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">More than 30 days, but less than 181 days</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-left: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-right: 2.0pt solid #000000; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employee must apply for reemployment with Lendlease within 14 days after the end of the service, providing that it is not impossible due to events beyond your control.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employee will be granted protection against discharge by Lendlease for up to 6 months after employee&rsquo;s return to employment.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 109.95pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-left: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-right: 2.0pt solid #000000; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Over 180 days</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-left: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-right: 2.0pt solid #000000; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employee must apply for reemployment with Lendlease no later than 90 days after completion of service.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employee will be granted protection against discharge by Lendlease for up to 1 year after employee&rsquo;s return to employment.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the employee is hospitalized or convalescing from a service-connected injury, the employee must submit an application for reemployment with People &amp; Culture no later than 2 years following completion of service.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 109.95pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-left: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-right: 2.0pt solid #000000; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Hospitalized or Convalescing from Service-Connected Injury</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-left: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 2.0pt solid #000000; border-right: 2.0pt solid #000000; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employee must submit an application for reemployment with Lendlease no later than 2 years following completion of service.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Access more information on the processes and procedures for&nbsp;<a href=\"https://pulse.lendlease.com/sites/people-portal/leave-and-time-off/americas-leave-and-pto/military-leave\" rel=\"nofollow\">Military Leave</a></span></p>\r\n<p><br Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<div>&nbsp;</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have a general People &amp; Culture enquiry, please contact People Connect.</span></p>\r\n<table>\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img style=\"height: 160px; width: 159px;\" src=\"https://pulse.lendlease.com/sites/people-portal/-/media/intranet/pmportal/images/corporate-workplace-png.png?h=160&amp;w=159&amp;la=en&amp;hash=E746F2D8C36361CD2423AE0967F0BB479948047D\" alt=\"Corporate Workplace\">&nbsp;</span></td>\r\n<td>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>People Connect<br><br>24 hours, Monday to Friday<br><br>Ask People Connect using the button on the right menu<br><br>Phone:&nbsp;1800 554 044<br><br>Email:&nbsp;<a href=\"mailto:PeopleConnect@lendlease.com\">PeopleConnect@lendlease.com</a></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Click here to&nbsp;raise/check the status of a People &amp; Culture Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Limitations now apply in Australia when engaging employees on a fixed term contract.&nbsp; It is important for our business to comply with these changes.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Limitations on using fixed term contracts</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">In Australia, from 6 December 2023, there are rules (called limitations) about using fixed term </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">contracts after this date. </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">These limitations relate to:&nbsp;</span></span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">How long a fixed term contract can be (no longer than 2 years, including extensions and </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">renewals) </span></span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Renewing a fixed term contract, including how many times a contract can be renewed (1 </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">renewal only, and within the 2-year limitation)</span></span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Employing a person on consecutive contracts&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Employers will also be required to provide new fixed term employees with a Fixed Term Contract </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Information Statement from the Fair Work Ombudsman.&nbsp;</span></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">For fixed term contracts entered into before 6 December 2023, the limitations don&rsquo;t apply, however </span></span><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">that contract will need to be considered when applying the consecutive contracts limitation or </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">extending or renewing the contract.&nbsp;</span></span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">The new restrictions will not apply where a fixed-term contract:</span><br /></span></span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">is for the performance only of a distinct and identifiable task using specialised skills; </span></span></span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">relates to a training agreement (i.e. apprenticeship or traineeship); </span></span></span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">relates to an employee earning more than the high-income threshold (currently $167,500 </span></span></span><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">per annum full-time (noting this figure is adjusted annually on 1 July each year));&nbsp;</span><br /></span></span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">is for the undertaking of essential work during a peak demand period;&nbsp;</span><br /></span></span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">is for the undertaking of work during emergency circumstances or during a temporary </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">absence of another employee (e.g. a parental leave backfill);&nbsp;</span><br /></span></span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">falls under prescribed government funding exceptions;&nbsp;</span><br /></span></span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">relates to a governance position that has a time limit under the governing rules of a </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">corporation or association of persons; or&nbsp;</span><br /></span></span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">where a modern award permits the term.&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Contact your People &amp; Culture Business Partner, should you wish to seek clarification on whether </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">these limitations apply.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">RESOURCES</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\"><img rel=\"noopener\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Secure Jobs Better Pay (FTC Change) Fact Sheet (General)</span></a></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease is committed to enabling summoned employees to perform jury service and/or to attend any court as a witness.</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent and fixed-term employees of Lendlease are eligible.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This benefit may not apply to employees bound by an operative enterprise agreement. Where you are employed under the terms and conditions of an operative enterprise agreement with a Lendlease group company, please refer to the relevant agreement for specific details of policies and benefits that apply to you.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees required to attend jury service and/or to attend court as a witness will be paid their normal salary provided that all jury fees, with the exception of travel or food allowances, are remitted to the company.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As soon as you receive your court summons to attend jury service or act as a witness, notify your manager.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Keep your manager informed of any important information such as the estimated length of the trial.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ACT&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">On completion of your jury service, submit a leave request Workday.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Provide your manager with a copy of the court summons and the certificate of attendance confirming any payment received.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">National Service (NS) leave is a leave of absence granted to support male employees who are required to report for NS call-up, in accordance with the Enlistment Act.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All male employees called up for NS activities are eligible.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What steps do I need to take if I have been called up?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; upon receipt of the SAF-100.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease is committed to help employees realise their true potential and achieve their ultimate ambitions. &nbsp;We aim to ensure all existing employees (and potential employees) have fair and consistent access to opportunities at Lendlease. &nbsp;The principles underpinning the recruitment and selection process at Lendlease are therefore those of merit, fairness, equal employment opportunity and the optimisation of career prospects.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In line with our philosophy, we encourage employees to apply for any job vacancy that matches your talents and aspirations.</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply for an internal role?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review your development plan and the current vacancies on Workday.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Discuss your career aspirations with your manager and the opportunities you are looking for to build your knowledge and skills.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Update your resume.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: your manager, you may apply online for the internally advertised role. All applications will be held in the strictest confidence and every assistance will be offered to help you prepare for the process.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The resourcing team will review your application against the role&rsquo;s requirements. Existing employees are given priority consideration for all vacancies.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The resourcing team will contact you regarding next steps, which could include a telephone interview or face to face interview. Upon request, we would provide you with detailed feedback after the interviews.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; Whether this is due to a team restructure or an employee changing their working hours we need to make sure that the change is managed in a structured way. As a people manager you might initiate a job change to:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Restructure your team;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Transfer an existing Lendlease employee into your team and/or;&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Update a team member&rsquo;s terms and conditions.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The job change process is managed in Workday. Once the process has been completed, updates will be made to the employee's records.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Workday%20job-change%20FAQs%20for%20managers.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=pp87H8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" title=\"Job Change FAQs\">Job Change FAQs</a>&nbsp;will help guide you through this process, if you cannot find the information you need here please contact People Connect.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the types of Job Change?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Transfer</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee makes a permanent move to a new role. Typically, the employee will move teams and may move departments, business unit or to a different &nbsp;Lendlease company. The employee may also have changes made to their role, compensation, manager and working hours.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Temporary Assignment</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee is temporarily assigned to a role for a fixed period of time. This assumes that the employee will return to their permanent role after the fixed period.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Promotion</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee accepts a permanent promotion which typically has a new position description. The employee may also have changes made to their organisation &nbsp;details, location, &nbsp;compensation, manager, or working hours.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Out of Cycle compensation or working hours change</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent change(s) are being made to an employee&rsquo;s compensation or working hours. No changes are made to the employee&rsquo;s position description, organisation or&nbsp;location.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Fixed Term Employee contract extension</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee working on a fixed-term contract has their contract end date extended.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Manager Change</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A simple change to the people manager. Current terms and conditions do not change.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Return from extended leave</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee is returning from a period of extended leave for example parental leave.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>","sys_created_by":"hinw325","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"x_caukp_ebonding_integration_mode":null,"can_read_user_criteria":"","active":"true","cannot_read_user_criteria":"","published":"2021-05-05","helpful_count":"0","sys_domain_path":"/","u_view_count_all":"1,018","version":{"display_value":"2.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_version/c5c7c3271bbbe0106d4e986cbc4bcb11"},"x_caukp_ebonding_requester_id":"","meta_description":"In the normal course of business there are likely to be changes within your team. calendar day of each month</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull;&nbsp;Malaysia &ndash; 28th calendar day of each month</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Your monthly salary will be paid on or before the scheduled pay day into the bank account of your choice. If this date falls on a weekend or public holiday, payday will be on the earliest previous working day to the pay day.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Please note that you may only deposit your salary into one bank account.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I access my payslip?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can access your payslips via Pay &gt; Payslips in Workday. Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\" xml:lang=\"EN-AU\" data-contrast=\"auto\">The Lendlease talent review process provides us with a consistent way to talk about our internal talent &ndash; whether this is with your peers, management, or across businesses and regions.&nbsp; This provides greater career progression and development opportunities for our people and helps Lendlease to ensure we have the right people ready for business-critical roles.</span><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><span xml:lang=\"EN-AU\" data-contrast=\"auto\">For you as a manager, our talent review process helps you identify the strengths and weaknesses of your team&rsquo;s capability. It provides you with insights on opportunity, readiness and priorities for people development.</span>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\"><span xml:lang=\"EN-AU\" data-contrast=\"auto\">Simplified Talent Assessment for our Emerging Talent</span>&nbsp;</span></strong></span></p>\r\n</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><span xml:lang=\"EN-AU\" data-contrast=\"auto\">In FY24 we have introduced a simplified approach for assessing talent at IC4-6 and PM1-2 (or what we call the &ldquo;emerging&rdquo; population).&nbsp; In this process we ask people managers to assess each of their team members in two ways &ndash; potential and performance over time &ndash; which combine to give us an overall talent rating.</span>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span xml:lang=\"EN-AU\" data-contrast=\"auto\">Managers will complete this task using a simple drag-and-drop tool in Workday.</span></span>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><em><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><span xml:lang=\"EN-AU\" data-contrast=\"auto\"><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">Step 1</span>: assess performance over time.</span>&nbsp;</span></em></p>\r\n</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><span xml:lang=\"EN-AU\" data-contrast=\"auto\">Review historical performance ratings for your team member over the past few years.&nbsp; Have they consistently been rating Ahead of Track, On Track, or Behind Track?&nbsp; (</span><a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Performance%20Potential%20and%209-box%20-%20Emerging%20Population.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><span xml:lang=\"EN-AU\" data-contrast=\"auto\">Click here</span></a><span xml:lang=\"EN-AU\" data-contrast=\"auto\"> for more information on our performance framework.)</span>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><em><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><span xml:lang=\"EN-AU\" data-contrast=\"auto\"><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">Step 2</span>: assess potential.</span>&nbsp;</span></em></p>\r\n</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><span xml:lang=\"EN-AU\" data-contrast=\"auto\">Potential is based on the five dimensions of learning agility: mental agility, people agility, change agility, results agility, and self-awareness.&nbsp; After considering each agility, determine whether your team member&rsquo;s potential is stable, growth, or high.&nbsp; (You can read more about each learning agility in </span><a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Performance%20Potential%20and%209-box%20-%20Emerging%20Population.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><span xml:lang=\"EN-AU\" data-contrast=\"auto\">this guide</span></a><span xml:lang=\"EN-AU\" data-contrast=\"auto\">.)</span>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><em><span
