Base","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_base/01125e5a1b9b685017eeebd22a4bcb44"},"meta":"","u_problem_type":null,"topic":"General","display_number":"KB0019086 v3.0","base_version":{"display_value":"KB0019086 v2.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge/d80f44ab1b37a0106d4e986cbc4bcbea"},"short_description":"Working Overseas - Global","u_last_review_date":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider_id":"","roles":"","direct":"false","description":"","disable_suggesting":"false","sn_grc_target_table":"","sys_class_name":"Knowledge","article_id":"c9c5547e1b7f20106d4e986cbc4bcb08","sys_id":"94787b7b1bfbe010ef4543b4bd4bcb6d","use_count":"0","flagged":"false","disable_commenting":"false","valid_to":"2100-01-01","retired":"","u_add_to_homepage":"false","u_video_url":"","display_attachments":"false","latest":"true","summary":{"display_value":"KB0019086","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_summary/49c5547e1b7f20106d4e986cbc4bcb0a"},"sys_view_count":"6","revised_by":{"display_value":"Wendy Hinks","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/6a5918de13801a00d774fc04e144b08d"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"6","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"Global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/c598f74f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcbbb"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2024-02-29 00:08:11","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018814","sys_updated_by":"raiv416","sys_created_on":"2021-05-06 01:50:29","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Americas People &amp; Culture</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease will comply with the Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) implementing Regulations as revised effective February 2013.&nbsp; The company posts the mandatory FMLA Notice in the company break rooms and upon hire provides all new employees with notices required by the U.S. Department of Labor (DOL) on Employee Rights and Responsibilities under the Family and Medical Leave Act.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The function of this policy is to provide employees with a general description of their Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) rights.&nbsp; In the event of any conflict between this policy and the applicable law, employees will be afforded all rights required by law under the Family and Medical Leave Act by the U.S. Department of Labor (DOL).&nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have any questions regarding this policy, you must contact The Hartford at&nbsp;<strong>888.301.5615</strong>&nbsp;or online at&nbsp;<a href=\"https://abilityadvantage.thehartford.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\">www.abilityadvantage.thehartford.com<br /></a> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Under this policy, Lendlease (&ldquo;The Company&rdquo;) will grant up to 12 weeks (or up to 26 weeks of military caregiver leave to care for a covered service-member with a serious injury or illness) during a 12-month period to eligible employees. The leave may be paid, unpaid or a combination of paid and unpaid leave, depending on the circumstances of the leave and as specified in this policy.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>ELIGIBILITY<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To qualify to take family or medical leave under this policy, the employee must meet all of the following conditions:</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1. The employee must have worked for the company for 12 months or 52 weeks. The 12 months or 52 weeks need not have been consecutive. Separate periods of employment will be counted, provided that the break in service does not exceed seven years. Separate periods of employment will be counted if the break in service exceeds seven years due to National Guard or Reserve military service obligations or when there is a written agreement, including a collective bargaining agreement, stating the employer&rsquo;s intention to rehire the employee after the service break. For eligibility purposes, an employee will be considered to have been employed for an entire week even if the employee was on the payroll for only part of a week or if the employee is on leave during the week.</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2. The employee must have worked at least 1,250 hours during the 12-month period immediately before the date when the leave is requested to commence. The principles established under the Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) determine the number of hours worked by an employee. The FLSA does not include time spent on paid or unpaid leave as hours worked. Consequently, these hours of leave should not be counted in determining the 1,250 hours eligibility test for an employee under FMLA.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;Airline flight crewmembers or flight attendants will meet the FMLA hours of service eligibility requirement if he or she has worked or been paid for not less than 60 percent of the applicable total monthly guarantee (or its equivalent) and has worked or been paid for not less than 504 hours (not including personal commute time or time spent on vacation, medical, or sick leave) during the previous 12 months. Airline employees who are not flight crew employees continue to be covered under the general hour of service eligibility requirement which requires 1,250 hours of service in the previous 12 months.</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">3. The employee must work in a worksite where 50 or more employees are employed by the company within 75 miles of that office or worksite. The distance is to be calculated by using available transportation by the most direct route.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Types of Leave Covered<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To qualify as FMLA leave under this policy, the employee must be taking leave for one of the reasons listed below:</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1. The birth of a child and in order to care for that child.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2. The placement of a child for adoption or foster care and to care for the newly placed child.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">3. To care for a spouse/domestic partner, child or parent with a serious health condition (described below).The definition of \"spouse\" includes marriages legally entered into by same-sex couples.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">4. The serious health condition (described below) of the employee. The serious health condition (described below) of the employee, spouse/domestic partner, child(ren) or parent(s).</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee may take leave because of a serious health condition that makes the employee unable to perform the functions of the employee's position.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A serious health condition is defined as a condition that requires inpatient care at a hospital, hospice or residential medical care facility, including any period of incapacity or any subsequent treatment in connection with such inpatient care or a condition that requires continuing care by a licensed health care provider.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This policy covers illnesses of a serious and long-term nature, resulting in recurring or lengthy absences. Generally, a health condition that would result in a period of three consecutive days of incapacity with the first visit to the health care provider within seven days of the onset of the incapacity and a second visit within 30 days of the incapacity would be considered a serious health condition. for a chronic or long-term health conditions requires periodic health care visits for treatment at least twice a year.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees with questions about what illnesses are covered under this FMLA policy are encouraged to consult with The Hartford.</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">5. Qualifying exigency leave for families of members of the National Guard or Reserves or of a regular component of the Armed Forces when the covered military member is on covered active duty or called to covered active duty.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee whose spouse/domestic partner, son, daughter or parent either has been notified of an impending call or order to covered active military duty or who is already on covered active duty may take up to 12 weeks of leave for reasons related to or affected by the family member&rsquo;s call-up or service. The qualifying exigency must be one of the following:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- short-notice deployment,</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- military events and activities,</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- child care and school activities,</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- financial and legal arrangements,</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- counseling,</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- rest and recuperation,</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- post-deployment activities and</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- additional activities that arise out of active duty, provided that the employer and employee agree, including agreement on timing and duration of the leave.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&ldquo;Covered active duty&rdquo; means:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">(a)in the case of a member of a regular component of the Armed Forces, duty during the deployment of the member with the Armed Forces to a foreign country; and</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">(b)in the case of a member of a reserve component of the Armed Forces, duty during the deployment of the member with the Armed Forces to a foreign country under a call or order to active duty under a provision of law referred to in section 101(a)(13)(B) of title 10, United States Code.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The leave may commence as soon as the individual receives the call-up notice (Son or daughter for this type of FMLA leave is defined the same as for child for other types of FMLA leave except that the person does not have to be a minor.) This type of leave would be counted toward the employee&rsquo;s 12-week maximum of FMLA leave in a 12-month period.</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">6. Military caregiver leave (also known as covered service-member leave) to care for an injured or ill service-member or veteran.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee whose son, daughter, parent or next of kin is a covered service-member may take up to 26 weeks in a single 12-month period to take care of leave to care for that service-member.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Next of kin is defined as the closest blood relative of the injured or recovering service-member.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The term &ldquo;covered service-member&rdquo; means:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">(a) a member of the Armed Forces (including a member of the National Guard or Reserves) who is undergoing medical treatment, recuperation, or therapy, is otherwise in outpatient status, or is otherwise on the temporary disability retired list, for a serious injury or illness; or</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">(b) a veteran who is undergoing medical treatment, recuperation, or therapy, for a serious injury or illness and who was a member of the Armed Forces (including a member of the National Guard or Reserves) at any time during the period of 5 years preceding the date on which the veteran undergoes that medical treatment, recuperation, or therapy.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The term &ldquo;serious injury or illness&rdquo;:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">(a) in the case of a member of the Armed Forces (including a member of the National Guard or Reserves), means an injury or illness that was incurred by the member in line of duty on active duty in the Armed Forces (or existed before the beginning of the member&rsquo;s active duty and was aggravated by service in line of duty on active duty in the Armed Forces) and that may render the member medically unfit to perform the duties of the member&rsquo;s office, grade, rank, or rating; and</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">(b) in the case of a veteran who was a member of the Armed Forces (including a member of the National Guard or Reserves) at any time during a period when the person was a covered service-member, means a qualifying (as defined by the Secretary of Labor) injury or illness that was incurred by the member in line of duty on an active duty in the Armed Forces (or existed before the beginning of the member&rsquo;s active duty and was aggravated by service in line of duty on active duty in the Armed Forces) and that manifested itself before or after the member became a veteran.</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Amount of Leave Covered<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An eligible employee can take up to 12 weeks for the FMLA circumstances (1) through (5) above under this policy during any 12-month period. The company will measure the 12-month period as a rolling 12-month period measured backward from the date an employee uses any leave under this policy. Each time an employee takes leave, the company will compute the amount of leave the employee has taken under this policy in the last 12 months and subtract it from the 12 weeks of available leave, and the balance remaining is the amount the employee is entitled to take at that time.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An eligible employee can take up to 26 weeks for the FMLA circumstance (6) above (military caregiver leave) during a single 12-month period. For this military caregiver leave, the company will measure the 12-month period as a rolling 12-month period measured forward. FMLA leave already taken for other FMLA circumstances will be deducted from the total of 26 weeks available.</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an employee and spouse/domestic partner both work for the company and each wishes to take leave for the birth of a child, adoption or placement of a child in foster care, or to care for a parent (but not a parent \"in-law\") with a serious health condition, the employee and spouse/domestic partner may only take a combined total of 12 weeks of leave. If the employee and spouse/domestic partner both work for the company and each wishes to take leave to care for a covered injured or ill service-member, the employee and spouse/domestic partner may only take a combined total of 26 weeks of leave.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Employee Status and Benefits during Leave<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">While an employee is on leave, the company will continue the employee's health benefits during the leave period at the same level and under the same conditions as if the employee had continued to work.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the employee chooses not to return to work for reasons other than a continued serious health condition of the employee or the employee's family member or a circumstance beyond the employee's control, the company will require the employee to reimburse the company the amount it paid for the employee's health insurance premium during the leave period.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Under current company policy, the employee pays a portion of the health care premium. While on paid leave, the employer will continue to make payroll deductions to collect the employee's share of the premium. While on unpaid leave, the employee must continue to make this payment, either in person or by mail. The payment must be received in the Benefits Department by the due date provided on the insurance coupon vouchers. If the payment is more than 30 days late, the employee's health care coverage may be dropped for the duration of the leave. The employer will provide 15 days' notification prior to the employee's loss of coverage.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the employee contributes to a life insurance or disability plan, the employer will continue making payroll deductions while the employee is on paid leave. While the employee is on unpaid leave, the employee may request continuation of such benefits and pay his or her portion of the premiums, or the employer may elect to maintain such benefits during the leave and pay the employee's share of the premium payments. If the employee does not continue these payments, the employer may discontinue coverage during the leave. If the employer maintains coverage, the employer may recover the costs incurred for paying the employee's share of any premiums, whether or not the employee returns to work.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Employee Status after Leave<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee who takes leave under this policy may be asked to provide a fitness for duty (FFD) clearance from the health care provider. This requirement will be included in The Hartford's response to the FMLA request. Generally, an employee who takes FMLA leave will be able to return to the same position or a position with equivalent status, pay, benefits and other employment terms. The position will be the same or one which is virtually identical in terms of pay, benefits and working conditions. In certain instances, Lend Lease may choose to exempt certain key employees from this requirement and not return them to the same or similar position.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Use of Paid and Unpaid Leave<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee who is taking FMLA leave because of the employee's own serious health condition, FML will&nbsp;run concurrently with short-term disability.&nbsp; If the FMLA leave is for the serious health condition of a family member the employee can substitute paid time off (PTO).</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Disability leave for the birth of the child and for an employee's serious health condition, including workers' compensation leave (to the extent that it qualifies), will be designated as FMLA leave and will run concurrently with FMLA. For example, if an employer provides six weeks of pregnancy disability leave, the six weeks will be designated as FMLA leave and counted toward the employee's 12-week entitlement. The employee has the option to substitute accrued (or earned) PTO as appropriate before being eligible for unpaid leave for what remains of the 12-week entitlement. This same option applies to an employee who is taking leave for the adoption or foster care of a child.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In order to receive holiday pay, an employee must either work or use a PTO day on the last business day before and on the first business day after a holiday. If an employee is on an FMLA leave and is using his or her accrued PTO on the last business day before and on the first business day after the holiday during the FMLA leave period in which the holiday falls, the employee will receive holiday pay for the holiday.&nbsp; If an employee is on an unpaid FMLA leave during the period on which the holiday falls, then the employee will not be paid for the holiday that occurs during the leave.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee will receive payment of short-term disability (&ldquo;STD&rdquo;) benefits during his or her leave period, including on the holiday that occurs during the leave period, pursuant to the terms and conditions of the Company&rsquo;s short-term disability program.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee who is using military FMLA leave for a qualifying exigency or FMLA military caregiver leave has the option to substitute accrued (or earned) PTO as appropriate before being eligible for unpaid leave.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Intermittent Leave or a Reduced Work Schedule<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee may take FMLA leave in 12 consecutive weeks, may use the leave intermittently (take a day periodically when needed over the year) or, under certain circumstances, may use the leave to reduce the workweek or workday, resulting in a reduced hour schedule. In all cases, the leave may not exceed a total of 12 workweeks (or 26 workweeks to care for an injured or ill servicemember over a 12-month period).</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The company may temporarily transfer an employee to an available alternative position with equivalent pay and benefits if the alternative position would better accommodate the intermittent or reduced schedule, in instances of when leave for the employee or employee's family member is foreseeable and for planned medical treatment, including recovery from a serious health condition or to care for a child after birth, or placement for adoption or foster care.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For the birth, adoption or foster care of a child, the company and the employee must mutually agree to the schedule before the employee may take the leave intermittently or work a reduced hour schedule. Leave for birth, adoption or foster care of a child must be taken within one year of the birth or placement of the child.</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the employee is taking leave for a serious health condition or because of the serious health condition of a spouse/domestic partner, child(ren) or parent(s), the employee should try to reach agreement with the company before taking intermittent leave or working a reduced hour schedule. If this is not possible, then the employee must prove that the use of the leave is medically necessary.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Certification for the Employee&rsquo;s Serious Health Condition<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The company will require certification for the employee&rsquo;s serious health condition. The employee must respond to such a request within 15 days of the request or provide a reasonable explanation for the delay. Failure to provide certification may result in a denial of continuation of leave. The Certification of Health Care Provider for Employee&rsquo;s Serious Health Condition form can be obtained by contacting The Hartford at&nbsp;<strong>888.301.5615&nbsp;</strong>or online at&nbsp;<a href=\"https://abilityadvantage.thehartford.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\">www.abilityadvantage.thehartford.com<br /></a> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The company may directly contact the employee&rsquo;s health care provider for verification or clarification purposes using a health care professional, an HR professional, leave administrator or management official. The company will not use the employee&rsquo;s direct supervisor for this contact. Before the company makes this direct contact with the health care provider, the employee will be a given an opportunity to resolve any deficiencies in the medical certification. In compliance with HIPAA Medical Privacy Rules, the company will obtain the employee&rsquo;s permission for clarification of individually identifiable health information.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The company has the right to ask for a second opinion if it has reason to doubt the certification. The company will pay for the employee to get a certification from a second doctor, which the company will select. The company may deny FMLA leave to an employee who refuses to release relevant medical records to the health care provider designated to provide a second or third opinion. If necessary to resolve a conflict between the original certification and the second opinion, the company will require the opinion of a third doctor. The company and the employee will mutually select the third doctor, and the company will pay for the opinion. This third opinion will be considered final. The employee will be provisionally entitled to leave and benefits under the FMLA pending the second and/or third opinion.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Certification for the Family Member&rsquo;s Serious Health Condition<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The company will require certification for the family member&rsquo;s serious health condition. The employee must respond to such a request within 15 days of the request or provide a reasonable explanation for the delay. Failure to provide certification may result in a denial of continuation of leave. The Certification of Health Care Provider for Family Member&rsquo;s Serious Health Condition form can be obtained by contacting The Hartford at&nbsp;<strong>888.301.5615&nbsp;</strong>or online at&nbsp;<a href=\"https://abilityadvantage.thehartford.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\">www.abilityadvantage.thehartford.com<br /></a> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The company may directly contact the employee&rsquo;s family member&rsquo;s health care provider for verification or clarification purposes using a health care professional, an HR professional, leave administrator or management official. The company will not use the employee&rsquo;s direct supervisor for this contact. Before the company makes this direct contact with the health care provider, the employee will be a given an opportunity to resolve any deficiencies in the medical certification. In compliance with HIPAA Medical Privacy Rules, the company will obtain the employee&rsquo;s family member&rsquo;s permission for clarification of individually identifiable health information.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The company has the right to ask for a second opinion if it has reason to doubt the certification. The company will pay for the employee&rsquo;s family member to get a certification from a second doctor, which the company will select. The company may deny FMLA leave to an employee whose family member refuses to release relevant medical records to the health care provider designated to provide a second or third opinion. If necessary to resolve a conflict between the original certification and the second opinion, the company will require the opinion of a third doctor. The company and the employee will mutually select the third doctor, and the company will pay for the opinion. This third opinion will be considered final. The employee will be provisionally entitled to leave and benefits under the FMLA pending the second and/or third opinion.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Certification of Qualifying Exigency for Military Family Leave<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The company will require certification of the qualifying exigency for military family leave. The employee must respond to such a request within 15 days of the request or provide a reasonable explanation for the delay. Failure to provide certification may result in a denial of continuation of leave. The Certification of Qualifying Exigency for Military Family Leave form can be obtained by contacting The Hartford at&nbsp;<strong>888.301.5615</strong>&nbsp;or online at&nbsp;<a href=\"https://abilityadvantage.thehartford.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\">www.abilityadvantage.thehartford.com<br /></a> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Certification for Serious Injury or Illness of Covered Service-member for Military Family Leave</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The company will require certification for the serious injury or illness of the covered service-member. The employee must respond to such a request within 15 days of the request or provide a reasonable explanation for the delay. Failure to provide certification may result in a denial of continuation of leave. The Certification for Serious Injury or Illness of Covered Service-member form can be obtained by contacting The Hartford at&nbsp;<strong>888.301.5615</strong>&nbsp;or online at&nbsp;<a href=\"https://abilityadvantage.thehartford.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\">www.abilityadvantage.thehartford.com<br /></a> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Re-certification<br /><br /></strong> The company may request recertification for the serious health condition of the employee or the employee&rsquo;s family member no more frequently than every 30 days when circumstances have changed significantly, or if the employer receives information casting doubt on the reason given for the absence, or if the employee seeks an extension of his or her leave. Otherwise, the company may request recertification for the serious health condition of the employee or the employee&rsquo;s family member every six months in connection with an FMLA absence. The company may provide the employee&rsquo;s health care provider with the employee&rsquo;s attendance records and ask whether need for leave is consistent with the employee&rsquo;s serious health condition.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Procedure for Requesting FMLA Leave<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All employees requesting FMLA leave must provide verbal or written notice of the need for the leave by contacting The Hartford at&nbsp;888.301.5615&nbsp;or online at&nbsp;<a href=\"https://abilityadvantage.thehartford.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\">www.abilityadvantage.thehartford.com</a>&nbsp; Within five business days after the employee has provided this notice, The Hartford will complete and provide the employee with the DOL Notice of Eligibility and Rights.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When the need for the leave is foreseeable, the employee must provide the employer with at least 30 days' notice. When an employee becomes aware of a need for FMLA leave less than 30 days in advance, the employee must provide notice of the need for the leave either the same day or the next business day. When the need for FMLA leave is not foreseeable, the employee must comply with the company&rsquo;s usual and customary notice and procedural requirements for requesting leave, absent unusual circumstances.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Designation of FMLA Leave<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Within five business days after the employee has submitted the appropriate certification form, The Hartford will complete and provide the employee with a written response to the employee&rsquo;s request for FMLA leave.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Intent to Return to Work from FMLA Leave<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">On a basis that does not discriminate against employees on FMLA leave; the company may require an employee on FMLA leave to report periodically on the employee&rsquo;s status and intent to return to work.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>REFERENCE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018990\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Family and Medical Leave Procedure\">Family and Medical Leave Procedure<br /></a> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SUPPORT CONTACT INFORMATION<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Contact The Hartford's Customer Service Center at <strong>888.301.5615</strong> or online at <a href=\"https://abilityadvantage.thehartford.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\">www.abilityadvantage.thehartford.com</a>&nbsp;to file an FMLA claim. Also contact the Regional Service Center in Charlotte, NC regarding insurance premiums during Unpaid FMLA.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Questions pertaining to the understanding or explanation of Leave should be referred to the Leave Coordinator at The Hartford's Customer Service Center at&nbsp;<strong>888.301.5615</strong>.</span></p>","sys_created_by":"hinw325","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease is committed to providing ongoing career development to all our employees and encourages employees to apply for internal vacancies.&nbsp;As an international company, with businesses spanning a range of sectors and capabilities, there are often opportunities to take on new roles and build your skills. &nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease encourages employees to apply for internal vacancies, as long as the employee has been in their current role for a minimum of 12 months, and the proposed role aligns with their talents and aspirations.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply for an internal role?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">COVID-19 has brought about many changes in our lives, including the way we work.</span><br><br></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Restricted movement has prompted an increase in remote working globally.&nbsp;Lendlease has long supported flexible working and regularly adopts new approaches as technology and the ways in which we work evolve.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The business, now embracing hybrid working as the norm, is generating fresh options for when and where people work provided they are prioritising customers, their teams and then themselves.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To further support this culture shift, a new flex opportunity is being offered for those interested in blending short-term remote working with annual leave overseas to extend their trips and spend time with family overseas.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">There are a number of risks and challenges associated with International Remote Working (IRW). To ensure that Lendlease is compliant with local immigration and tax regulations, it is important that the IRW Guidelines are reviewed and adhered to before any remote working arrangements are approved.</span><br><br></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-type: disc; list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/International%20Remote%20Work%20Guideline.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">International Remote Work Guidelines</a></span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=WzIMvPxuqEyeRhG1D-KqtaUvQTntZ4BAiPkfYuOlOc9UMzNCRU05NFFEUE80MFdaT01MRFJRNlRVNSQlQCN0PWcu\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" title=\"International Remote Work Application Form\">International Remote Work Application Form</a></span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; Restricted movement","kb_knowledge_base":{"display_value":"People Connect Knowledge Australia","u_last_review_date":"2024-12-09","x_caukp_ebonding_provider_id":"","roles":"","direct":"false","description":"","disable_suggesting":"false","sn_grc_target_table":"","sys_class_name":"Knowledge","article_id":"761f114b1b405d10ef4543b4bd4bcb80","sys_id":"96814ba29792921072b954800153af3b","use_count":"0","flagged":"false","disable_commenting":"false","valid_to":"2025-12-09","retired":"","u_add_to_homepage":"false","u_video_url":"","display_attachments":"false","latest":"true","summary":{"display_value":"KB0020018","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_summary/ffcf158b1b405d10ef4543b4bd4bcb44"},"sys_view_count":"40","revised_by":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"6","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"AUST","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/31b8378f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcbd0"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2024-02-29 00:08:12","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018832","sys_updated_by":"raiv416","sys_created_on":"2021-05-06 02:07:45","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 231.05pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: top; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Approver's name and title:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Teena Hester</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Head of People &amp; Culture, Americas</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 231.05pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: top; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Effective date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">August 2017</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 231.05pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: top; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">August 2017</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 231.05pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: top; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Next review date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">August 2019</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE &amp; ELIGIBILITY<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The purpose of the Out of Town Living Allowance is to cover significant duplicate living costs arising from being put on an Out of Town Living Assignment.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees are eligible for an Out of Town Living Allowance if they are requested by the company to be on an out-of-town job assignment temporarily relocating them more than 50 miles away from their permanent tax home for a period of 120 days or more while on company business. OTL Allowances must be approved through Workday Job Change, Promotion or Offer, before it is able to be paid.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Assignment Length &amp; Taxability<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The assignment length should be based on the legitimate expected length of assignment on the project and updated at the point this intent changes. (For example, if 5 months into an 8-month assignment the project decides an employee will be there a total of 14 months, project management should notify People &amp; Culture to extend the assignment and the OTL would become taxable at that time.)&nbsp;</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Short-term Assignment&nbsp;-</strong> If an employee&rsquo;s assignment is expected to last twelve (12) months or less, living expenses are not taxable income to the employee and therefore he/she would be eligible to receive a &ldquo;non-taxable&rdquo; OTL allowance. All reimbursements for Home Leave travel will also be non-taxable.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Long-term Assignment</strong>&nbsp;- If an employee&rsquo;s assignment is expected to last longer than twelve (12) months, living expenses are taxable income to the employee and he/she would receive a &ldquo;taxable&rdquo; OTL allowance. In this case, there will be a gross up for taxes by payroll beginning from the first month of the assignment. All reimbursements for Home Leave travel will also be taxable and passed along form Accounts Payable to be grossed up for taxes and paid through Payroll.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Assignments that are too Short for OTL Allowances</strong>- In most situations an assignment of 120 days or less would not allow for an apartment lease to be established, so the assignment must be handled by expenses through Accounts Payable. In these situations, a Job Change in Workday is still typically required to place the employee in the correct work state for taxes.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Typically, a Workday Job Change will be required if the employee will be working at a project location for 6 weeks or more. Also, the employee should be working approximately 100% of their time at the OTL location during the expected assignment. If there is a question around this Payroll and/or the Mobility Specialist should be contacted.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Required Pre-Approval<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All Out of Town Living Allowances must be approved, in advance, through the Appian system.&nbsp; A Manager should attach completed versions of the OTL Authorization Form&nbsp;<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><strong>AND&nbsp;</strong></span>the Declaration of OTL Benefits Form to the Appian Job Change, Promotion or Offer. If these documents are not attached, the Appian action will be rejected until they are attached. Any changes, including expected duration dates, to the authorization form after approval have been obtained will require additional approvals.&nbsp;&nbsp;No commitment should be made to an employee or new hire until Appian approvals have been obtained.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A new OTL Allowance Authorization Form and Declaration of OTL Benefits must be completed each time an employee moves to a new OTL assignment.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>OTL Allowance Rate<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Standard Net Monthly Rates will be established based on reimbursement for:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Apartment rental (one-bedroom)</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Basic furniture rental</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Utilities &ndash; electricity, gas, water, standard cable television &amp; internet</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Incidentals (including, but not limited to, dry cleaning &amp; groceries) are handled by $300 included within the Standard Established Monthly OTL Rate</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Security Deposits are not typically covered by Lend Lease, as these will be reimbursed to the employee</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee should match any lease they enter to the terms of their assignment. If Lend Lease changes the OTL assignment details and causes lease break costs, these will be reimbursed to the employee.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Certain non-reimbursable fees such as apartment application fee or background check, may be reimbursed individually.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Other factors that may affect the baseline rate should also be considered such as length of stay, housing alternatives, lower cost areas in close proximity.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Setting OTL Allowance Rate<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Upon request by a project or management group, People &amp; Culture will work with a contracted third party vendor to determine the OTL rate for a particular city or geographic area. From the vendor information, a standard monthly net rate which includes the $300 for incidentals per month will be determined. Once a rate is established for a geographic location, this rate must be paid consistently among all eligible employees&rsquo; working in that location.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The rates paid will be reviewed as needed to ensure they remain current with market conditions for the affected area.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Items Not Included in the OTL Rate<br /></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Meals</strong>&nbsp;- Meals are&nbsp;not&nbsp;included in the OTL rate structure. Only business meals will be reimbursed using the actual expense method submitted on the Employee Expense Reports Form when appropriate.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Transportation for Home Leave Trips&nbsp;</strong>- Actual expenses for transportation for&nbsp;<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">one</span>&nbsp;round trip to the employee&rsquo;s home per month will be reimbursed and should be submitted on the Employee Expense Report Form. Additional home leave trips may be approved by Management, but are not required by OTL Policy.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Access more information on the processes&nbsp;and procedures for<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018735\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"OTL\">OTL</a></span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>","sys_created_by":"hinw325","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Eligible employees on voluntary or involuntary \"Active Duty\" will be granted military leave and re-employment rights in order to serve our country in the \"Uniformed Services\".&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease will continue base wages for two weeks, each calendar year, for training, and will supplement pay, if eligible, after the two weeks, to reach your Lendlease base wage. Please contact the benefits department for more information.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Salaried and hourly, non-union employees on active duty in uniformed services are eligible for basic military pay and supplemental military pay.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Casual, interns and contracted employees are not eligible for Military Leave pay.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review the eligibility requirements</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Read through the Military Leave Policy</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Provide supporting documents, including copies of your military orders, rank and pay and&nbsp;any documentation outlining&nbsp;pay to be received from the military (for military leave more than two weeks).&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ACT</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1. Complete the Leave of Absence Request Form and give to your manager for their signature.&nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2. Send the approved Absence Request Form along with supporting documents via email to the AMER Benefits team (<a href=\"mailto:amerbenefits@lendlease.com\">amerbenefits@lendlease.com</a>) as far in advance as possible.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">3. Provide an email address for communication while on military leave.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">4. Follow these steps for time entry/timesheets purposes:</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull;&nbsp;Do not&nbsp;code hours for military leave days in E1 Self Service Time Entry.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; If you start military leave in the middle of a pay period, time entry should be entered for the hours worked, only up to your last day worked. Do not code time entry for military leave days/hours. Submit your time for manager approval.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Based on your Leave of Absence Request Form, payroll will be instructed by the AMER benefits team to pay your basic military pay to pay type 39 and, or pay supplemental military pay to pay type 42.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">FINALIZE</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You will receive an email from the AMER benefits team confirming the receipt of the leave request form and any supporting documents.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Who can I contact regarding the benefit?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For questions about military leave, completing the Leave of Absence Request Form or the approval process, contact People Connect on 1 866 848 1200 and select option two or ask People Connect online using the button on the&nbsp;top right hand corner of this page.</span></p>\r\n<p><span Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Our dental benefit is an opportunity for employees to purchase dental insurance coverage through the Lendlease MetLife Preferred Dentist Program (PDP). This is a preferred provider organization with a nationwide network of over 197,000 general and specialty participating dentists.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As part of the program, participating dentists in the network provide services at fees that are typically 10-30% lower than the average charged in their communities.&nbsp; With this plan there is also flexibility to visit providers outside of the network.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin: 0cm 0cm 8pt; line-height: 107%; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Full -time salaried or hourly employee (non-union) regularly scheduled to work at least 30 hours per week. Salaried employees are eligible to participate in the Benefit Programs on their date of hire.&nbsp; <br><br>Hourly employees are eligible to participate in the Benefits Programs the first day of the month following or coincident with completion of two months of continuous employment (at least 260 hours) from their most recent hire date (but no later than the 91<sup>st</sup> day after their most recent hire date).</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I enroll?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As a new hire, you have 31 days from your start date to elect healthcare benefits. New employees should go to the Benefits Center (<a href=\"http://www.Lendlease.hrintouch.com\">www.Lendlease.hrintouch.com</a>) to complete all benefit enrollments with the exception of the 401(k) plan. Per the Plan provisions, if you do not make an affirmative election to enroll in, or decline healthcare coverage (i.e., fail to enroll) within 31 days from your start date, you will be deemed to have elected to waive coverage under all Plans, except the Plan&rsquo;s default benefits.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When enrolling an eligible dependent, such as a spouse/domestic partner or child(ren), certain documentation will be required for verification, such as a birth certificate, marriage certificate.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you miss the 31-day election window, you will be able to enroll during the Open Enrollment period in November for benefits to be effective January 1 of the following year.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have a qualifying event, such as a marriage, divorce, birth of a child, loss of other coverage, etc. you will be able to change your benefit elections mid-year by going to the Benefits Center within 31 days following the life event.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I use the benefit?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once enrolled, you will not receive a dental identification card for this coverage.&nbsp; It is recommended to take a dental claim form to your dental visit.&nbsp; The form contains all the plan identification information and phone numbers and the dental office can verify coverage and file the claim.&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For more information please read the MetLife Dental Plan Summary and Dental Preventive Care FAQs available under the Resources section of this page.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: 01:28:00","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Lendlease 401(k) Plan is our employer-sponsored retirement savings plan offered to our US employees. The plan is administered by Vanguard&reg; and lets you save directly through payroll deductions and invest your contributions on a pre-tax, Roth or traditional after-tax basis.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All full-time, salaried US employees are eligible to participate, including Lendlease international transfers (excludes inbound international assignees on secondments).</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To enroll in the Lendlease 401(k) Plan, you must be a new employee or an existing employee who has not yet enrolled in the Lendlease 401 (k) Plan.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">New employees can enroll soon after hire, or&nbsp;will be automatically enrolled in the program approximately 90 days after start date unless they contact Vanguard to opt out.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What are the benefits?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The plan offers a number of additional benefits that can be activated via the Vanguard website:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Annual Increase<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If elected, the &lsquo;annual increase&rsquo; option allows you to increase the amount you are saving by gradually increasing your contribution rate over time. Each year your savings rate is raised&nbsp;by the percentage you specify. Annual increases take place until you've reached the IRS or your plan's saving limit. Check your plan for &lsquo;one step save&rsquo; details by accessing your account online or calling Vanguard.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>One-time additional payment&nbsp;or pay off&nbsp;your existing 401(k) loan balance<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can make a payment over and above your normal payroll deduction and it will be applied toward your principle balance. You will need to log onto your<a href=\"http://www.vanguard.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\">&nbsp;account online</a>&nbsp;then click &lsquo;manage loans/withdrawals&rsquo; under the &rsquo;I want to...&rsquo; drop down menu.&nbsp;You will see your loan(s) listed. You can then complete an electronic bank transfer for part or your entire loan by clicking &lsquo;initiate payoff or early payment&rsquo;. This cannot be handled by payroll deduction.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Company matching<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The company match is a simple way to maximize your plan contributions. After one year of service, for every $1 you contribute to the plan (either pre-tax or Roth, or a combination of both), Lendlease will contribute $0.50, up to 6% of your eligible compensation.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Maximize the company match<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you plan to contribute the full IRS dollar limit of $22,500 to your 401(k) Plan in 2023, there is potential for you to miss some company matching contributions if you &lsquo;max out&rsquo; before the end of the year. Use the contribution maximizer calculator to help you understand the contribution percentage to best maximize your company matching contributions. If you are 50 years or older, or turn 50 anytime during the year, you are eligible to contribute an additional $7,500, up to $30,000, as catch-up for retirement.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you were previously employed by Lendlease, contact People Connect to enquire about your eligibility for company match.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I enroll?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review the eligibility requirements above.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Receive the Vanguard enrollment kit mailed to your home.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Read through the Lendlease 401(k) Summary Plan Description.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">View the available Current 401(k) Investment Options.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;<strong>PREPARE</strong></span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When you receive your enrollment kit from Vanguard, you can proceed.&nbsp; You will also be given an opportunity to opt out of enrollment.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you do not opt out, you will be enrolled in the Lendlease 401(k) Plan at a default savings rate of 6% of your eligible pay.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The first deduction will be approximately 90 days from the date of your automatic enrollment notice.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Your contribution will be invested in a date-specific Vanguard Target Retirement Fund based on your age and an assumed retirement age of 65.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You will need the following when enrolling:</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Social Security Number</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Zip code</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Birth date</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Plan number* 091686</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When enrolling you will be required to designate a beneficiary.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;<strong>ACT</strong></span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; font-size: 12pt;\">Visit the Vanguard website for see step-by-step enrollment instructions.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you would like to rollover funds from a retirement plan at your previous employer into the Lendlease 401(k) Plan, Contact Vanguard Personal Assistance</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once enrolled you will receive a personal identification number (PIN) shortly in the mail.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Consider utilizing the two investment advice programs on selecting your funds, investing your money, and periodically make changes to your asset mix to suit your personal goals:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Vanguard Managed Account Program</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Vanguard Financial Planning Services (for age 55 and older).</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are over age 50, use the &lsquo;Over age 50&rsquo; program.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Use the contribution maximizer calculator to help calculate your catch-up contributions.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I manage my account?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can manage your account including your plan deduction on your pay check, personal details and beneficiaries using the following options:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Online:&nbsp; Log on to the Vanguard website.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">By Phone:&nbsp; Call Vanguard's 24-hour number 1-800-523-1188. &nbsp;You will need your PIN and your Social Security number when using this option.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For live assistance, contact a Vanguard Participant Services Associate by calling the same toll-free number and pressing zero. The service is available Monday to Friday from 8:30am to 9pm Eastern Time.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For Qualified Domestic Relations Order (QDRO) contact (888) 809-8104 ext. 34669.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I opt out?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have received an automatic enrollment notification (mailed to your home) from The Vanguard Group and you do not wish to enroll, please call a Vanguard Participant Services Associate. The deadline to opt out will be reflected in your enrolment notification package.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color:
