Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease is sympathetic to employees who may experience an event of the death, serious illness, injury of a close family member or very close friend; or an event of urgent domestic distress&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Each case will be viewed sympathetically and compassionate leave will be granted where applicable.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This policy does not form part of any employee&rsquo;s contract of employment and it may be amended at any time.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This policy applies to all UK Lendlease employees regardless of length of service. It does not apply to agency workers or self-employed contractors.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><br />How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PLAN</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review the eligibility requirements&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PREPARE</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">One day of paid leave will be provided for the funeral of a family member or close friend. For a member of immediate family e.g. spouse, partner, parent, child, sibling or very close friend, paid leave will be granted from the death up to and including the date of the funeral. If a longer period is required, this will be discussed on an individual basis and agreed with the employee&rsquo;s people manager.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Compassionate leave for urgent domestic distress is for circumstances such as house flooding, burglary, fire, boiler breakdown etc. Deliveries of furniture or white goods would not be classed as an urgent domestic situation. In these circumstances the employee should discuss alternative arrangements with their manager, such as leaving work earlier or arriving later.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You may choose to take annual leave or unpaid leave to cover a longer period of time of compassionate leave.</span><br /></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>ACT</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You should notify your manager as soon as possible of your absence, preferably by telephone, informing them of your inability to attend work and reason for the request.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are personally unable to contact your manager, you should arrange for someone else to do so on your behalf.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees are encouraged to utilise our free employee assistance program service if they wish to seek independent support during this difficult period.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>FINALISE</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Your manager or yourself will enter the leave into Workday.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Payment for compassionate leave in the event of bereavement, serious illness, injury or urgent domestic distress will be at your manager&rsquo;s discretion.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Who can I contact for further information?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have questions or clarifications regarding compassionate leave, contact People Connect online using the button on the top right hand corner of this page.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; background-color: #ffffff; 02:37:37","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Occasionally our employees may be asked to perform tasks that are beyond the normal scope of their role requiring time away from their usual place of work, or working in excess of their usual working days. At Lendlease we understand that fulfilling these requests can result in the employee incurring additional costs associated with caring for their dependents. The Dependent Care Rebate assists eligible employees by reimbursing part of the cost involved in organising an approved or registered carer to care for their dependent/s in their home.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent and fixed-term employees of Lendlease are eligible for the Dependent Care Rebate, subject to policy conditions.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Individuals employed under the terms and conditions of an operative enterprise agreement with a Lendlease group company, should refer to the relevant enterprise agreement to determine if this policy applies to you.</span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Term</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Definition&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Dependent &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A dependent is considered to be an immediate family member including partner, spouse, child, grandchild, parent, grandparent, brother, sister, step-parent, step-child, step-sister, step-brother, fianc&eacute; or fianc&eacute;e. It may also include your partner&rsquo;s immediate family or another person living with you as part of your family.&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Partner is one of two people in a marriage or de facto relationship, including those in same-sex relationships.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Approved Childcare</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Childcare provided by an approved service including centre-based long day care service, family day care service, occasional care service, in home care and some occasional-care services.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Please go to the website www.humanservices.gov.au for more information.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Registered Care&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Childcare provided by grandparents, relatives, friends, or nannies that are approved as a registered carer with the Australian Government.&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Please go to the website www.humanservices.gov.au for more information.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Fixed Term Employee&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee engaged for an agreed period of time where it is not expected that there will be an ongoing need for the position.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Full Term Employee&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee engaged on a permanent basis to work full time hours.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Part Term Employee&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee engaged on a permanent basis to work regular hours that are less than full time hours.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees can claim the rebate in situations where they are required by the business to undertake work commitments resulting in additional dependent care costs being incurred. This may occur due to a temporary planned event, or an unplanned event.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">Planned</span><br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Fulfilling temporary/ ad-hoc requests beyond the normal scope of the role (e.g. a part time employee is required to work an additional day, or an employee is required to travel interstate where this is not a normal requirement of their role).&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For example, John is a Finance Manager based in Adelaide and has been asked by his manager to travel to Sydney to attend a two day seminar. John is a single parent and the primary caregiver for his two children and is unable to arrange alternative childcare arrangements whilst he is away. In this situation, John could arrange for an approved or registered carer to care for his children in their home during the hours he would normally care for them (6pm to 7am), and claim a subsidy under the Dependent Care Rebate. &nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">Emergency/ Unplanned</span><br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Working additional hours at the request of the Company&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Breakdown in travel arrangements (e.g. delayed flight)</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For example, Lisa&rsquo;s manager asks her if she is able to stay back until 10pm to finalise a bid. Lisa normally finishes work at 5pm and gets home at 5.30pm to care for her very elderly mother of whom she is the primary carer. Lisa says that this will be ok, but needs to make alternative carer arrangements for her mother (through a registered carer). In this situation, Lisa is able to claim a subsidy under the Dependent Care Rebate for the hours where she would normally be the primary caregiver of her mother (5.30pm &ndash; 10pm).</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Ensure you meet the eligibility criteria listed above.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Organise a registered carer for your dependent and pay for the service. Obtain a receipt for the service provided.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>ACT</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Complete the Dependent Care Rebate Form and email this to the relevant payroll team. Ensure a copy of the receipt is attached.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease Services:&nbsp;<a href=\"mailto:Payroll.Admin@lendlease.com\" rel=\"nofollow\">Payroll.Admin@lendlease.com<br></a> Lendlease Engineering:&nbsp;<a href=\"mailto:Payroll.Admin@lendlease.com\" rel=\"nofollow\">Payroll.Admin@lendlease.com</a>.</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All other Lendlease Companies: <a href=\"mailto:PayteamAU@lendlease.com\" rel=\"nofollow\">PayteamAU@lendlease.com</a>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">FINALISE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You will be reimbursed the relevant amount in the next available pay run. Reimbursement will result in a reportable fringe benefit being included on your annual payment summary.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong><br>What does the rebate entitle me to?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease will reimburse approved or registered carer costs incurred under the Dependent Care Rebate for up to five occasions per calendar year. The employee is required to pay a maximum of $25 per day and Lendlease will cover the remaining carer cost.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Claims will be paid only within the current Fringe Benefits Tax year (1 April - 31 March). Reimbursement will result in a reportable fringe benefit being included on the employee&rsquo;s annual payment summary. Follow the link to find out more about Fringe Benefits Tax.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong><br>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; background-color: #ffffff; Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Strategic Working Plans (SWP) are owned by the Business Leader with People &amp; Culture and Finance executive partnership. SWP comprise two interdependent activities. It is both a risk management tool that informs decision making, and a means of optimising workforce effectiveness now and well into the future. &nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Workforce Strategy enables Businesses to model, articulate and shape the workforce of the future (3-5 years out). The Workforce Strategy is informed by and informs the Business Plan and considers future labour supply and costs; organisation and team design; the impact of technology disruptors on existing and future required capabilities. &nbsp;Approaches to develop or securing the future capability are identified with strategic action plans documented. The action plans in turn inform the operational Full Time Equivalent (FTE) Planning &nbsp;process, which is largely decentralised. It is important that the contributors understand the Strategic Workforce actions for the plan period.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Each year the business sets an Operational Budget which includes employment costs based on the forecasted resourcing needs for that year. The Operational Plans are prepared annually and forecast the required FTE and expected cost impacts. &nbsp;The forecasted FTE are expanded to the Career and Job Framework (CJF) Job Family and Role level FTE forecasts and captured at a business unit level, providing insight to how the workforce is developing against the plan.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To ensure financial targets are not impacted, managers should reference their operational FTE plans prior to approving new positions, promotions or job changes that will have an impact to employment costs. Your finance partner will be able to provide additional information if required.</span></p>","sys_created_by":"hinw325","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy 12pt;\">As part of this commitment, employees of the Company globally must conduct themselves in accordance with the highest ethical standards, and avoid even the appearance of impropriety by complying with the Lendlease Code of Conduct.&nbsp; In addition, this Ethics and Professional Conduct Policy serves as a supplement to the Lendlease Code of Conduct and is applicable to all employees of Lendlease subsidiary companies and divisions in the United States.&nbsp; If you have questions regarding the Company&rsquo;s Code of Conduct or this Ethics and Professional Conduct Policy, please Americas","u_last_review_date":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider_id":"","roles":"","direct":"false","description":"","disable_suggesting":"false","sn_grc_target_table":"","sys_class_name":"Knowledge","article_id":"a15850e21bebe410b03a9829bc4bcbb2","sys_id":"a0f0e0841b403410ef4543b4bd4bcbfb","use_count":"0","flagged":"false","disable_commenting":"false","valid_to":"2100-01-01","retired":"","u_add_to_homepage":"false","u_video_url":"","display_attachments":"false","latest":"true","summary":{"display_value":"KB0018798","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_summary/a954d55e1bbf6010ef4543b4bd4bcba8"},"sys_view_count":"4","revised_by":{"display_value":"Wendy Hinks","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/6a5918de13801a00d774fc04e144b08d"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"6","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"AMER","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/11683f0f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcbbb"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2024-12-19 04:52:27","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018830","sys_updated_by":"kohj323","sys_created_on":"2024-12-19 04:44:50","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">PURPOSE</span><br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease provides eligible employees with a Basic Life Insurance package, the ability to elect supplemental life insurance coverage for yourself or your dependents, and employee AD&amp;PL insurance benefit in the event of loss of life, limb, sight, speech or hearing.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">SCOPE</span><br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The benefits described below are available to all eligible salaried and hourly non-union employees.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">POLICY</span><br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Aetna Life Insurance Company</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">Basic Life Insurance</span><br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease provides eligible employees with a Basic Life Insurance package of two (2) times the employee's annual salary, the amount of which (combined with any employee supplemental life insurance plan) cannot exceed $1,000,000.00. Basic Life will be: (1) reduced to 75% of the pre-age 70 amount at age 70; and (2) further reduced to 50% of the pre-age 70 amount at age 75.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any amount over $50,000.00, is considered Group Term Life Insurance (GTL) and is considered a taxable fringe benefit. &nbsp;You are required to pay taxes on the amount over $50,000.00, as imputed income. &nbsp;This taxable benefit is subject to Social Security and Medicare taxes. &nbsp;This is reflected on your bi-weekly pay stub as GTL Benefit. &nbsp;Log into the&nbsp;<a href=\"http://www.lendlease.hrintouch.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Benefits Center</a>&nbsp;- Overview &gt; Additional Benefits &gt; Life &amp; AD&amp;D 2017 &gt; Edit (button) &gt; Bi-weekly Imputed Income, to see this taxable amount.&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">New Hires</span><br></strong> </span><br><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Supplemental Life Insurance (for self and dependents)</span></strong><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you wish, you may elect supplement life insurance coverage for yourself or your dependents.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Employee:</strong>&nbsp;1 Times Salary | 2 Times Salary | 3... | 4... | 5&hellip;up to $1,000,000 (combined maximum including Basic Life, provided by the company)</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Spouse/Domestic Partner:</strong>&nbsp;$10,000 | 20,000 | 30,000 | 40,000 | and so on up to $100,000</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Child:</strong>&nbsp;$5,000 | 10,000</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For each of these supplemental elections, certain payroll deductions apply. To review these deductions,&nbsp;access the current year rates located in the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Summary%20of%20Benefits%20Salaried%20LIFE%20and%20ADandPL.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Summary of Benefits&nbsp; -&nbsp;Salaried and AD&amp;PL\">Summary of Benefits&nbsp; -&nbsp;Salaried and AD&amp;PL</a>&nbsp;or the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Summary%20of%20Benefits%20Hourly%20LIFE%20and%20ADandPL.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Summary of Benefits&nbsp; -&nbsp;Hourly and AD&amp;PL\">Summary of Benefits&nbsp; -&nbsp;Hourly and AD&amp;PL</a>.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employee Supplemental Life will be: (1) reduced to 75% of the pre-age 70 amount at age 70; and (2) further reduced to 50% of the pre-age 70 amount at age 75.</span><br><br><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Guarantee Issue Limits are as follows</span></strong></span><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">:</span></strong><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Employee&nbsp;</strong>- Supplemental 5 times&nbsp;salary</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Eligible Spouse/Domestic Partner</strong>&nbsp;- $40,000</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Eligible Child(ren)</strong>&nbsp;- $10,000</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Guarantee Issue (GI) Limits are for new hires, rehires, and life event elections made within the \"31 day Eligibility period\".</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Proof of good health is required for Spouse/Domestic Partner Life $50,000 to $100,000. Evidence of Insurability (EOI) application is required within 31 days (eligibility period) of the date of hire, rehire, marriage, or becoming a domestic partner. Elections for new hires and life events can be made by contacting the Benefits Center at 844 549 6210 or online at&nbsp;<a href=\"http://www.lendlease.hrintouch.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Benefits Center</a>.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Child life insurance:&nbsp;&nbsp;Aetna does not require evidence of insurability on children.&nbsp; However, they cannot be home or hospital confined due to an illness.&nbsp;Children up to age 26 can be covered for child life insurance.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You may&nbsp;reduce or drop&nbsp;optional life insurance at any time during the year&nbsp;by going online to&nbsp;the&nbsp;<a href=\"http://www.lendlease.hrintouch.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Benefits Center</a>&nbsp;or calling 844 549 6210.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Domestic Partner Life<br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an employee wishes to add a Domestic Partner anytime during the year, please log into the Benefits Center and enter a Qualified Life Event.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Life Event Changes<br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have a qualified life event such as marriage and you would like to enroll and purchase Spouse Life Insurance, you may do so within 31 days of the life event.&nbsp; Election of spouse life up to the Guaranteed Issue (GI) amount of $40,000 can be made by contacting the&nbsp;<a href=\"http://www.lendlease.hrintouch.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Benefits Center</a> or calling 844 549 6210.&nbsp;Amounts $50,000 to $100,000 are subject to proof of good health.&nbsp; The Evidence of Insurability application process for additional amounts over the GI limit is also handled via the call center.&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have a qualified life event such as marriage and you would like to enroll and purchase life insurance on yourself, you may do so by contacting the&nbsp;<a href=\"http://www.lendlease.hrintouch.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Benefits Center</a>&nbsp;or calling 844 549 6210.&nbsp; However there are some rules surrounding the process and what is permitted.&nbsp; Reminder:&nbsp; There is a combined maximum of $1,000,000 (Basic Life 2x plus Employee Supplemental Life).</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>If you currently are not enrolled&nbsp;</strong>in optional employee supplemental life on yourself (you have Basic Life 2x salary only), you may add optional life insurance coverage amount of 1x Salary without evidence of insurability, provided such request is made within 31 days of the qualified life event.&nbsp; Amounts above this 1x Salary requires evidence of insurability.</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>If you currently are enrolled&nbsp;</strong>in optional employee supplemental life on yourself, 1x, 2x, 3x, or 4x salary, you may increase your optional life insurance coverage up to the plan&rsquo;s guarantee issue limit without evidence of insurability provided the request is made within 31 days of the qualified life event.&nbsp; The guarantee issue limit for employee supplemental life is 5x Salary.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You may still drop or reduce optional life insurance on yourself, spouse/domestic partner or children any time during the year by contacting the&nbsp;<a href=\"http://www.lendlease.hrintouch.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Benefits Center</a>&nbsp;or calling 844 549 6210.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">Beneficiaries</span><br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You may make changes to your beneficiaries at any time during the year by contacting the&nbsp;<a href=\"http://www.lendlease.hrintouch.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Benefits Center</a>&nbsp;or calling 844 549 6210. The employee is automatically the beneficiary for dependent (spouse/domestic partner/child) life insurance.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">Choosing Your Life Insurance&nbsp;Beneficiary</span><br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Accidental Death and Personal Loss (AD&amp;PL)</span></strong></span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Insured Persons: Two (2) times Earnings, rounded to the nearest $1, subject to a maximum of $1,000,000.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Note: The amount of Principal Sum will be: (1) reduced to 75% of the pre-age 70 amount at age 70; and (2) further reduced to 50% of the pre-age 70 amount at age 75. Insurance terminates at your Retirement.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In the event of loss of life, limb, sight, speech, or hearing employees are eligible to receive an AD&amp;PL insurance benefit. For a complete overview of each injury type and the insurance benefits associated, refer to the AD&amp;PL Summary Plan Description (SPD).</span></p>","sys_created_by":"wonl340","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<div>&nbsp;</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">At Lendlease when an employee leaves our organisation it is called a &ldquo;termination&rdquo;.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When a termination is sensitive or complex, your Strategic Business Partner will review the process and form, and will work with you to make sure you are properly supported and the correct policies and legal procedures are followed.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Voluntary terminations are employee initiated with common reasons being:</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &bull;&nbsp;Resignation</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &bull;&nbsp;Retirement</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &bull;&nbsp;Not returning from a period of leave</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Involuntary terminations are when the business decides to end the employment contract. Common reasons are:</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &bull;&nbsp;Redundancy</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &bull;&nbsp;Misconduct</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; &nbsp; &bull;&nbsp;Unresolved performance issues</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Strategic Business Partners should be consulted on all involuntary terminations.</span></p>\r\n</div>\r\n<div>&nbsp;</div>\r\n<div id=\"textAccordion\"><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">How do I initiate a Termination?</span></strong></span></div>\r\n<div>&nbsp;</div>\r\n<div>\r\n<div>\r\n<table style=\"width: 100.048%; height: 675px;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 392px;\">\r\n<td style=\"border-style: solid; border-color: #5c5858; width: 10.1024%; height: 392px;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>&nbsp;PLAN&nbsp;</strong></span></td>\r\n<td style=\"border-style: solid; border-color: #5c5858; width: 86.5246%; height: 392px;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the termination is due to a resignation you will need to have a resignation letter from the employee to finalise the termination process (this can be in the form of an email). A resignation letter is not&nbsp;required in the Americas region.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For all other types of termination, please check Lendlease policy and any other specific legislative requirements which will determine what documentation is required and when.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You will also need to establish:</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Is the notice period agreed the standard contractual notice?</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- What date is the employee&rsquo;s last working day?</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Is the employee&rsquo;s last working day the same as their end date?</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- What handover is required for the employee&rsquo;s work?</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- What assets does the employee have? When and how will they be returned to the business?</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Will the employee be changing their address in the near future?</span></td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 44.8px;\">\r\n<td style=\"border-style: solid; border-color: #5c5858; width: 10.1024%; height: 44.8px;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>&nbsp;PREPARE&nbsp;</strong></span></td>\r\n<td style=\"border-style: solid; border-color: #5c5858; width: 86.5246%; height: 44.8px;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Together with the employee, finalise and agree on the terms of the termination.</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 156px;\">\r\n<td style=\"border-style: solid; border-color: #5c5858; width: 10.1024%; height: 156px;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>&nbsp;ACT</strong></span></td>\r\n<td style=\"border-style: solid; border-color: #5c5858; width: 86.5246%; height: 156px;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For voluntary resignations the employee or manager can enter the termination in Workday. Please refer to the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Quick%20Facts%20-%20Initiate%20a%20Termination.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=zB9dI1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" title=\"Quick Fact Guide\">Quick Fact Guide</a>&nbsp;for more information.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For involuntary resignations the Strategic Business Partner will enter the termination record in Workday.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have any questions on this process please contact People Connect.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 44.4px;\">\r\n<td style=\"border-style: solid; border-color: #5c5858; width: 10.1024%; height: 44.4px;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>&nbsp;FINALISE</strong></span></td>\r\n<td style=\"border-style: solid; border-color: #5c5858; width: 86.5246%; height: 44.4px;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In some instances, approval may be required in line with the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018982\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" title=\"Limits of Authority\">Limits of Authority</a>.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n<div>&nbsp;</div>\r\n<div>&nbsp;</div>\r\n<div><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Notice Periods</span></strong></span>\r\n<div><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Notice periods are dependent on the terms and conditions in an employee&rsquo;s contract of employment and can vary. Leaders should contact their Strategic Business Partner to confirm the notice periods for their employees.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Notice periods do not apply for United States employees</span></div>\r\n<div>&nbsp;</div>\r\n<span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Resources</span></strong></span>\r\n<div>\r\n<table>\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td style=\"width: 80px; height: 80px; text-align: center;\" colspan=\"2\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">FAQ</span></strong></span>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Q - What does the Strategic Business Partner review?</strong></span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A - When an employee termination is complex or especially sensitive, your Strategic Business Partner is required to review the termination details. In some cases, specific legislation or policy determines how and under what&nbsp;terms an employee should leave e.g. in cases of redundancy, performance related dismissals or separations due to ill health. It is the responsibility of your Strategic Business Partner to support you and sometimes take the lead in these circumstances.</span></p>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>","sys_created_by":"mohn407","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"x_caukp_ebonding_integration_mode":null,"can_read_user_criteria":"","active":"true","cannot_read_user_criteria":"","published":"2025-04-29","helpful_count":"1","sys_domain_path":"/","u_view_count_all":"1,231","version":{"display_value":"6.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_version/2aca689c47912a102d72c701e36d43e2"},"x_caukp_ebonding_requester_id":"","meta_description":"At Lendlease when an employee leaves our organisation it is called a “termination”. sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are leaving Lendlease it is important to follow several steps to ensure correct payments are made including your salary, annual leave and any other eligible benefits as a result of voluntary or involuntary separation.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What steps do I need to take?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For <strong>Malaysia</strong>, <strong>Japan</strong> and <strong>China employees</strong>, refer to your employment contract to confirm the required notice period.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span 12pt;\">If your role within the Career and Job Framework (CJF) changes during your employment with Lendlease, this will result in a change to your notice period.</span></p>\r\n<table style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Enter your separation in Workday</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;Complete the Exit Clearance Form and ensure that all company property is returned to the respective departments prior to your departure. Items may include but are not limited to:</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;- Corporate credit card</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;- ICT equipment (laptop/desktop computer, docking station, mouse)</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;- Mobile phone and chargers</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;- Security passes</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;- Office/cabinet keys</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;- Any other assets or property belonging to Lendlease</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">Withholding Tax (Malaysia employees only)</span>:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For foreigners who cease employment with Lendlease in Malaysia or plan to leave Malaysia for more than three (3) months, Lendlease is required by the tax authorities to withhold payment of all monies due to your pending tax clearance.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Payroll Malaysia will provide you with Form CP21 to verify details of your tax payments and deductions to LHDN. Upon receipt of the tax clearance letter, any balance monies withheld will be released to you.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span style=\"color: #000000; text-decoration: underline;\">Withholding Tax (Singapore employees only)</span></span>:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For foreigners, including Singapore Permanent Residents who cease employment with Lendlease in Singapore or plan to leave Singapore for more than three (3) months, Lendlease is required by the tax authorities to withhold payment of all monies due to your pending tax clearance.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For Singapore Permanent Residents who have no intention to leave Singapore permanently and will continue to work in Singapore, you may submit a Letter of Undertaking together with your Exit Clearance Form prior to your departure, in order for Lendlease to release your final salary.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review the&nbsp;<a sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Medical leave is time off for an eligible employee to use to help deal with personal illness.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent full-time, fixed-term contract full-time employees and part-time employees employed on local terms are eligible for medical leave.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Additionally, Singapore based employees must complete 3 months of service before medical leave can be utilised.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Summer Hours Program is designed to help you maximize and enjoy your time during the summer season as well as promote a work-life balance.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All Lendlease US based employees with Manager approval.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How the Summer Hours Program Works<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you choose to work four additional hours on Monday through Thursday of a given week, you can take a half day after working 4 hours on Friday of that week.&nbsp; For example, if you work four additional hours on Monday through Thursday and your workday begins at 8:00 AM on Friday, you would be able to leave at Noon.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This flexible schedule program, which is dependent on business needs and approval from your manager, will be available from June&nbsp;through August. Employees will be able to participate in this program every other week dependant on the schedule you manager creates for your work group. Alternating weeks with your colleagues will allow for effective coverage and prevent disruption to work.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Generally, our standard hours are from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM with one hour for lunch. All employees are expected to be at work during these hours. During the Summer Hours Program, the time of arrival and departure may not differ from the standard hours by more than two hours except for Friday at early departure. For example, if you work three additional hours Monday through Thursday, you may leave at 2:00 on Friday. Employees must work a minimum of 4 hours on Friday.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees cannot &ldquo;bank,&rdquo; &ldquo;borrow&rdquo; or &ldquo;carryover&rdquo; summer flextime hours. In addition, lunch periods may not be skipped.&nbsp; Employees must use the time during the week or it is lost. Summer hours will not be available during the week of July 4th.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How to Participate<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are interested in participating in the Summer Hours Program, you will need to pre-plan with your co-workers and meet with your manager to discuss your schedule. Keep in mind that managers will need some time to collect requests to determine the best schedule that supports coverage. It is essential that we provide excellent service to our customers (internal &amp; external) through the end of the normal work week. Your manager will determine the best possible work schedule to ensure that a sufficient number of people are in place to accomplish this.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How to Record Your Time<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are in participating in the Summer Hours Program,&nbsp;<strong>you will need to record your actual hours worked on each day during that week</strong>.&nbsp; You should not just enter in 8 hours for each work day.&nbsp; For example, if you work one hour over on Monday through Thursday, you would enter 9 hours for each of those days and enter in 4 hours for Friday.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Please note that this Summer Hours Program can be suspended or discontinued at the discretion of senior leaders based upon business or office needs.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As we begin the summer, remember to be safe and to make work-life balance a priority! Enjoy this program over the coming months, and contact your Strategic Business Partner if you have any questions.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Access more information on the processes and procedures for&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018741\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Summer Hours Program\">Summer Hours sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Annual leave is paid time off work.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees are required to take all their annual leave each year. Any requests to carry over annual leave to the following year will need to be approved by managers. Typically any carry-over should not exceed one week (five days) and should only be agreed where Lendlease has requested the employee to defer their annual leave to meet business needs.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Approved carry-over annual leave must be used within the first three months of the following annual leave year.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This policy and procedure does not form part of any employees&rsquo; contract of employment and it may be amended at any time.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This policy applies to all UK Lendlease employees regardless of length of service. It does not apply to agency workers or self-employed contractors.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How many days of annual leave do I get?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The annual leave year runs from 1 April to 31 March and unless specified in your contract of employment, you will be entitled to 25 days annual leave per year, in addition to public holidays. This will be pro-rated for part-time employees. &nbsp;Where an employee joins the company part way through the holiday year, their annual leave will be pro-rated.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All employees who have joined the company on or after 1 April 2005 are entitled to 26 days leave after 5 years&rsquo; service and 27 days after 10 years&rsquo; service. This is pro-rated for part-time employees.&nbsp;</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; This free service is designed to help you and your family navigate the healthcare system and help you handle healthcare and insurance related issues. Some examples you may use Health Advocate:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To identify and make appointments to see the best physician or hospital for an illness;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For help with insurance claims and billing issues;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For help understanding an illness when you have been unable to get the time with your provider to ask all your questions; and</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To help with the transfer of medical records, x-rays and lab results prior to a scheduled appointment with a new physician.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Health Advocate is available to all US employees and families (children, spouses/domestic partners, parents and parents-in-law), whether or not the employee is enrolled in a Lendlease medical plan.<br><br></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Who can I contact about the benefit?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Visit the Health Advocate website or to reach a Personal Health Advocate, call toll free 866 695 8622 or <a href=\"mailto:Answers@HealthAdvocate.com\">Answers@HealthAdvocate.com</a>.</span></p>\r\n<p><span sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Needs analysis is the process of determining all the critical job and employee related information for a specific business need. &nbsp;This includes the necessary tasks, knowledge and skills required to perform the job as well as the capabilities required to perform the job effectively. The information gathered whilst conducting a job analysis can be used to create a job description.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Job design is the process of defining the specific tasks and responsibilities at an individual or group level. The key components of job design include determining an employee&rsquo;s responsibilities, authority over work, scope of decision making and Career Job Framework (CJF) code. Managers should also consider the hours and location of work and whether the job can be done flexibly.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">It is important that leaders take part in needs analysis and job design when reviewing positions in their team. This specifically applies to the recruitment process to ensure the right candidates are identified for positions based on merit and capability.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Whilst some roles are unchanging and require automatic replacement, the opportunity to grow your team&rsquo;s capability occurs with every new hire. Managers often replace a role at the same level of the previous incumbent, without considering what level is required for the role.</span></p>","sys_created_by":"hinw325","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"x_caukp_ebonding_integration_mode":null,"can_read_user_criteria":"","active":"true","cannot_read_user_criteria":"","published":"2021-05-05","helpful_count":"0","sys_domain_path":"/","u_view_count_all":"55","version":{"display_value":"2.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_version/85c707271bbbe0106d4e986cbc4bcb96"},"x_caukp_ebonding_requester_id":"","meta_description":"Needs analysis is the process of determining all the critical job and employee related information for","kb_knowledge_base":{"display_value":"People Connect Knowledge Base","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_base/01125e5a1b9b685017eeebd22a4bcb44"},"meta":"Needs Analysis and Job Design","u_problem_type":null,"topic":"General","display_number":"KB0018973 v2.0","base_version":{"display_value":"KB0018973 v1.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge/0b1487f41bbfa4106d4e986cbc4bcb5e"},"short_description":"Needs Analysis and Job Design - style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Coaching at Lendlease is about creating positive directed change. It is about developing potential and finding ways to live and work in a more productive, more satisfying way. The following information and resources are here to assist you in understanding and sourcing external coaching at Lendlease in Australia.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The use of an external qualified coach may not be suitable given the seniority of the person or development required. P&amp;C plays a supportive and guiding role in the coaching relationship by providing strategic guidance on the right development approach and sourcing appropriate coaches to meet the development need.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Guiding Principles for Coaching at Lendlease</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Business coaching is a partnering relationship between a professional coach and the employee that also requires the support of the manager and P&amp;C SBP/Manager.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Business coaching is a finite relationship that involves the identification of goals and the development of strategies, relationships and action plans intended to achieve those goals.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The success of coaching lies with firstly the individual and secondly with their manager who plays a critical role as they are active developers of their people.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A clear development plan outlining the development need and course of action so that progress can be monitored.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Using an external coach does not replace the people practices of managing, training or performance management.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Coaching Request Form</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you&rsquo;re interested in coaching, have a conversation with your manager who will assess this further with your P&amp;C SBP/Manager.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once it is agreed that coaching is the right solution, the line manager and P&amp;C SBP/Manager will complete the request&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Coaching%20Request%20Int.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=lXNvqr\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" title=\"form\">form</a>&nbsp;to initiate the process.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Tip Sheets:&nbsp;These tip sheets will provide you with information to help you gain a deeper understanding of what is involved in a formal business coaching process and help you prepare for the development activity.&nbsp; For coaching to a be a success all parties involved need to know what is required of them and what role they play in the process.</span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Flexible Spending Account (FSA) assists you with managing the cost of eligible out-of-pocket medical and dependent care expenses by allowing you to set aside a portion of pre-tax earnings to pay for qualified expenses. The FSA is funded through payroll deductions and used to reimburse you for these expenses. The benefit is administered by our third party vendor: Flores &amp; Associates.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Full -time salaried regularly scheduled to work at least 30 hours per week. Salaried employees are eligible to participate in the Benefit Programs on their date of hire.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I enrol?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As a new hire, you have 31 days from your start date to elect healthcare benefits. New employees should go to the Benefits Center (<a href=\"http://www.Lendlease.hrintouch.com\">www.Lendlease.hrintouch.com</a>) to complete all benefit enrolments with the exception of the 401(K) plan. Per the Plan provisions, if you do not make an affirmative election to enrol in, or decline healthcare coverage (i.e., fail to enrol) within 31 days from your start date, you will be deemed to have elected to waive coverage under all Plans, except the Plan&rsquo;s default benefits.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you miss the 31-day election window, you will be able to enrol during the Open Enrolment period in November for benefits to be effective January 1 of the following year.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have a qualifying event, such as a marriage, divorce, birth of a child, loss of other coverage, etc. you will be able to change your benefit elections mid-year by going to the Benefits Center within 31 days following the life event.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I use the benefit?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Health Care Flexible Spending Account</span></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Health Care Flexible Spending Account (FSA) can reimburse you for eligible expenses you or your eligible dependents incur that are not paid by your existing healthcare plan.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Plan for your upcoming expenses and include your spouse and dependents, if eligible. It is important to plan for your annual allocation as any remaining funds in your FSA will be lost if unused by the December 31<sup>st</sup> deadline shown on the claim form.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Click <a href=\"https://www.flores247.com/docs/MRA_Handout.pdf\">here</a> for more details regarding the Health Care FSA.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Dependent Care (day care) Flexible Spending Account.</span></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (FSA) can reimburse you for day care expenses provided for your dependents so that you (and your spouse, if you are married) can work. Care must be for a dependent child under the age 13 or a dependent of any age that lives in your household that is incapable of self-care.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Click <a href=\"https://www.flores247.com/fsaforms/DCRA_Handout.pdf\">here</a> for more details regarding the Dependent Care FSA.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Who can I contact about the benefit?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Visit <a href=\"http://www.flores247.com\">www.flores247.com</a> and log in using Participant ID or Username and password</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Customer Service 800.532.3327</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All employees will be classified into one of the following categories:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Exempt</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Non-Exempt</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All Lendlease AMER Employees</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All employees will be classified into one of the following categories:</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Exempt</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Executives, professional employees, and certain administrative employees who meet certain requirements generally are exempt from earning overtime pay under applicable law. If an employee is classified as &ldquo;exempt,&rdquo; the employee will not be eligible for overtime pay. Exempt employees are paid a set salary that is not based on the number of hours worked per week. Exempt employees are expected to work as many hours as are reasonably required to perform their assigned work. Such extra hours are considered part of the nature of many exempt positions and are accounted for in total compensation.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Non-exempt</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Professional and administrative employees who do not meet certain requirements are generally not exempt from earning overtime pay.&nbsp; If an employee is classified as &ldquo;non-exempt,&rdquo; the employee is eligible for overtime payments and will be paid time and one-half for all hours worked over forty (40) in one workweek.&nbsp; Certain states may also require overtime for hours worked in excess of eight (8) in one day.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The exemption classification depends entirely on the nature and responsibilities of the position and the relevant requirement of federal and local laws, regardless of the position level in the company. Any questions regarding position classification for a position within the Company should be directed to the Strategic Business Partner.</span></p>","sys_created_by":"hinw325","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy
