07:41:46","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018996","sys_updated_by":"kohj323","sys_created_on":"2024-12-19 05:30:56","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease recognizes the importance of parental leave to enable employees to fulfill their family responsibilities at the birth or adoption of a child. Parental or partner leave is available for both primary and non-primary care givers.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Following significant life events (birth of your child, adoption or foster care placement up to age 18), eligible employees in the Americas and their families are supported through one of two parental and partner leave options:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 8pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Parental leave is available to a primary parent, which is someone who has primary or full-time responsibility for the care of the child immediately following the arrival of their child.&nbsp; Upon arrival of the child you may take up to twelve weeks paid leave, and an additional unpaid leave period of up to eight weeks.</span></span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Partner leave is available to a spouse or domestic partner who does not have primary or full-time responsibility for the care of the child immediately following the arrival of their child.&nbsp; Partner leave must be taken within the first eight weeks from the life event date in increments of no less than one business day.&nbsp; Upon arrival of the child you may take up to two weeks (10 business days) of paid leave.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All leave taken under these policies will run concurrently with any FMLA leave, short-term disability leave, and any state or local leave to which you are entitled, where applicable and permissible under law.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee must provide the employer with at least 30 days&rsquo; notice when the need for this leave is foreseeable.&nbsp; When an employee becomes aware less than 30 days in advance the employee must provide notice to their supervisor as soon as reasonable.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All full-time salaried employees are eligible for this benefit.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply for parental or partner leave</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review the eligibility requirements.&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Access the parental (primary) or partner leave policy for further details and instructions.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #f8f8f8; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #f8f8f8; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=0136af391be256503569b91f034bcbc3\" alt=\"Parental and partner leave flow chart\" width=\"438px\" height=\"672px\">&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ACT&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are the birth mother, file your short-term disability claim with The Hartford first. Once the delivery date has&nbsp;occurred, then you may complete the&nbsp;parental leave request&nbsp;affirmation form and contact The Hartford to apply for&nbsp;parental leave.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Hartford will coordinate your leave with your short-term disability, if applicable.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Discuss your leave plan with your manager so they are able to manage your team&rsquo;s business needs.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">FINALIZE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Hartford will send you an email/letter to approve or request more information for the application.&nbsp;If you have any questions regarding your application or approval contact The Hartford.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you wish to stay in touch with the business during your parental leave, you can do so via your Lendlease email account.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Who can I contact regarding the benefit?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Changes to your parental&nbsp;leave dates or any questions regarding parental leave should be referred to The Hartford on 888.301.5615 or the benefits team (<a href=\"mailto:AmerBenefits@lendlease.com\">AmerBenefits@lendlease.com</a>).</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<div><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Regular one-on-ones are at the heart of our approach to performance management, encouraging frequent, open and constructive feedback on how employees are progressing throughout the year.</span></div>\r\n<div>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Our performance management approach aims to:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-type: disc; list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lift our people's performance impact through regular feedback helping us to achieve greater organisational performance</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Support our people's growth by providing development opportunities that advance their careers</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Ensure outstanding performance and greater contribution is recognised and rewarded</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In addition to regular one-on-ones are goal setting, mid-year and year-end conversations. These three conversations have specific objectives and guidelines, which you should review below.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Throughout the year we encourage ongoing conversations on career and wellbeing &amp; flexibility. Initiated by employees, these conversations aim to help employees manage their careers and balance their wellbeing and flexibility needs.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>GOAL SETTING</strong></span></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">While you should regularly discuss your goals with your manager, the start of a new financial year and any time you commence a new role are the perfect times to set goals.&nbsp; You should also review your goals during your mid-year conversation. Talk to your manager and agree your priorities, considering both 'what' is to be achieved and 'how' you are expected to achieve it.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Clear goals help to focus your efforts and ensure that you and your manager agree on what success looks like for the year ahead.&nbsp; We recommend writing three to five goals using the SMART framework.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Goal Setting Guidelines</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Goal%20Setting%20Guidelines_English.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" title=\"English\">English</a> &nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/FY21%20Goal%20Setting%20Guidelines%20ZH.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=ag9job\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Chinese</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/FY21%20Goal%20Setting%20Guidelines%20JA.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=mCfTpG\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Japanese</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/FY21%20Goal%20Setting%20Guidelines%20IT.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=rIdYug\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Italian</a></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Goal Setting - Quick Fact Guide</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Quick%20Fact%20Guide%20-%20Goal%20Setting.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">English</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Quick%20Fact%20Guide%20-%20FY21%20GOAL%20SETTING%20ZH.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=8Kc8aR\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Chinese</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Quick%20Fact%20Guide%20-%20FY21%20GOAL%20SETTING%20JA.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=6qIB9J\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Japanese</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Quick%20Fact%20Guide%20-%20FY21%20GOAL%20SETTING%20IT.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=e3jQbP\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Italian</a></span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Goal%20Setting%20during%20COVID_IT.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=cvjcV4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><br></a></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>MID-YEAR REVIEW CONVERSATION</strong></span></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Mid-year review conversations are an opportunity for employees and people managers to have a meaningful discussion on progress in the current year.&nbsp; They allow us the opportunity to not only reflect on our performance &amp; progress, but our wellbeing too.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">It is also an ideal time to:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">discuss what went well during the first half and what could be improved;</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">review the Financial Year goals and whether they need to be updated or amended;</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">check-in on health and wellbeing;</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">agree priorities for the rest of the year.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Each conversation will be different and may not touch upon all the suggested topics above.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Mid-year review conversation guide &ndash; for People Managers</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Mid-Year%20Review%20Conversation%20Guide_Managers.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">English</a></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Capturing mid-year conversation notes using Workday Feedback for People Managers - Quick Facts</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Quick%20Facts%20-%20Give%20Feedback.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">English</a></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Wellbeing resources&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0019101\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Conversation guides</a>&nbsp; |&nbsp; <a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/sites/Microsite-Health-Wellbeing/SitePages/In-the-Workplace.aspx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Wellbeing Microsite</a>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">YEAR-END REVIEW CONVERSATION</span><br></strong></span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Our year-end review conversations are an opportunity for our employees and people leaders to discuss achievements, development and progress over the year, as well as any areas of focus to improve on for the future.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Year-end conversations take place in June-July of each year.&nbsp; First, all employees complete a self-assessment in Workday on what went well during the year and what could have been improved.&nbsp; Next, year-end conversations are arranged between managers and employees to allow a meaningful two-way feedback discussion.&nbsp; People managers also need to complete the manager review in Workday and to provide a performance rating for each of their team members.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Year-end Performance Review Workday Quick Fact Guide - <strong>Employee Guide</strong></span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Quick%20Fact%20Guide%20-%20Employee%20Self%20Evaluation_FINAL.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=XahbVy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">English</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Quick%20Fact%20Guide%20-%20Employee%20Self%20Evaluation_FINAL_ZH%20.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=pPjUWu\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Chinese</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Quick%20Fact%20Guide%20-%20Employee%20Self%20Evaluation_FINAL_JA.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=7FdqOX\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Japanese</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Quick%20Fact%20Guide%20-%20Employee%20Self%20Evaluation_FINAL_IT.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=23rhLm\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Italian</a></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>WELLBEING &amp; FLEXIBILITY CONVERSATIONS</strong></span></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease is a place where you matter. We believe that if you are healthy and happy at work you are more likely to perform your best and be your best.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">What can you do to improve your wellbeing and feel supported to work more flexibly? A wellbeing &amp; flexibility conversation with your manager is a chance to talk about your current working arrangements, what you would like to change to better meet your flexibility needs, and anything else you might need to enhance your wellbeing at work.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can find support materials under our <a sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Employee Referral Program is designed to reward employees for successfully identifying and personally referring external job candidates.&nbsp; If a referred individual is subsequently hired, the referring employee may be eligible to receive a monetary reward after the new employee completes 90 days of employment in good standing.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I make a referral?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Step 1:</strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">View current openings within the region. &nbsp;Access Workday to see the list of current post openings.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Step 2:<br /></strong> Contact the person you believe to be a good fit for the opening. You can conveniently share the posted opening by email or social media by clicking the appropriate icon at the top right of the posted opening. Instruct the person to list you as their referrer when initially applying and on the formal application at the time of hire. If the applicant appears to strongly meet the qualifications for the position, you will be contacted by the recruiter to provide additional details on the candidate's qualifications and how you know them. &nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Step3:<br /></strong> If your referral is successful and subsequently hired you may be eligible to receive a monetary reward as per the Employee Referral Program Policy after they complete 90 days of employment in good standing.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Who can participate in the Employee Referral Program?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Employee Referral Program is available to all Lendlease Americas employees, except officers of the company, human resources and anyone who participates in the interviewing and candidate selection decision for the position (including the hiring manager).</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Paid Time Off (PTO) provides you with the flexibility to use your accrued PTO to meet your personal needs, while recognizing your individual responsibility to manage to your accrued PTO balance.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All full time (scheduled to work 30 hours per week or more) salaried employees are eligible for PTO.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY<br /></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PTO can be used for vacations, illness, caring for others, medical/dental appointments, personal business or emergencies.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Your manager&rsquo;s approval is needed for all PTO except in the event of sickness or an unplanned emergency. In these circumstances you are expected to notify your manager as soon as possible.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To support a safe work environment for all employees, individuals who have a contagious illness should not report to work.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PTO Bank Accrual<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PTO hours are earned or accrued each pay period based on the schedule below which assumes a 40 hour per week work schedule.&nbsp;Individuals scheduled to work less than 40 hours per week will have their accruals prorated based upon their weekly schedule.&nbsp; PTO does not accrue while out on an unpaid leave of absence or while receiving Supplemental Military Pay.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Effective October 3, 2015, the PTO accrual will be:</span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto; border-collapse: collapse; border: 1.5pt solid #DDDDDD;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Length of Service</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">25 days</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;border-top: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-left: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-bottom: 1.5pt solid #000000; border-right: 1.5pt solid #000000; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">7.69 Hours</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Break in Service</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When determining loss of service for PTO accruals for individuals who are rehired the following rules apply.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For employees who have a break in service with the company of 12 months or less, prior years of service will be recognized, adjusting the hire date to reflect the break in service, if the following criteria are met:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">prior years of service were as full-time, salaried employee, and</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">the employee has at least one year of uninterrupted prior service</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Managing your PTO Balance<br /></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To request PTO or view your accrued balance, log in to Workday and click on the Absence Worklet. Employees must plan vacations, etc. around the accrued, or available, PTO balance and should avoid going into a negative balance.&nbsp;<strong>Employees may only go into a negative PTO balance with their manager&rsquo;s prior approval. Further PTO requests will be managed closely to ensure a positive balance can be achieved in a reasonable amount of time.</strong>&nbsp;Additional requests for PTO while in a negative balance, may need to be unpaid.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The maximum number of hours that may be banked into your account is 300 hours. This is to encourage you to use your PTO and allows the company to manage its financial obligations.&nbsp; Once you reach the 300-hour cap, you will not earn or accrue additional PTO hours until the PTO balance goes below the cap.&nbsp; You will not receive retroactive credit for any accrual missed while above the cap limit.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Should you leave the company, you will be paid any accrued, unused PTO balance,&nbsp;following termination. If your PTO balance is negative, then the negative balance will reduce your final paycheck, as allowed by applicable state laws.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Please note when you leave the company, your last day of employment is your last day physically worked.&nbsp;</strong>PTO may not be used to extend your last day worked.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Access more information on the processes and procedures for&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018995\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Paid Time Off\">Paid Time Off</a></span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>","sys_created_by":"hinw325","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"x_caukp_ebonding_integration_mode":null,"can_read_user_criteria":"","active":"true","cannot_read_user_criteria":"","published":"2021-05-06","helpful_count":"2","sys_domain_path":"/","u_view_count_all":"1,164","version":{"display_value":"2.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_version/f0fb49441b403010ef4543b4bd4bcbe0"},"x_caukp_ebonding_requester_id":"","meta_description":"Americas People & Culture PURPOSE Paid Time Off (PTO) provides you with the flexibility to use your accrued","kb_knowledge_base":{"display_value":"People Connect Knowledge Base","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_base/01125e5a1b9b685017eeebd22a4bcb44"},"meta":"Paid Time Off - The form should be sent to payroll by the 10th&nbsp;of the month for payment. You can find the appropriate overtime form under the resources section.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For administration employees, an overtime form is available on Pulse. sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When leaving Lendlease it is important to follow a number of steps to ensure correct payments are made in relation to your salary, PTO, Stellar points, Vitality points, and other benefits as a result of a voluntary or involuntary separation.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Due to a 30-day window of opportunity to elect to continue most benefits, please take the time to review the <a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Benefits%20Exit%20Summary%20-%20Salaried.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Salaried Benefits Exit Summary</a>&nbsp;resource document regarding the transition of your healthcare related company benefits after your last day at work.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Group%20Guideline%20on%20Individual%20Data%20Handover.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Employee Data Handover Guideline</a>&nbsp;and&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/Handover%20Document%20template.docx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Data Handover Template</a>&nbsp;for guidance on managing your data when you are leaving Lendlease.&nbsp; </span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To arrange for remote collection of Lendlease equipment please click&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=sc_cat_item&amp;sys_id=1ec0ba34db40d0d0ee773313e29619dd&amp;sysparm_category=109f0438c6112276003ae8ac13e7009d\">here</a>.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>COBRA<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 (COBRA) makes it legally possible for employees and/or eligible dependents to continue their medical, dental and vision benefits in case of the following events:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Employee's resignation</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Employee's layoff</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Employee's disability</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Employee's reduction of hours</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Employee's involuntary termination</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Employee begins leave of absence</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Divorce/Legal separation</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Ineligibility of dependent child</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Death of covered employee</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Employee entitled to Medicare</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Separated employees automatically have their medical, dental and vision benefits (if elected) extended through to the last day of the month following their last day of work (note the last day of work may not be extended by Paid Time Off). Employees are responsible for electing and paying for COBRA continuation for medical, dental and vision benefits.</span><br /><br /><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SEVERANCE PLAN<br /></strong></span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Eligible employees may receive severance benefits when separated from Lendlease, to ease the transition into a future job.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What steps do I need to take?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><u>All Separations</u>:</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review the eligibility requirements above and read through the COBRA policy.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Refer to the following guides to manage employee benefits for your separation:</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Salaried employees &ndash; Salaried Benefits Exit Summary</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Non-union Hourly employees &ndash; Hourly Benefits Exit Summary</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><u>Separations Eligible for Severance</u>:</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Read through the Severance Pay Plan Policy.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For a complete review of eligibility and the full terms of the severance benefit, view the complete Severance Pay Plan Summary Plan Description (SPD).</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you currently have medical, dental, and vision coverage and you plan to elect COBRA to continue one or all of these benefits, you will receive a COBRA election packet in the mail from our COBRA administrator.&nbsp; Review the information, rates, and election timeline carefully.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are interested in electing COBRA continuation of coverage, complete and return the election form to the COBRA administrator by the deadline date as indicated.&nbsp; <em>Note:&nbsp; Health coverage is not reinstated with the insurance carriers, until your first COBRA payment is received by the COBRA administrator.</em></span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Who can I contact about the benefit?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have any questions regarding this benefit, please call 1-866-848-1200 and select option 2 or Ask People Connect online.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To help students in their transition from studies to work, Lendlease provides a work experience program. This offers students the opportunity to gain insight into a particular occupation or industry. It is a formal arrangement for students enrolled at an educational establishment to participate in activities at one of our Lendlease sites or offices on a voluntary basis.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Students in year 10 or above are eligible to apply.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Work experience students must be insured either personally or through their educational institution.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">International students must have obtained the appropriate visa allowing them to participate in the Australian Lendlease work experience program.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do students apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PREPARE</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The student or supervising employee (if pre-arranged) must provide a copy of the student&rsquo;s insurance documentation and complete the Work Experience Application Form.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>ACT</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Submit the application with required documentation to People Connect. If required, People Connect will liaise with the business to source a suitable supervising employee.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">FINALISE</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A confirmation letter will be sent to the student once a suitable placement has been found. The letter must be signed and returned to People Connect.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What do I need to do as the supervising employee?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; font-size: 12pt;\">Ensure the student&rsquo;s signed work experience letter has been returned to&nbsp;<a href=\"mailto:PeopleConnect@lendlease.com\">PeopleConnect@lendlease.com</a>&nbsp;with the necessary insurance documentation.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Use the Work Experience Agenda Template as a guide to plan out their daily activities. &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; font-size: 12pt;\">Complete the Work Experience Checklist, ensuring all items are ticked off and completed.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Upon commencement of placement, you must provide the student with a copy of our Workplace Conduct Policies and Code of Conduct Statement. &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; font-size: 12pt;\">Please note: If the school student is based in Victoria, you must ensure arrangements for payment have been made within the business. This payment is generally processed via a gift card or petty cash if applicable.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">It is Lendlease policy to provide parents with up to 18 weeks' unpaid leave per child for the purposes of caring for that child, subject to meeting certain conditions.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Ordinary Parental Leave is available to all employees based in the UK who have completed at least one year's continuous service with the Company.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Read through the Ordinary Parental Leave Policy.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In order to be able to apply for Ordinary Parental Leave during the period of your employment, you must first provide written evidence to your manager of your eligibility, outlining:</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">parental responsibility or expected responsibility for the child in question; and</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">the child's date of birth or date on which placement for adoption began.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are new to the Company, Lendlease reserves the right to request confirmation of Ordinary Parental Leave already taken from previous employers. That leave will then be deducted from any remaining entitlement once the qualifying period has been achieved.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Enter your leave request in Workday at least 21 days before the date on which leave is proposed to start. Include the dates on which the period of leave is to begin and end.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Requests to commence Ordinary Parental Leave immediately following the birth or adoption of a child must also be done so 21 days prior to the expected week of childbirth or adoption.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the period of the proposed leave is less than two weeks, the period of notice required is reduced to a period of twice the amount of the proposed leave.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ACT</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Following leave approval, payroll will be informed to suspend pay during the period of Ordinary Parental Leave.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">FINALISE</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once your return to work is confirmed, payroll will be informed to restart full pay.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Can my leave be postponed?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease may postpone a period of Ordinary Parental Leave (other than where Ordinary Parental Leave has been requested immediately after childbirth or immediately after placement for adoption and has met the written notice requirements) where the company considers that its business would be unduly disrupted if the employee were to take leave during the period requested.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In such a case, the Company will allow the employee to take an equivalent period of Ordinary Parental Leave beginning no later than six months after the commencement of the period originally requested.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease will give notice in writing of the postponement, stating the reason for it and specifying suggested dates for the employee to take Ordinary Parental Leave. Such notice will be given no more than seven days after the employee's notice was given to the Company.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; border-right: 1.5pt solid #FFFFFF; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Short Term Disability plan assists employees in meeting reasonable income needs in the event they become disabled longer than 7 calendar days; approved short term disability benefits begin on the eighth consecutive calendar day.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Eligible employees may receive a maximum period of 26 weeks of plan benefits coverage subject to length of service.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">There is a seven consecutive calendar day waiting period that requires you to use paid time off, if available, otherwise it is unpaid.&nbsp; Approved short term disability benefits will begin on the eighth consecutive calendar day.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All full-time salaried employees who are scheduled to work 30 or more hours per week are eligible.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once an employee satisfies the eligibility requirements they are enrolled automatically as of that date. The employee must be actively at work on the day their participation in the plan begins. If not actively at work on that day, their participation will be delayed until they are back at work</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I file a claim?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PLAN</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review the eligibility requirements.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Read through the Short Term Disability Policy and Summary available under the resources section of this page &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">At Lendlease we understand that our employees may occasionally require time off to work through issues relating to their dependents. &nbsp;Each case will be viewed sympathetically. Normally employees will be paid for reasonable time off to resolve urgent issues and to put the necessary short or long term arrangements in place where:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- A dependent falls ill, has been injured or is having a baby;&nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- An injured or ill dependent requires long term care;&nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- There is a disruption in care arrangements for a dependent; and / or&nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- There is an unexpected incident involving a dependent&rsquo;s schooling.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All full time or part time UK employees are eligible. &nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A dependent is the spouse, partner, child or parent of an employee. It also includes someone living in the same household who is a relative e.g. an elderly aunt, grandparent, etc. It does not include tenants or boarders.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PLAN</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Time off for dependents may range from one or two hours to a day or more. In most cases one or two days should be sufficient to deal with the circumstance, and it must be a genuine emergency.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>ACT</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You should notify your manager as soon as possible of the reason for your absence and how long you expect to be absent. You should then enter the absence for dependents leave into Workday.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: your coverage.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All benefits information may be found at the Benefits Center, except the 401(k). font-size: 12pt;\">For Example:</span></strong></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When am I eligible to make a change to my healthcare coverage?</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas People &amp; Culture</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">Authorized Time Off is for time during normal business hours not worked due to circumstances outside of the control of the employee or community related</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\"><strong>SCOPE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">If authorized by their manager, and if in accordance with the guidelines below, employees may record time on their timesheet as \"authorized time off\" (Pay Type 14).&nbsp; This would be for time during normal business hours not worked due to circumstances outside of the control of the employee or community related.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\"><strong>POLICY<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">Appropriate uses of \"authorized time off\" include:&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">- Office closings prior to company holiday</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">- Office closings due to inclement weather</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">- Bereavement</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">- Jury duty</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">- Voting time</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">- Blood donation</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">- Company closings</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">- Community service activity</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">- Professional Licensing</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">- Springboard program conference</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">Please note that this time off should not be recorded to the extent it would cause the total hours to:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">- Exceed 40 hours in the week for exempt employees, or</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">- Exceed 8 hours in the day for non-exempt employees (except when Authorized Time Off is used for Community Day and Professional Licensing)</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\"><strong>Office Closings Prior to Company Holiday<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">Time lost due to the office closing early prior to a holiday should be recorded as Authorized Time Off only if total hours for the week are under 40 hours.&nbsp; If hours for the week meet or exceed 40, time lost due to the closing should not be recorded. Employees are unable to supplement ATO time during days they are not at work. For example, if you take a PTO day on the same day the company has offered 2 hours of ATO for early office hours closing, you are not eligible for ATO. Similarly, while on a half day of PTO, you are unable to supplement any ATO time offered for office closings.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\"><strong>Inclement Weather<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">Time lost due to office closings or delays should be recorded as Authorized Time Off only if total hours for the week are under 40 hours.&nbsp; If hours for the week meet or exceed 40, time lost due to the closing should not be recorded.&nbsp; If an employee chooses to stay home and the office is not officially closed or delayed, personal, vacation time (or PTO) should be used.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\"><strong>Bereavement<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">If there is a death in your immediate family, please notify your manager as soon as possible.&nbsp; Immediate family includes your spouse, domestic partner, child, parent (in-laws), sibling (in-laws) &amp; grandparent (in-laws).&nbsp; Authorized Time Off up to a maximum of five (5) paid days may be authorized.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\"><strong>Military Training Services<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">Refer to the&nbsp;Military Leave Page.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\"><strong>Jury Duty<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">If you are summoned to report for jury duty or as a subpoenaed witness in a civil or criminal proceeding, you will receive your regular pay for approved hours of absence for up to two weeks.&nbsp; You may keep the jury duty check you receive.&nbsp; If you are summoned for Grand Jury service, please advise your immediate manager.&nbsp; An employee called for jury duty should give immediate notification to her/his supervisor in order to permit appropriate work planning.&nbsp; If an employee is required to give jury service beyond a two-week period, special determination will be made regarding the extent of additional compensation.&nbsp; If the employee is excused from jury duty on any day, it is expected that she/he will report for work.&nbsp; You should obtain a court-supplied document of certification, completed by the court after your service is performed, as well as a copy of your pay voucher.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\"><strong>Voting Time<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">If an employee who is a registered voter does not have sufficient time to vote outside her/his working hours, she/he may receive paid time off to vote, not to exceed one hour at the beginning or end of the work day or in conjunction with the employee's lunch hour.&nbsp; An employee who is not working for a least two (2) consecutive hours while the polls are open will be deemed to have sufficient time to vote.&nbsp; An employee requesting time off to vote will schedule it with her/his supervisor before Election Day.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\"><strong>Blood Donation<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">Employees will be paid their straight time pay for time lost from their regularly scheduled working hours in order to donate blood to the Red Cross.&nbsp; Such pay will include reasonable time spent going to and returning from the Blood Donor Centre.&nbsp; Note that this policy applies to donation of blood to the Red Cross only.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\"><strong>Community Service<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">Employees are encouraged to become more involved in their communities by doing volunteer work.&nbsp; Employees are entitled to do volunteer work during regular working hours not to exceed two hours per month unless unusual circumstances exist.&nbsp; Approval of service by each employee's supervisor is necessary to ensure that the company's work is properly accomplished.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\"><strong> Professional Licenses<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">Time off with pay will be granted to employees who have made application for a state registration, licensing examination or similar exams.&nbsp; This applies to actual test date(s).&nbsp; The registration or exam must be professionally relevant and must be approved in advance in writing by the Senior Vice President.&nbsp; Fees associated with the exam itself will be reimbursed upon submittal of registration confirmation (i.e., a copy of the admissions paid receipt).&nbsp; Fees related to review courses or preparation courses are also subject to reimbursement and approval by the Senior Vice President.&nbsp; The company will reimburse the cost of securing and maintaining a state license or registration.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\"><strong>Community Day<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">Any employee that chooses to participate in Community Day, with approval from their manager, should record all time spent whilst working on their assigned Community Day project. The guidelines for recording time due to participation in a Community Day project are as follow:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">- Overhead Employees &ndash; Any employee that currently charges time to a specific Overhead should record all time spent working on a Community Day Project to their usual Overhead account.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">- Project Employees &ndash; Any employee that currently charges time to any project, should record all time spent working on a Community Day project as Authorized Time Off.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">*Authorized Time Off (Pay Type 14) should be recorded on the employee timesheet in the applicable fields.&nbsp; This time is to be recorded after authorization has been given by the employee&rsquo;s manager.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\"><strong>Springboard</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">Employees selected to participate in Springboard may use Authorized Time Off (ATO) for time related to the conference program and business travel. If you have other Springboard questions, please click&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/sites/C1_Social_Impact_Hub/SitePages/Springboard.aspx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" title=\"here\">here</a>.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #000000;\">Access more information on the processes and procedures for&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018989\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" style=\"color: #000000;\" title=\"Authorized Time Off&nbsp;(ATO) process\">Authorized Time Off&nbsp;(ATO) process</a></span></p>","sys_created_by":"hinw325","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"x_caukp_ebonding_integration_mode":null,"can_read_user_criteria":"","active":"true","cannot_read_user_criteria":"","published":"2021-05-06","helpful_count":"0","sys_domain_path":"/","u_view_count_all":"1,330","version":{"display_value":"2.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_version/6beb09441b403010ef4543b4bd4bcb65"},"x_caukp_ebonding_requester_id":"","meta_description":"Americas People & Culture PURPOSE Authorized Time Off is for time during normal business hours not worked","kb_knowledge_base":{"display_value":"People Connect Knowledge Base","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_base/01125e5a1b9b685017eeebd22a4bcb44"},"meta":"Authorized Time Off","u_problem_type":null,"topic":"General","display_number":"KB0018813 v2.0","base_version":{"display_value":"KB0018813 v1.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge/71f5cd2e1b232810b03a9829bc4bcb39"},"short_description":"Authorized Time Off Policy - Long service leave is granted in recognition of long term and continued employment at Lendlease.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">What are the eligibility requirements?</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent and casual employees of Lendlease are eligible.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This is a specific benefit for Australian employees. Long service leave is governed by applicable state legislation or the relevant award.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I confirm my long service leave balance?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can access your balance in Workday. Please note, your long service leave balance accrues from the day you begin working for the company. Whilst you can see a leave balance in the system, you may not yet be eligible to apply for the leave in accordance with state legislation. &nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you believe there is a discrepancy, please contact People Connect.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt;
