&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">August 2013</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;padding-top: 0.75pt; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review Date</span></strong><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">November 2016</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; ;padding-top: 0.75pt; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Next Review Date</span></strong><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">November 2018</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Respect for one another is an integral part of the Lendlease culture. This includes respecting individual ideas, views and beliefs. By providing employees with appropriate avenues for expressing their views, complaints and concerns, the Company is committed to maintaining good employee relations through effective communication and the resolution of work related issues.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This Employee Concerns and Advocacy policy applies to all Lendlease businesses.&nbsp;This policy applies to employees, directors, consultants and contractors; permanent, fixed-term and casual (Aust only) contracts; full and part time; salaried, wages (Aust only) or union (US only). This policy applies in all geographies in which Lendlease operates.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Most issues or grievances can be resolved by open communication. An employee who wishes to express a complaint or concern regarding a work related problem is encouraged to resolve the issue informally through discussions with his or her immediate manager. Alternatively, the employee may wish to discuss their concerns, thoughts or comments with another manager in the organisation or their local Strategic Business Partner - People &amp; Culture.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees are free to raise any issue using any of these avenues of communication without fear of coercion, discrimination, or reprisal. There will be no retaliation against any employee for raising concerns. All issues, concerns, investigations and resolutions will be kept confidential (where practicable and appropriate under the circumstances).</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Group companies in each jurisdiction may also have their own more detailed procedures which supplement this Policy and take into account local protected disclosure and other laws. Where there is any inconsistency between local laws and procedures and this Policy, those local laws and procedures will prevail.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Further information and related materials<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Download&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/POL_Employee%20Concerns%20and%20Advocacy.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=gfgWdI\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Employee Concerns and Advocacy policy<br /></a> <a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018985\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Employee grievance procedures</a>&nbsp;can be found in the policies section on People Portal.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employee procedures around managing issues of&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018801\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">harassment and bullying</a>&nbsp;can be found on People Portal.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have any questions on this policy please contact&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=home_esc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"People sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Set by the Australian Government, modern awards are created under the national workplace relations system and relate to specific industries or occupations. Together with the National Employment Standards, modern awards determine fair and relevant minimum terms and conditions of employment.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Modern awards provide a minimum safety net around areas like pay rates and conditions of employment and are amended each year by Fair Work Australia.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For more information on modern awards visit the Fair Work Commission website.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I find out more about modern awards?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Our business is diverse and spans numerous different industries and occupations, so there are a number of modern awards that are relevant to our employees. Below is a list of modern awards that relate to some of our employees. Click on the link to view the relevant award.&nbsp; For more information, please refer to the Fair Work Commission website or contact People Connect.</span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"5","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"ASIA","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/6768bb4f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcbd1"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2025-03-18 19:49:59","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A trip to a foreign country can be a wonderful experience, but should an emergency arise, here are how your Lendlease (US) plans will provide coverage. Be sure to take sufficient supply of any maintenance medication with you and put it in your carry-on bag. Please refer to the following information if you are covered by one of the listed plans.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I use my medical benefit outside the US?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">United Healthcare (UHC) and Express Scripts Prescriptions Plan</span></strong></span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You will only be covered for emergency treatment when outside the US.&nbsp;&nbsp; Please note you will need to pay up front for any medical or prescription bills you incur, then you can submit them to UHC using the UHC Foreign Claim Form, or to Express Scripts using the and Express Scripts Prescription Drug Reimbursement Form.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><strong>Express Scripts</strong></span>&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You will only be covered for emergency treatment when outside the US. &nbsp;Please note &nbsp;you will need to pay up front for any medical or prescription bills you incur, then you can submit them to UHC using the UHC Foreign Claim Form, or to Express Scripts using the and Express Scripts Prescription Drug Reimbursement Form.</span><br><br><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>The Hartford Travel Assistance</strong></span></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When you are more than 100 miles from home you have direct access to round-the-clock support when travelling for business or pleasure for medical emergencies, cash, emergencies, evacuations, prescription refills and more. The program even pays for a companion to remain with you if you need to be hospitalized for more than seven days.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>UHA Hawaii</strong>&nbsp;</span></span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">UHA offers global emergency services through Assist America. Assist America is automatically activated when a UHA member travels more than 100 miles away from home. For the services to be covered, members must arrange all services through Assist America.&nbsp; Contact <strong>(800) 304-4585</strong> or <strong>(609) 921-0868</strong> for immediate assistance.&nbsp; Assist America provides services including medical referrals, monitoring, evacuation, repatriation, emergency prescription refills and more. A free smartphone app is available which provides a US Embassy Locator, Pre-Trip Information and an emergency phone call button.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">All other UHA overseas services</span><br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">UHA will reimburse members at a non-participating rate (80% of Eligible Charge). To receive reimbursement, members need to submit an international claim form (HCFA1500) and billing invoice. Both items should be converted into English and US dollars. Members will be reimbursed up to their respective policy and benefit limits.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">MetLife Dental</span><br></strong> &nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Benefits are available for dental services received outside of the US by a foreign provider.&nbsp; You will need to pay up front and be reimbursed by submitting copies of invoices with a MetLife claim form.&nbsp; Any foreign currency will be converted into US dollars. MetLife will allow benefits based on current plan provisions.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">VSP Vision Plan</span><br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are enrolled in the VSP Vision Plan, you can utilize the vision benefits outside of the US.&nbsp; You will need to pay up front and then file a claim for out-of-network benefits using the VSP Out of Network Reimbursement form along with copies of receipts from the medical provider.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Life Insurance</strong>&nbsp;</span></span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Lendlease life insurance plan includes a &ldquo;repatriation of remains&rdquo; benefit that covers the preparation and transportation of the employee&rsquo;s body to a mortuary if they suffer an accident and pass away more than 200 miles from their primary residence. Please note this covers accidental deaths only. If an employee passes away while overseas due to illness, this would not be included.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: #169179;\"><strong style=\"font-family: 'Arial Narrow', sans-serif;\"><span style=\"font-family: Arial, sans-serif;\">Critical Incident Definition</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin: 0cm 0cm 6pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: 'Arial Narrow', sans-serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;\">Any event that had the potential to result in, or has resulted in, LARGE or VERY LARGE impacts (refer to the Impact Table below).</span></p>\r\n<table style=\"border-collapse: collapse; width: 84.8938%;\" border=\"1\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td style=\"width: 12.9134%; text-align: center;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Impact</span></strong></td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 39.1339%; text-align: center;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Health &amp; Safety</span></strong></td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 47.9528%; text-align: center;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Environmental</span></strong></td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td style=\"width: 12.9134%;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Very large</span></td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 39.1339%;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Fatality due to Injury or Occupational Illness</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Kidnapping of an employee</span></p>\r\n<span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Evacuation of employee&rsquo;s due to threat of fatality </span></td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 47.9528%;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Irreversible on-site and/or off-site damage; On-site and/or off-site damage with clean up or remedy work incurring a very large impact </span></td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr>\r\n<td style=\"width: 12.9134%;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Large</span></td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 39.1339%;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Injury or Occupational Illness that results in permanent disability </span></td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 47.9528%;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Treatable on-site and/or off-site damage with clean up or remedy work incurring a large impact. </span></td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p style=\"margin: 0cm 0cm 6pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: 'Arial Narrow', sans-serif;\">&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p style=\"margin: 0cm 0cm 6pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: 'Arial Narrow', sans-serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">A critical incident has the potential to overwhelm the usually effective coping skills of either an individual or group. Critical incidents typically cause a &lsquo;detrimental&rsquo; impact which can include:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">significant disruption;</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">increased levels of tension;</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">emotional responses, and</span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">changes in performance.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p style=\"margin: 0cm 0cm 6pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: 'Arial Narrow', sans-serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Leaders can significantly assist recovery by providing the following supportive behaviours, called the three Rs approach: <strong>Recognise, Respond, Refer</strong>.</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"margin-top: 0cm; margin-bottom: 6pt; list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\"><strong>Recognise</strong> signs of post-incident stress as normal reactions. </span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\"><strong>Respond</strong> with a supportive approach and talking with all impacted employees. </span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\"><strong>Refer </strong>the employee to further support or counselling, e.g. an Unmind Therapist, their family, or a GP.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p style=\"margin: 0cm 0cm 6pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: 'Arial Narrow', sans-serif;\">&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p style=\"margin: 0cm 0cm 6pt; font-size: 11pt; font-family: 'Arial Narrow', sans-serif;\"><strong><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #169179;\">For urgent critical incident support&nbsp;on Lendlease sites or assets please contact Unmind.</span></strong></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin: 0cm 0cm 6pt; Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This plan is designed to provide non-union hourly or casual employees with the flexibility to meet their personal needs during the work week. Hourly Paid Time-Off (PTO) may be used during regularly scheduled work hours for when an employee does not work. Eligible employees begin accruing Hourly PTO hours at the start of their employment.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements and how do I earn Hourly PTO hours?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Eligible employees are full-time and part-time, non-union hourly employees working more than 90 consecutive days. &nbsp;PTO will be calculated at the start of employment and hours will be deemed accrued and may be used 90 days from the employment start date, in increments of a minimum of one (1) hour. Eligible employees will accrue .0385 hours of PTO per hour of work recorded, with a maximum limit of 40 work hours per week.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">At the end of each calendar year, unused, accrued PTO hours continue to stay in the employees Hourly PTO bank, however, hours will stop accruing at 160 hours.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><br />How do I request my Hourly PTO?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review the eligibility requirements and read the Hourly Paid Time-Off Policy and Frequently Asked Questions for more details. Unless an emergency or sudden illness occurs, employees must notify their supervisor seven (7) days in advance, or as early as possible, prior to taking Hourly PTO.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Hourly PTO hours must be fully accrued to be used; verify your balance with your supervisor prior to requesting or taking Hourly PTO. Work with your supervisor to determine any time where work schedules may preclude taking time off or where other employees may have already requested time off.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>ACT</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Track your eligible hours and use them based on the policy, as approved by your supervisor.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Enter your PTO request in Workday and record your PTO hours along with all regular hours submitted to payroll weekly. &nbsp;Enter \"Pay Type\" 36 within E1 Employee Self-Service and \"Pay Type\" 86 if paid bi-weekly. &nbsp;If you record your hours on a written timesheet you should write \"PTO\" on the days in which you take PTO hours.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">FINALIZE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Balances are available in E1 Employee Self-Service. Upon separation from employment, eligible employees will be paid for any accrued, unused PTO hours following their last day, unless state law requires otherwise.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><br />Who do I contact about the benefit?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have any questions about the Hourly PTO Plan, please call People Connect on 866 848 1200 and select option two or ask People Connect online using the link on the top right corner of this page.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"11","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"AUST","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/31b8378f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcbd0"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2025-04-13 05:06:10","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Changes in your family often require changes to your benefit plans. If you have experienced a qualifying Life Event, you can make benefit changes within 31 days of the event.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements Qualifying?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">These are events that qualify for a Life Event:</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1.&nbsp;Marriage, legal separation, divorce, or annulment since last election</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2.&nbsp;Birth of a child since last election (even if you have Family coverage today you must add a new child)</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">3.&nbsp;Adoption or placement for adoption of a child since last election</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">4.&nbsp;Death of your spouse or child since last election</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">5.&nbsp;Change of dependent status of a child (such as attaining age limit or change in availability of benefits through child's employer) since last election. (NOTE: A child may remain covered to age 26 regardless of employment or availability of coverage through employer.)</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">6.&nbsp;Termination (or commencement) of employment of spouse or dependent since last election</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">7.&nbsp;Change in employee's, spouse's or dependent's job or residence location since last election, resulting in stoppage of HMO coverage</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">8.&nbsp;Judgment, decree, or order resulting from a divorce, legal separation, annulment, or change in legal custody (including issuance of a qualified medical child support order) that affects the child's eligibility for coverage under this or other parent's health plan since last election</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">9.&nbsp;Taking an unpaid leave of absence by the employee, spouse, or dependent or returning from such a leave, since last election</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">10.&nbsp;Switching from part-time to full-time employment or from full-time to part-time status by the employee or spouse since last election</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">11. Significant change in the health care coverage or cost of coverage of the employee or spouse attributable to the spouse's employment since last election (for example, any material loss or addition of health benefits under spouse's employer's plan that changes the employee's or spouse's coverage)</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">12.&nbsp;You or your spouse becoming enrolled in Medicare or Medicaid or losing eligibility for Medicare or Medicaid</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">13.&nbsp;You or your eligible dependents either lose Medicaid or Children&rsquo;s Health Insurance Program (CHIP) coverage because you are no longer eligible, or become eligible for a state&rsquo;s premium assistance program under Medicaid or CHIP. You will have 60 days &ndash; instead of 31 &ndash; from the date of the Medicaid/CHIP eligibility change to request enrollment.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">14. Changes in coverage due to an election made by your spouse or dependent under the spouse's or dependent's employer's benefit plan if the other employer plan has a different open enrollment period that relates to a period that is different from the plan year for this plan (for example, your spouse's open enrollment is in January and your spouse changes coverage)</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">15.&nbsp;Changes in the availability of benefit options or coverage (additional or removal) under the plan</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">16.&nbsp;Significant increase or decrease in the cost of coverage during the plan year</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">17.&nbsp;Eligibility for a special enrollment period</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">18.&nbsp;Eligibility for COBRA continuation coverage or extended coverage under USERRA</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">19.&nbsp;Change in employment status so that you are no longer expected to average at least 30 hours of service per week, if you enroll in another plan that provides minimum essential coverage</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">20.&nbsp;Qualifying for either a special or annual enrollment period in the Health Insurance Marketplace</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account<br></strong> </span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">21.&nbsp; Change in dependent care provider</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">22.&nbsp;Change in fees charged by dependent care provider (as long as provider is not a relative)</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I submit a Qualifying Life Event?</strong></span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You have a 31 day window to report and make any change(s) in your family&rsquo;s status, health coverage elections, life insurance coverage elections and report any qualifying life event change during the plan year.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Source supporting documentation as required under the dependent verification requirements guidelines/website.&nbsp;<br><br></span></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have experienced one of the changes listed under the eligibility requirements, log on to your account on the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://secure-enroll.com/sso/saml/Lendlease/sp1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" title=\"Benefits Center\">Benefits Center&nbsp;</a>and upload any required documents.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You will be able to make changes to your medical, dental, vision, FSA, life insurance, Metlife Critical Illness, Metlife Hospital, or Accident Plans (as well as update your life insurance beneficiaries) on the Benefits Center.</span><br><br></li>\r\n<li style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have added a dependent under medical, you will receive a new identification card from the insurance carrier.&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Who can I contact about a qualifying life event?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For questions regarding the benefit, contact the Benefits Center on 844.549.6210</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; background-color: #ffffff; Event","u_problem_type":null,"topic":"General","display_number":"KB0018736 v6.0","base_version":{"display_value":"KB0018736 v5.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge/8f44217bdb7d8a50ee773313e296192f"},"short_description":"Qualifying Life Event - Americas","u_last_review_date":"2025-04-11","x_caukp_ebonding_provider_id":"","roles":"","direct":"false","description":"","disable_suggesting":"false","sn_grc_target_table":"","sys_class_name":"Knowledge","article_id":"0377f330db236c50ee773313e2961988","sys_id":"c57e49121b78a210727c0e12604bcb19","use_count":"0","flagged":"false","disable_commenting":"false","valid_to":"2026-04-11","retired":"","u_add_to_homepage":"false","u_video_url":"","display_attachments":"false","latest":"true","summary":{"display_value":"KB0018736","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_summary/f044115e1bbf6010ef4543b4bd4bcb9f"},"sys_view_count":"0","revised_by":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"5","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"AMER","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/89c8b38f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcb85"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2024-02-29 00:08:19","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018803","sys_updated_by":"raiv416","sys_created_on":"2021-05-05 21:50:42","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Americas Legal &amp; Compliance</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 231.05pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: top; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Approver's name and title:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Michael G. Serafino</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Chief Compliance &amp; Litigation Officer, Americas</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 231.05pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: top; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Effective date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">September 2020</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 231.05pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: top; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">September 2020</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 231.05pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: top; padding: 0.0pt 5.4pt 0.0pt 5.4pt;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Next review date:</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">January 2022</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Perceived benefits of engaging an individual as an independent contractor (also referred to as a &ldquo;consultant&rdquo;) include the avoidance of certain benefits afforded to employees under federal, state, and local law. For example, independent contractors are not entitled to minimum wage or overtime pay under federal or state law, and a company also avoids tax withholding and remittance and insurance obligations. However, it is important to understand that where an individual is incorrectly classified as an independent contractor rather than an employee, the company could be in violation of applicable law. Independent contractor engagements must not be for purposes of avoiding the provision of benefits or the payment of applicable taxes.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Misclassifying individuals as consultants or independent contractors may result in significant penalties to Lendlease. Penalties could include significant tax, wage, and benefit liabilities; unanticipated (and perhaps underinsured) tort liability to third parties for injuries caused by contractors; as well as significant fines and/or license revocation. In addition, having an individual work without a contractual or employment relationship exposes Lendlease to undue risk.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Please follow this Policy prior to making any commitment to engage an independent contractor to provide services to Lendlease in the Americas, including engaging a former employee to provide services to the Business. Failing to follow policy and procedure could result in penalties to you, up to and including termination.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This policy applies to all employees in the Americas Region of Lendlease including those who are permanent or fixed term and working full-time or part-time.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The engagement of an independent contractor or consultant must be approved by Americas People &amp; Culture, Tax, and Legal before Lendlease makes any commitment or services begin. These procedures apply to contracts for the provision of business services (as distinct from vendors providing goods and materials under a purchase order or supply agreement).</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">It is the relevant Business' obligation to submit requests for initial approval or renewal to People &amp; Culture with sufficient time for People &amp; Culture, Tax, and Legal to conduct review. It is the relevant Business' obligation to work with People &amp; Culture to properly classify the individual. Legal will confirm once all required approvals have been obtained before People &amp; Culture proceeds with onboarding the individual in the appropriate classification.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Start by engaging your People &amp; Culture Strategic Business Partner. People &amp; Culture will consider the facts relevant to the engagement, including interviewing the hiring manager and/or the individual as appropriate, using the Independent Contractor Classification Tool (defined below).&nbsp; People &amp; Culture will thoroughly document the relevant facts.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Where further review is necessary, People &amp; Culture will provide the relevant facts to regional compliance counsel, who will, as appropriate, review the proposed classification and consult with People &amp; Culture.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In the event the principal or employees of a corporation will provide the services, as opposed to an individual or sole proprietor of a LLC, further review may not be necessary to approve independent contractor status.&nbsp; In the event an individual will be acting as an employee rather than a consultant, and classification as an independent contractor is not appropriate, People &amp; Culture will advise regarding onboarding the individual under the appropriate classification.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All independent contractor engagements require a current, written agreement setting forth the terms of the relationship, which must be reviewed and approved by Legal.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>CONSEQUENCES OF BREACHING THIS POLICY</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Disciplinary action may be taken at Lendlease&rsquo;s sole discretion if this policy is breached. This may include action up to and including dismissal in appropriate circumstances.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Penalties against Lendlease for misclassifying individuals as independent contractors could include significant tax, wage, and benefit liabilities; unanticipated (and perhaps underinsured) tort liability to third parties for injuries caused by contractors; significant fines and license revocation; as well as debarment from public contracting.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>FURTHER INFORMATION AND RELATED MATERIALS</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Download this Americas Policy on Engagement of Independent Contractors</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/L1_AMER_LL_Policies_Procedures/PnP_Legal/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B78266B9E-048A-472A-BFE6-659E412E1A1F%7D&amp;file=Independent%20Contractor%20Classification%20Tool%20%281.2020%29.docx&amp;action=default&amp;mobileredirect=true\" rel=\"nofollow\">Independent Contract Classification Tool</a></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This tool is utilized by People &amp; Culture to guide the Business through an analysis of the relevant engagement to determine whether independent contractor status is appropriate given the circumstances.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For questions on this policy or it's implementation please contact:</span></p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Legal</span></strong></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Chief Compliance&nbsp;&amp; Litigation Officer</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Associate Counsel, Compliance&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Legal Counsel, Compliance&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">People &amp; Culture Americas</span></strong></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">People &amp; Culture, Director of Compliance</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Tax, Americas</span></strong></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Head of Tax</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For compliance contacts please see the&nbsp;<a href=\"https://pulse.lendlease.com/policies/key-contacts\" rel=\"nofollow\">Key Contacts</a>&nbsp;page - Compliance</span></p>","sys_created_by":"hinw325","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"x_caukp_ebonding_integration_mode":null,"can_read_user_criteria":"","active":"true","cannot_read_user_criteria":"","published":"2021-05-06","helpful_count":"0","sys_domain_path":"/","u_view_count_all":"30","version":{"display_value":"2.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_version/e562d5441b803010ef4543b4bd4bcb49"},"x_caukp_ebonding_requester_id":"","meta_description":"Americas Legal & Compliance Approver's name and title: Michael G. with different experiences and needs, at various stages of life. To support this, we provide a wide range of benefits from which employees can choose.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">From our employee Binti Mohd Razali","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/b8d1a1cc47716510fa3d6da7a46d436d"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"6","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"AUST","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/31b8378f1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcbd0"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2024-02-29 00:08:20","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018790","sys_updated_by":"raiv416","sys_created_on":"2021-05-07 01:51:01","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Group or Regional Legal and Company Secretarial</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Purpose</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">This Group Code of Conduct Breach Reporting Procedure provides a mechanism for raising concerns about unethical or illegal business conduct, including behaviour which may not accord with our Core Values or Code of Conduct, and offers certain protections to anyone who reports concerns in good faith under this Group Procedure.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Instructions</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Procedures for making a disclosure under this Group Policy</span></p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1. Business Conduct Officers</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease has established Business Conduct Officers&nbsp;to serve as the primary points of contact for the disclosure of unethical or illegal conduct.&nbsp; Group officers, employees and contractors may raise concerns by contacting the Business Conduct Officer in their region or, if preferred, the Group Business Conduct Officer.</span></p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2. Employee Conduct Hotline</span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Lendlease Employee Conduct Hotline is a secure and independent channel for you to raise genuine concerns, seek further assistance and report potential employee conduct breaches that you have felt uncomfortable in raising or resolving through the other channels available to you. It is hosted by EthicsPoint, an external organisation that helps companies foster a culture of integrity and compliance.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Lendlease Employee Conduct Hotline offers:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Confidential reporting and the choice to remain anonymous</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Telephone and web-based reporting options in over 180 languages</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">24-hour access, seven days a week</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Ability to follow up on your concern, even if you choose to remain anonymous</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">It is important to note that the information you submit will be treated confidentially. Following each call or web contact, the hotline operator will forward a report to the appropriate Business Conduct Officer within Lendlease for review and handling. Your report is given a report key so that you can check back to receive a response or provide more information.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Disclosures may be anonymous</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The individual making the disclosure may choose whether or not to make the disclosure anonymously.&nbsp; It may not be possible to investigate the disclosure as thoroughly if it is made anonymously than where the individual gives their details.&nbsp; In addition, in some countries the individual may need to reveal their identity before making the disclosure to qualify for protection under protected disclosure laws.&nbsp; Further information on local laws can be obtained from the Business Conduct Officer in the relevant region.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Flowchart of procedures for making a disclosure under this Group Policy</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=1350ead81b48b010ef4543b4bd4bcb7a\" alt=\"\" width=\"500px\" height=\"268px\" /></span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Investigation of disclosures</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The action taken to investigate disclosures under this procedure will necessarily depend on the particular circumstances.&nbsp; Where the individual has provided their contact details, they will be informed in general terms of the status of the disclosure and the final outcome of any investigation, unless privacy, confidentiality or other legal constraints limit the feedback that can be provided.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Generally, disclosures made under the Policy will be treated confidentially, and in some countries the law requires that a disclosure remains confidential unless the individual making the disclosure gives their consent to the disclosure being revealed.&nbsp; For this reason, you may be asked for such consent if you make a disclosure in order to facilitate the investigation process and to enable Lendlease to reach a satisfactory outcome.&nbsp; For example, to investigate the disclosure it may be necessary to reveal its substance to people such as other Lendlease personnel, external consultants involved in the investigation process and, in appropriate circumstances, law enforcement agencies.&nbsp; At some point in time, it may also be necessary to disclose the fact and substance of the disclosure to the person who is the subject of the disclosure.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an individual&rsquo;s identity is disclosed during the investigation process, the individual will not be disadvantaged in their employment by any Group company.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Reprisal action will not be tolerated</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease will not tolerate the taking of detrimental action against individuals who make a disclosure under this procedure in reprisal for making the disclosure.&nbsp; Any officer or employee who takes or threatens to take detrimental action in reprisal will be subject to disciplinary action, which may include dismissal.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Further, under some countries&rsquo; laws, the taking of detrimental action in reprisal for making a disclosure may be an offence and/or may give the individual who has made the disclosure the right to seek compensation.&nbsp; Further information on the laws that apply in a particular country is available from the relevant Business Conduct Officer.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If an individual believes that they have been, or are likely to be, disadvantaged in any way by another officer or employee or a Group company because they have made a disclosure, they should contact their manager or the Business Conduct Officer in their region.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Fairness to persons against whom disclosures are made</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease recognises that individuals against whom disclosures are made are entitled to be treated fairly.&nbsp; Disciplinary action may be taken against employees found to have made disclosures containing malicious or unfounded allegations.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Anyone who makes a disclosure under this Group Policy, but is later found to have been actively involved in the wrongdoing, will be subject to the same investigation process, including any disciplinary or criminal proceedings.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Further information</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://pulse.lendlease.com/-/media/intranet/pulse/documents/aboutus/policies/group-standards-and-guidelines/employee-conduct-guide-july-2016-v2.1-pdf.pdf?la=en&amp;hash=9868743C37B2F39F81F27F214C9B5E4869F0EEE2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Employee Conduct Guide</a>.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Group Policy&nbsp;<a href=\"https://pulse.lendlease.com/-/media/intranet/pulse/documents/aboutus/policies/5-reputation/final-group-policy-conduct-breach-reporting-2019-pdf.pdf?la=en&amp;hash=AE97729B25DD92469E806984A9AB3879389747AE\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Conduct Breach Reporting</a></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Business Conduct Officers details can be found under&nbsp;<a href=\"https://pulse.lendlease.com/policies/key-contacts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Key Contacts</a></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://secure.ethicspoint.com/domain/media/en/gui/28300/index.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Employee Conduct Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">At Lendlease we believe that flexibility is the key to a good work life balance. This is why we offer eligible employees the option to purchase additional leave, if this suits their circumstances.&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can purchase additional leave through two methods at certain times during the year:&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- using any potential annual bonus awarded to you through the compensation review bonus (option available in June); and/or&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- using salary sacrifice from TPV.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent and fixed term employees of Lendlease are eligible to purchase additional leave, subject to policy conditions.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Where employees are employed under the terms and conditions of an operative enterprise agreement with a Lendlease group company, please refer to the relevant enterprise agreement as to whether or not this policy applies to you.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply for additional leave using salary sacrifice?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; Hinks","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/6a5918de13801a00d774fc04e144b08d"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"6","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"AMER","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/b837f34b1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcbda"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2024-02-29 19:25:05","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A secondment is when a business unit or project has a temporary need for resource support which can be met by moving an employee from their current role for a defined period of time. It is anticipated at the end of the secondment employees will return to the role they left. A secondment can be a valuable way for our people to gain experience and develop skills and knowledge across our business.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Secondments may emerge from a number of situations:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- You may be asked to join a team or project because of your specific skills or experience.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- A manager or project leader may consult with People &amp; Culture and/or their peers about a particular short-term resourcing need.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- You may discuss your interest in a secondment with your manager as a way of further developing your skills and experience. &nbsp;Your manager may be able to assist in finding secondment opportunities to facilitate this development request.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">There are no specific eligibility requirements to apply for or to take up a secondment opportunity. Before applying for any opportunity you should discuss your application with your manager. You should be clear about what your objectives are when submitting your application and also what business rationale your application supports.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the different types of secondments?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An&nbsp;internal secondment&nbsp;is where an employee moves temporarily to a different Lendlease business unit or project. Employees remain in their home country but may move office locations. If an employee is required to move locations within country, it may be considered as a &lsquo;temporary relocation&rsquo;.&nbsp; The type and level of support available varies depending on location. For more information about support when temporarily moving locations please refer to your region&rsquo;s policy in the resources section below.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An&nbsp;external secondment&nbsp;is where an employee moves temporarily to an external organisation to work on a project or assignment. The employee remains employed by Lendlease and remains in their home country. For more information on external secondments please contact your local People &amp; Culture representative.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An&nbsp;international assignment&nbsp;is where an employee moves temporarily to a role or project in another country. The employee remains employed by Lendlease in their home country. For more information on international assignments please review the Global Mobility Framework and related policies.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I move forward?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PLAN</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Think about your personal objectives and business rationale for your move.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Discuss secondment opportunities with your manager in your regular one-on-one meetings.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review opportunities on Workday.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Australian employees should read&nbsp; the Secondment (Local Assignment) Policy.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PREPARE</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Discuss with your current manager and plan what would happen with your current responsibilities during your secondment.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Set out some specific objectives for the secondment with your current manager.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>ACT</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are interested in pursuing a specific secondment opportunity speak to your manager or People &amp; Culture representative.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Prepare for an appropriate handover of your current responsibilities.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>FINALISE</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Generally your terms and conditions of employment will remain unchanged during the secondment, but you will receive a letter outlining the nature and expected duration of the secondment, including details of your reporting relationships.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">During your secondment, you will report to a manager in the host business unit, and this business is responsible for paying your salary and other costs.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">At the completion of the secondment you will typically return to your original role and business unit.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Occasionally, secondments can become permanent and this typically occurs if the hosting manager requests this change, and all parties agree.&nbsp; In this case the terms and conditions of your employment will adjust to the new permanent role.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Paid Family Leave &ndash; for Non-Union Employees working in New York State&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Beginning January 1, 2018, the state of New York will offer Paid Family Leave (PFL) to eligible workers. The Hartford will administer this leave on behalf of Lendlease. Eligible employees can take up to ten weeks of PFL to:</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1.&nbsp;bond with a newly born, adopted or fostered child (within the first 12 months after the child&rsquo;s birth or placement);&nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2.&nbsp;care for a family member with a serious illness; or&nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">3.&nbsp;to care for or assist with family matters when a family member is deployed or has been called to active duty.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PFL is not available for an employee&rsquo;s own serious illness or qualifying military event.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Aetna will administer the PFL program and will make all determinations as to eligibility for PFL.&nbsp; All requests for PFL must be submitted through The Hartford.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees must work in the State of New York to be eligible. Full-time employees (&gt; 20 hours per week) must work 26 continuous weeks before becoming eligible for PFL, and part-time employees (&lt; 20 hours per week) must work 175 days within a 52-week period before becoming eligible for PFL.&nbsp; In 2020, an eligible employee is allowed up to a total of&nbsp;10 weeks of PFL within a 52-consecutive week period.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">There&rsquo;s no waiting period for PFL.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review eligibility requirements.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Read through the policy.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ACT</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Advise your manager of the leave you need (provide 30 days advance notice if the need for leave is foreseeable) and your anticipated return date. If the need for leave is not foreseeable, provide advance notice as soon as possible.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Apply for PFL and payment of PFL benefits.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Contact:</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Hartford online at&nbsp;<a href=\"https://abilityadvantage.thehartford.com/\">https://abilityadvantage.thehartford.com/</a>&nbsp;or through their mobile application</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Call their Customer Care Center at 888.301.5615</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">FINALISE</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">After filing PFL claim with The Hartford, you will receive a 'leave packet'. You may be required to return information to The Hartford for an approval and submit additional documentation demonstrating the need for PFL, so please review the packet carefully and return all required documentation in a timely manner.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size:
