Europe","u_last_review_date":"2025-04-22","x_caukp_ebonding_provider_id":"","roles":"","direct":"false","description":"","disable_suggesting":"false","sn_grc_target_table":"","sys_class_name":"Knowledge","article_id":"e91f28c71b33a0106d4e986cbc4bcb75","sys_id":"d44fc8711b09a610727c0e12604bcbc0","use_count":"0","flagged":"false","disable_commenting":"false","valid_to":"2026-04-22","retired":"","u_add_to_homepage":"false","u_video_url":"","display_attachments":"false","latest":"true","summary":{"display_value":"KB0019115","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_knowledge_summary/291f28c71b33a0106d4e986cbc4bcb77"},"sys_view_count":"19","revised_by":{"display_value":"Norhaniza Binti Mohd Razali","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/b8d1a1cc47716510fa3d6da7a46d436d"},"article_type":"HTML","u_needs_review":"false","sys_mod_count":"6","sn_grc_source":"","sys_tags":"","replacement_article":"","x_caukp_ebonding_provider":"","taxonomy_topic":"","view_as_allowed":"true","x_caukp_ebonding_requester":"","ownership_group":"","category":null,"kb_category":{"display_value":"EUR","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_category/fe37b3cb1b2bac102cbba8a8b04bcbbb"}},{"u_reminder_send_date":"","wiki":"","rating":"","source":"","sys_updated_on":"2024-02-29 00:08:23","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018727","sys_updated_by":"raiv416","sys_created_on":"2021-05-03 21:52:19","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Flexibility is important to Lendlease. It enables us to retain our people, which means continuity for our business and our clients.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For Lendlease, flexibility is about when and where people work. It is an essential part of creating an effective organization. There is significant evidence that flexibility helps people work smarter and optimize resources and productivity in a highly competitive business environment.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Flexible work arrangements are not an entitlement, so employees should not assume that if they ask for flexibility they will automatically get it. These work arrangements need to be mutually beneficial to the business and the employee. After due consideration, managers may turn down requests for a flexible work arrangement if business needs cannot be met.</span><br /></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All Lendlease active, salaried employees scheduled to work 30 or more hours per week are eligible to apply for flexible work arrangements.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I submit a request for flexible working?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review the eligibity criteria</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Read through the documents available under the Resources section of this page&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Work through Step 1 of the Implementation Approach document and make an initial consideration of the type of flexible work arrangement you intend to propose to your manager.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Fill out the Flexible Work Arrangement Conversation Guide and submit it to your manager.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ACT&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Discuss your interests and proposal for a flexible work arrangement with your manager; this stage of the process may take some time while you and your manager discuss and agree on the proposed flexible work arrangement.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">At the end of the discussions, if you and your manager have agreed and are satisfied with the terms, your manager may approve the flexible work arrangement.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">FINALISE</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once the flexible work arrangement has been agreed, sign and retain a copy of the Flexible Work Arrangement Conversation Guide. This will serve as a helpful reference to key aspects of the agreed arrangement.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What are some examples of flexible work?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">There are a range of creative and practical ways to change when and where work is done. Some of the more traditional forms of flexible work arrangements include:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>When people work<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Flexible start/finish times. Flexible start finish times allow for employees and managers to negotiate start and finish times that work for all parties.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Reconfiguring workweek.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Part-time work. Generally speaking, working fewer than the standard weekly hours. Note: Benefits eligibility will be impacted if scheduled less than 30 hours weekly.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>When people work<br /><br /></strong> &bull; Working remotely. Also called teleworking, this means working away from the main office or site (i.e. at home) either full or part-time, and on a regular or intermittent basis.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; May be appropriate only during specific phases of a project.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Ensure you check the project contract for potential issues.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Applicable examples include:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Project site:<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Ida Crown Jewish Academy in Skokie, IL - Team coordinated flexible start and finish times to accommodate rush hour and travel distances, while still allowing full coverage on site</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; - Superintendent starts at 6:00am and is generally the first person to leave the site</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; - Senior Project Manager starts between 6:30am/7:00am and is generally the next person to leave the site after the Superintendent</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; - Project Manager starts at 7:00am and is generally the last person to leave the site</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Lumina in San Francisco, CA</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; - Mix of Project Managers, Control Staff and Field Superintendents take every fourth Friday afternoon off</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Office-based:<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Office-based people manager in PM&amp;C works from home on regular basis, with schedule driven by calendar&nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Development Manager leaves at 2:30pm on Mondays and makes up the time by working in the evenings&nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull; Administrative Assistant starts at 6:30am and finishes at 3:30pm</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; 00:08:25","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018815","sys_updated_by":"raiv416","sys_created_on":"2021-05-05 22:44:15","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Americas People &amp; Culture</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The company recognizes national holidays.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All Lendlease salaried employees in US.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For purposes of paid holidays, the Company recognizes the following days as paid time off:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">New Year's Day</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Martin Luther King Day</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">President's Day&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Memorial Day&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Independence Day&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Labor Day</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Veteran's Day</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Thanksgiving Day and the day after Thanksgiving (two days)&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Christmas Day</span><br /></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Any of the above holidays that fall on Saturday will be observed on Friday. Holidays falling on a Sunday will be observed on Monday. If Christmas falls on a Tuesday or a Thursday, you'll receive an additional paid day off - the Monday before or the Friday after the holiday.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Holidays that fall during an employee's vacation period will not be counted against vacation time.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Whenever an employee is required to work on an observed holiday, equivalent time off will be provided on a day approved by the company.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Supervisors are responsible for coordinating and approving holidays among their personnel and with other related departments.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In order to receive holiday pay, an employee must either work or use a PTO day on the last business day before and on the first business day after a holiday. If an employee is on an FMLA leave and is using his or her accrued PTO on the last business day before and on the first business day after the holiday during the FMLA leave period in which the holiday falls, the employee will receive holiday pay for the holiday. If an employee is on an unpaid FMLA leave during the period on which the holiday falls, then the employee will not be paid for the holiday that occurs during the leave.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee will receive payment of short-term disability (\"STD\") benefits during his or her leave period, including on the holiday that occurs during the leave period, pursuant to the terms and conditions of the Company's short-term disability program.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Holidays &mdash; Less than 40-Hour Work Week or Non-traditional Work Weeks &nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">An employee's reduced work schedule may or may not require the employee to work every week day. Therefore, an employee is paid for a holiday based on the number of hours the employee was scheduled to work on the day the holiday occurs. For example:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employee A &mdash; is scheduled to work Monday through Thursday for eight hours each day. When a holiday falls on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday or Thursday, this employee is eligible for eight hours of holiday pay. When a holiday falls on Friday, this employee receives no paid time off for that holiday.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employee B &mdash; is scheduled to work six hours a day, Monday through Friday. This employee would be eligible for six hours of holiday pay for any holiday.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employee C &mdash; is scheduled to work four hours a day, Monday through Friday. This employee would not be eligible for any holiday pay because an employee must be scheduled to work at least 30 hours a week to be eligible for holiday pay.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">* Paid Time Off taken in observance of a company holiday (as outlined in the Holiday Policy) should be recorded on the employees bi-weekly timesheet on the appropriate line marked as &ldquo;Holiday&rdquo;.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0019134\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Americas Holiday Schedule\">Americas Holiday Schedule</a></span></p>","sys_created_by":"hinw325","scheduled_publish_date":"","image":"","u_kbi_uniqueid":"","cmdb_ci":"","author":{"display_value":"Lizzy Wong","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user/3ff81f981ba0e110ef4543b4bd4bcb57"},"x_caukp_ebonding_integration_mode":null,"can_read_user_criteria":"","active":"true","cannot_read_user_criteria":"","published":"2021-05-06","helpful_count":"0","sys_domain_path":"/","u_view_count_all":"1,183","version":{"display_value":"2.0","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/kb_version/a2a215841b803010ef4543b4bd4bcbd1"},"x_caukp_ebonding_requester_id":"","meta_description":"Americas People & Culture PURPOSE The company recognizes national holidays. 03:12:31","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are required by the Company to live away from home for a period of time at locations sufficiently distant from your home to make daily travel impracticable for a period of three (3) months or more, you may be provided with a subsistence allowance.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Subsistence Allowance is an annual amount set in line with the CIJC Working Rule Agreement Rate Guidance. It will be paid in twelve (12) equal monthly instalments.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Full-time or part-time UK employee required by the company to live away from home for a period of three (3) months or more.&nbsp; As a guideline a subsistence allowance should be applied where journeys to work are over 70 miles each way, and/or where commuting times are over 90 minutes each way.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Employees&nbsp;must confirm that they are maintaining an address away from their permanent home and have a continuing financial liability for the maintenance of their permanent home.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I claim the allowance?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review the eligibility criteria and read the Subsistence Allowance Policy.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ACT&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; font-size: 12pt;\">Complete the Subsistence Allowance form.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All Subsistence forms need approval from the Business Unit Managing Director.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Submit the form along with the supporting documents to your people manager.&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Return the approved documentation as directed in the form.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; and / or&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull;&nbsp;If your work place of the employee changes; and / or&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How will I be impacted under a company audit?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Company will perform an annual audit of Subsistence Allowances being provided. So if you have received a Subsistence Allowance, make sure to retain receipts to back your subsistence claims.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you are selected for scrutiny under the Annual Audit you will be informed shortly in advance of the Audit period and will be required to provide receipts or copies of bills for your rental, utility, council tax or other accommodation costs or items related to your Subsistence Allowance claim.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; 22:49:49","x_caukp_ebonding_sdc":"","number":"KB0018733","sys_updated_by":"kohj323","sys_created_on":"2025-02-04 21:57:11","sys_domain":{"display_value":"global","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sys_user_group/global"},"x_caukp_ebonding_no_return":"false","u_select_portal":{"display_value":"IT Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As part of our focus on employee health and wellbeing, Lendlease has secured medical insurance at corporate rates for our employees. The following plans are available through United Healthcare for Mainland employees.&nbsp;</span><br><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>United Healthcare Savings Account Plan (HSA)<br></strong> </span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The <strong>United Healthcare Choice Plus Health Savings Account (HSA) Option </strong>combines a consumer driven health plan (&ldquo;<strong>CDHP</strong>&rdquo;) with a health savings account (&ldquo;<strong>HSA</strong>&rdquo;). If you enrol in this option, you may open an HSA and make contributions to your HSA that may be used to pay for qualified out-of-pocket medical expenses. The Company will also make a Company Contribution to your HSA on your behalf, provided you open an HSA bank account. The Lendlease funded amounts are $520 for individuals; $1040 for families. Your HSA belongs to you and you may use the account to save for your eligible health expenses (refer to IRS Publication 969), including health expenses that may arise after you retire.&nbsp; If you do not use the amounts in your HSA, the account balance may continue to grow with your contributions (and earnings or losses from investments). The Deductibles for the <strong>United Healthcare Choice Plus HSA Option </strong>are higher than the Deductibles for the <strong>United Healthcare Choice Plus Option</strong>, but your HSA may be used for those out-of- pocket expenses needed to meet the Deductibles.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>United Healthcare Choice Plus Plan<br></strong> </span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The United Healthcare Choice Plus Option offers health coverage for more premium contributions than the United Healthcare Choice Plus HSA Option, but the Deductibles for in-network and out-of-network providers are lower.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Review your medical plan options including premiums, deductibles, and co-payments to make your choice on healthcare options. The HSA typically has lower premiums, but a higher deductible. Preventive care is not subject to a deductible.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Click <a href=\"https://lendlease.sharepoint.com/:b:/r/sites/Pulse_People_Culture/Shared%20Documents/UHC%20Plan%20Comparison.pdf?csf=1&amp;web=1&amp;e=NfHOUF\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a> to review the United Healthcare (UHC) Medical Plan Comparison document for more detailed information.</span></p>\r\n<p><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>United Healthcare Out-Of-Area Preferred Provider Organisation (PPO) Plan<br></strong> </span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The United Healthcare PPO Option is available for employees living outside the United Healthcare network.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The San Francisco Choice Option is available for certain employees working on contracts involving the City or County of San Francisco who are covered by the San Francisco Health Care Accountability Ordinance (&ldquo;Eligible HCOA Employees&rdquo;).&nbsp; The San Francisco Choice Option provides Eligible HCOA Employees with the opportunity to obtain employee-only medical coverage at no premium cost.&nbsp; However, employees who wish to cover their spouse or dependents will be responsible for 100% of the cost of the spouse or dependents&rsquo; premium.&nbsp; This Option is available only to Eligible HCOA Employees.</span></p>\r\n<p><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Express Scripts Prescription Drug Plan<br></strong> </span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Express Scripts is the administrator of our prescription drug benefit. The benefit&nbsp;provides comprehensive prescription drug coverage for name brand and generic medications through participating pharmacies, including mail order discounts for maintenance medications. The Prescription Drug Benefit Program is only available if you elect the Medical Benefit Program.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><u>Eligibility </u></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Full -time salaried or hourly employee (non-union) regularly scheduled to work at least 30 hours per week. Salaried employees are eligible to participate in the Benefit Programs on their date of hire. Hourly employees are eligible to participate in the Benefits Programs the first day of the month following or coincident with completion of two months of continuous employment (at least 260 hours) from their most recent hire date (but no later than the 91<sup>st</sup> day after their most recent hire date).</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><u>How do I enrol</u></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">As a new hire, you have 31 days from your start date to elect healthcare benefits. New employees should go to the Benefits Center (<a href=\"http://www.Lendlease.hrintouch.com\">www.Lendlease.hrintouch.com</a>) to complete all benefit enrolments with the exception of the 401(K) plan. Per the Plan provisions, if you do not make an affirmative election to enrol in, or decline healthcare coverage (i.e., fail to enrol) within 31 days from your start date, you will be deemed to have elected to waive coverage under all Plans, except the Plan&rsquo;s default benefits.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">When enrolling an eligible dependent, such as a spouse/domestic partner or child(ren), certain documentation will be required for verification, such as a birth certificate, marriage certificate.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you miss the 31-day election window, you will be able to enrol during the Open Enrolment period in November for benefits to be effective January 1 of the following year.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you have a qualifying event, such as a marriage, divorce, birth of a child, loss of other coverage, etc. you will be able to change your benefit elections mid-year by going to the Benefits Center within 31 days following the life event.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><u>How do I use the United Healthcare medical benefit?</u></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Go to <a href=\"http://www.myuhc.com\">www.myuhc.com</a> and register. To review Finding Care &amp; Cost, Claims &amp; Accounts, Coverage &amp; Benefits and Health Resources, register at <a href=\"http://www.myuhc.com\">www.myuhc.com</a> website. If you need assistance, please call United Healthcare (UHC) at 800 645 9402.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you need to see a provider before you get your United Healthcare (UHC) identification card, provide your physician&rsquo;s office with your Social Security Number and the Lendlease group# 228599.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can also download the UHC mobile app, UnitedHealthcare, to check claims and find urgent care.</span></p>\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><u>How do I use the Express Scripts prescription benefit?</u></span></strong></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Present your Express Scripts member identification card to a retail pharmacy when picking up your prescription. &nbsp;You will be required to fill your maintenance prescriptions for 90-days, in one of three ways: 1) through Express Scripts Mail Order; 2) at a Walgreens; 3) at a CVS pharmacy. </span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you purchase your maintenance medications elsewhere, after the first two courtesy fills, you will be required to pay additional fees for your retail maintenance drugs. A new prescription may be necessary for the first fill of a 90-day supply.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If you need a prescription filled before you get your prescription identification card, provide your pharmacist with your Social Security Number, the Lendlease group number LLEASE1 and Lendlease BIN# 610014</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To review your current prescription claims and manage your mail order pharmacy items, register at the Express Scripts member website. If you need assistance, please call Express Scripts at 866 563 9289.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong><u>Who Can I Contact About Benefits?</u></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For United Healthcare medical questions including requesting a new or printing a temporary ID card contact at 800 645 9402.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For United Healthcare Savings (HSA) Bank Account contact Optum Bank at 800 791 9361 Option 1.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For claims assistance and locating providers, call Health Advocate at 866 695 8622.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For General benefits inquiries contact People Connect at 866 848 1200 Option 2.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For Enrollment and eligibility questions contact the <a href=\"http://lendlease.hrintouch.com/\">Benefits Center</a> 844 549 6210.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"color: #008080;\"><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease employees have the opportunity to salary sacrifice for a range of benefits. By choosing to salary sacrifice, an employee forgoes a portion of their total remuneration (TPV minus superannuation guarantee contributions) in lieu of a benefit item offered, to an equivalent value from their pre-tax pay. This in turn will reduce an employee&rsquo;s taxable salary and therefore may have the effect of lowering an employee&rsquo;s marginal rate of tax on their salary.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Some of the benefit items available to salary sacrifice include:</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&bull;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018776\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Superannuation\">Superannuation<br /></a> &bull;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018785\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Employee Share Acquisition Plan\">Employee Share Acquisition Plan<br /></a> &bull;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0019025\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Purchased Leave\">Purchased Leave<br /></a> &bull;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018786\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Motor Vehicles\">Motor Vehicles<br /></a> &bull;&nbsp;<a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0018787\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Parking\">Parking<br /></a> &bull;&nbsp;Other variable packaged items (see below)</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Click on the benefits above to find out further information on how to salary package these items. To salary sacrifice Superannuation, ESAP or purchase additional leave, please use the benefits worklet in Workday and select Salary Sacrifice. Wages employees please complete the below salary sacrifice form and send through to payroll.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">In addition to the benefits above, there are a number of variable packaged items covered through the salary packaging options at Lendlease.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What variable packaged items are available to salary package?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Taxi / Rideshare Travel (to and from work)</strong>&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Taxi / rideshare travel to and from the office on days you are working (including weekends when you work) is exempt from fringe benefits tax (FBT).</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">To be eligible for the exemption and for reimbursement via salary sacrifice, the journey must be a single trip, and either begin or end at your place of work. It is not necessary that the trip begin or end at your home; nor is it necessary that the trip occur immediately before or after work.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Airline lounge membership</strong>&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">View the personal Qantas Club membership page in the resources section below to find out more information on memberships at discounted corporate rates.&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>iPads/tablet</strong>&nbsp;</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can salary package a tablet or iPad if it is to be used primarily for business purposes (more than 51%), and only if Lendlease does not already supply you with one. &nbsp;Please note that no accessories can be included.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Briefcases &nbsp;<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">A briefcase to be used primarily for business purposes can be salary packaged. A briefcase is a flat, rectangular case of leather or other material used for carrying documents, books, manuscripts and does not include modern bags such as satchel bags, wheeled business cases, backpacks, shoulder bags, laptop bags, etc.</span><br /><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I salary package a variable packaged item?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Confirm the item is eligible for salary packaging by referring to the policy or, if required, asking People Connect.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ACT&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For Superannuation, ESAP or Purchased leave submit via the benefits worklet in Workday.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">You can change your salary sacrifice contributions to your superannuation in Workday at anytime, but your numbers should always be submitted as a full annual amount.&nbsp; Simply go to the benefits worklet from the home screen, click on benefits under change, select salary sacrifice and choose the first day of the current month as the Benefits Event Date and then submit.&nbsp; Click on open and you will be taken to the screen that summarises your elected benefits. Select the type of salary sacrifice by clicking elect and simply change the annual amount and click continue to complete.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Keep in mind the number should always be an annual amount. For example, if you would like to salary sacrifice $20,000 over the next three months you need to multiply the monthly contribution you would like to make by 12, as the Workday system only accepts an annual amount - so would would enter $80,000, because: (20,000/3)*12 = 80,000.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Please remember that the deductions roll over from one month to another so if you would like to reduce your salary sacrifice at the end of a period you will need to go back into Workday and adjust the amount. If you would like to cease salary sacrificing contributions to your superannuation you will need to select 'waive' in Workday, this will update the annual amount field to zero.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For all other items purchase the item using your own funds and retain the receipt.</span></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; color: black;\">Complete a Salary Packaging Work-Related Items Declaration Form and upload to Concur with your expense claim. Ensure that you attach a copy of the tax invoice/s.</span></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;\">&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p style=\"margin: 0cm; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Use the codes listed in the claimable items section to show that the purchase is to be debited to your salary package.&nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The full amount claimed will be credited to your bank account but your salary package will only be charged the amount minus any input credit.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>FINALISE</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Please note you are limited to one claim within each variable packaging item category (taxis travel excluded) in each Fringe Benefit Taxation year (1 April to 31 March)&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Resources</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto; height: 921.2px;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 75.6px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60pt; background-color: #ffffff; Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Americas People &amp; Culture</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PURPOSE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Allows Employees to take an unpaid leave between projects with no impact to Benefits.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>SCOPE<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">All Lendlease Employees in US.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>POLICY<br /></strong> </span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Unpaid Standby Leave of Absence (USLOA) must be approved by the Business Unit Leader and is for those employees waiting for the next project to start.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>REQUIREMENTS</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">1.&nbsp;Upon approval, one&nbsp;Unpaid Standby Leave during any 12 month period. Minimum one week at a time.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2. Employee must exhaust all available PTO prior to the commencement of the USLOA.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The employee can continue all benefits&nbsp;and is required to remit any employee paid premiums normally deducted from their paycheck to the Lendlease Benefits Department in Charlotte, North Carolina. The Lendlease Benefits Department will send an&nbsp;invoice to the employee with appropriate amounts and due dates.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">If the employee does not return to work at the end of the leave, life insurance ends the last day of leave; health benefits end the last day of the month that standby leave ends.</span><br /><br /><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Example of an USLOA:</span></strong><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">From 5/16/15 through 7/16/16</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">* Last Day Worked is 5/13/16</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Effective first day of Leave is 5/16/16</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">* Last day of PTO in the event you are exhausting your PTO in order to take an Unpaid Standby Leave.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Holidays are not paid during an Unpaid Standby Leave Of Absence.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>REFERENCE<br /></strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><a href=\"https://lendlease.service-now.com/lendlease?id=kb_article_view&amp;sysparm_article=KB0019000\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\" title=\"Unpaid Standby Leave of Absence process\">Unpaid Standby Leave of Absence process<br /></a> </span><br /><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Support Contact Information</span></strong><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; #000000;\">have to</span><span style=\"color: #000000;\"> demonstrate both.&nbsp; A great leader will provide strong direction when needed, and at other times give freedom to test, adapt and Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=6fa859771b7ba010ef4543b4bd4bcb1a\" alt=\"\" width=\"601px\" height=\"257px\" /></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Global Graduate Program supports the personal and professional development of newly employed Lendlease Graduates.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Our goal is to build capability for future growth across our global regions. Our program supports this goal with an aim to transition a university graduate to a Lendlease Graduate who has foundational skills, knowledge and tools to navigate real world situations and adapt to future needs quickly.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The two-year early-career talent program is built around rotational experiences that enable graduates to practically apply their learnings and enhances their knowledge and skills within our industry. Technical job-family learning is embedded into on-the-job development specific to the program stream and graduates are expertly coached to develop a development pathway that is individually tailored to them. Over two years the Lendlease Global Graduate Program will kick start a graduate&rsquo;s career and support the transition from university to the workplace.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">2017 marked the first year that we launched the Global Graduate Program. We have specifically taken a global approach, so that we create a consistent experience for all our graduates, no matter where in the world you are or which program stream a graduate is part of. Graduates will develop the foundational skills, knowledge and tools to navigate the workplace, enabling them to adapt to the challenges and opportunities that are ahead.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The objectives of the program include:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Embedding Lendlease methodology&nbsp;and capabilities early</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Enhancing our innovation agenda</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Driving employee engagement early</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Ensuring foundation skills are developed</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Ensuring a long term talent supply for Lendlease</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Annually each Region (Asia, Australia, Europe and US) will run a Graduate Program that is aligned to a Global Framework built around:</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Job Rotations</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Learning Program</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Networking Opportunities</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Support Structures.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>For more information on how to apply in your region please click the relevant link below:</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto; border-collapse: collapse; border: 1.5pt solid #DDDDDD;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease continues to build more projects in places around the world. While we are building better futures for others, we are also building better futures for ourselves by offering great career opportunities.&nbsp;</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Global Mobility Framework (GMF) governs the way Lendlease supports its employees when they move across borders for extended periods of work. This can include relocations to anywhere Lendlease operates, a neighbouring country, or to the other side of the world.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The GMF and associated policies have been developed for use across the Group. &nbsp;They provide direction and guidance for managers, employees and People &amp; Culture professionals to structure international assignments and transfers appropriately.&nbsp; Any exceptions to the policies require sign off by authorised representatives in regional and/or global roles.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The GMF ensures mobility for our employees at Lendlease is:&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n<ul style=\"list-style-position: inside;\">\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Fair, equitable, transparent and competitive in the marketplace;&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Provides resourcing solutions whilst enabling talent development in growth markets;&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Perceived as a positive career differentiator and not a career risk;&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Governed by policies and processes which are cost effective, benchmarked and implemented consistently; and,&nbsp;</span></li>\r\n<li><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Not an opportunity to achieve personal financial advantage.</span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">The Global Mobility Business Decision Tree uses a series of questions to assess which policy is most appropriate to the circumstances. It should be used by employees, line managers and Strategic Business Partners. &nbsp;For full details of the assignment provisions please refer to the individual policy documents.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Underpinning the framework are four policies which define the support provided to employees in different circumstances.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Global Policies</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 60.0pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: center; border-right: 1.5pt solid #FFFFFF; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt 6.75pt 7.5pt;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=285327c01b3496544d4c0fa2cd4bcb54\" alt=\"Stationery_Paper_BLK_PNG png\" width=\"48px\" height=\"59px\" /></span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Marriage leave is granted to eligible employees for the celebration of your marriage.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>What are the eligibility requirements?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Full-time permanent, full-time fixed-term contract and part-time employees employed on local terms, who have completed three months service (for Singapore) or 90 calendar days (for Malaysia) and meet the following criteria, are eligible for Marriage Leave.</span><br /><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- This must be your first legal marriage.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- Proposed leave must be within six (6) months of the marriage solemnisation or customary wedding ceremony.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- You must have been an employee of Lendlease on the solemnisation date.</span><br /><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- You are not serving your notice.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>How do I apply?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>PLAN</strong>&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; location.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; Portal","link":"https://lendlease.service-now.com/api/now/table/sp_portal/22553273132a8490dffa30ded144b0f7"},"workflow_state":"Published","text":"<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Lendlease has a number of programs in place to support employees in relation to travelling to and from work.&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Non Work Related Taxi Travel</strong>&nbsp;</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Eligible employees have the ability to salary package the cost of personal taxi travel that begins or ends at your primary workplace.&nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Local Travel Expenses<br></strong> Employees can make certain claims/ reimbursements when local travel expenses are incurred as a result of performing work related duties.</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">For general business travel, the procurement microsite provides information on FCM Travel solutions, Avis care hire and Qantas Club membership. The Lendlease travel policies are also located on the site.</span></p>\r\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>Who is eligible to salary sacrifice non-work related taxi travel?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Permanent full-time, permanent part-time and fixed-term employees may be eligible&nbsp;for travel and expense benefits.</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Individuals employed under the terms and conditions of an operative enterprise agreement with a Lendlease group company, should refer to the relevant enterprise agreement to determine if this policy applies to you.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I salary sacrifice non-work related taxi travel?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Read the Non-work related taxi travel policy.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Pay for the taxi travel to or from work, using your own finances. Ensure you obtain a receipt.&nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ACT&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Submit a fringe benefits claim through iExpenses, attaching the&nbsp;receipt&nbsp;which includes the suppliers ABN number. To find out more information on&nbsp;iExpenses visit the eFinance page link located in the resources section below. &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">FINALISE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Once the claim has been processed, payroll will then deduct the GST- exclusive cost of the taxi travel expense. &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n</tbody>\r\n</table>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Please note:&nbsp;if the employee does not have a receipt, or the journey does not begin or end at the employee's primary workplace, they will be unable to claim the cost as a tax benefit.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>What local travel expenses are included in the policy?</strong></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Local travel expenses can include any of the following:</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- public transport</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- taxis</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- personal vehicle</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- road tolls and incidental parking</span><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">- fuel (company vehicles/car hire)</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt; color: #008080;\"><strong>How do I claim travel expenses?</strong></span></p>\r\n<table style=\"width: auto;\">\r\n<tbody>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PLAN&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Read the travel and expenses policy. &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">PREPARE&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Pay for the cost of work-related travel expenses by cash or corporate American express card (public transport/ taxi/ road tolls and incidental parking/ fuel (hire vehicles and genuine site vehicles only))&nbsp;.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><strong><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ACT&nbsp;</span></strong></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: auto; background-color: #ffffff; border-right: 1.5pt solid #5c5858; padding: 6.75pt 7.5pt; border-top-style: solid; border-bottom-style: solid; border-left-style: solid; border-top-color: #5c5858; border-bottom-color: #5c5858; border-left-color: #5c5858;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Public transport/ taxi/ road tolls and incidental parking/ fuel - Submit a claim through&nbsp;iExpenses, providing proof of the work-related travel e.g. description/ reason for the journey. &nbsp;</span><br><br><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Personal vehicle mileage claim - Obtain your manager's/ department head's approval and email your completed&nbsp;mileage claim form to payroll. &nbsp;</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr are changing minor details of an employee&rsquo;s role. Details that may be changed without a new position include Change in </span><span style=\"color: #3e3f2c;\">Hours, Fixed</span><span style=\"color: #3e3f2c;\">-term contract extension</span> <span style=\"color: #3e3f2c;\">and Change in location.</span></strong></span></p>\r\n<p class=\"body_Text\" style=\"margin-left: 7.1pt; margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">a. Search for the employee you wish to Job Change in the search bar</span></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Or</span></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;\">Find the employee in My Team Management</span></p>\r\n<p style=\"margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt; margin-top: 5.9pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">b. The Worker name and Job should default to the employee you are entering the Job Change for</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">b. Select <strong>Location and/or Hours Change or Move to a new manager.</strong></span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">c. For other changes including Secondments you will need to ensure a new position has been created for the employee to move in to.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Note</strong>: Please ensure you select the correct reason at this stage as this cannot be amended later.</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Click <img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=f23352ec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb10\" alt=\"\" width=\"75px\" height=\"25px\" />to continue</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Start Details</strong></span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">a. Confirm the effective date of the change</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">b. Update the location if required</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Note</strong>: If you have selected Location/Hours Change or Move to a new manager on the previous screen, the &ldquo;Why are you making this change&rdquo; field will default to Job Data Change on this screen.</span></p>\r\n<p><br /></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Click <img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=763352ec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb12\" alt=\"\" width=\"81px\" height=\"31px\" /> to continue</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 255.15pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=f63352ec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb14\" alt=\"\" width=\"325px\" height=\"189px\" /></span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><img src=\"/sys_attachment.do?sys_id=323352ec1b4cf010b03a9829bc4bcb23\" alt=\"\" width=\"142px\" height=\"101px\" /></span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n</tr>\r\n<tr style=\"height: 19px;\">\r\n<td style=\"width: 28.4pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">3.</span></p>\r\n</td>\r\n<td style=\"width: 226.55pt; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 9.9pt; padding-bottom: 9.9pt; border: 1.0pt solid #A6A6A6;\">\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Location screen</strong></span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">a. Click location to update the employee&rsquo;s work location</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">b. If you need to change your employee&rsquo;s working hours then change the Scheduled Working Hours to reflect the new hours.</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><br /></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">c. If you have changed the working hours you also need to select the new Work Shift to reflect the new arrangement (not applicable to AU Wages employees)</span></p>\r\n<p><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><strong>Note:</strong> Please be aware that for Salaried employees, a change in hours will impact compensation.</span></p>\r\n<p class=\"list_Paragraph\" style=\"margin-left: 36.0pt;\"><span style=\"font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;\">d.
